original: des na spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi shes pa 'bras bu tsam yin na yang nus pa med par rab tu bstan pas so //
analyzed: des na spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi shes pa 'bras bu tsam yin na yang nus pa med par rab tu bstan pas so //
translated: Thus, even if the cognition of the universal is merely an effect, it is taught that it is not a potentiality.

original: rdzas dang 'degs dang spyi dang ni //
analyzed: rdzas dang 'degs dang spyi dang ni //
translated: Substance, support, universal,üîΩnumber,

original: grangs sogs la ni /
analyzed: grangs sogs la ni /
translated: and so on.

original: sogs pa smos pas ni ldan pa dang rnam par phye ba la sogs pa dang / kun rdzob las 'byung ba dag bzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni ldan pa dang rnam par phye ba la sogs pa dang / kun rdzob las 'byung ba dag bzung ngo //
translated: By the word ‚Äúand so on,‚Äù conjunction, action, quality, and so on, and the conventional are included.

original: blo gang yin pa de bshad cing bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: blo gang yin pa de bshad cing bstan pa yin no //
translated: That is the cognition that is taught and explained.

original: dper na bum pa la sogs pa yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su byed pa mi rung ba'i phyir de de dag gi 'bras bu ma yin no //
analyzed: dper na bum pa la sogs pa yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su byed pa mi rung ba'i phyir de de dag gi 'bras bu ma yin no //
translated: For example, it is not the effect of those because it is not suitable to follow existence and nonexistence, like a pot and so on.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: brda rtsol ba la sogs pa dang / nang gi yan lag rjes su 'jug phyir ro //
analyzed: brda rtsol ba la sogs pa dang / nang gi yan lag rjes su 'jug phyir ro //
translated: Because of the effort of convention and so on, and because of the internal engagement.

original: brda la sogs pa brda yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: brda la sogs pa brda yid la byed pa'o //
translated: Convention and so on is the mental engagement of convention.

original: sogs pa smos pas ni rjes su mthun pa yid la byed pa bzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni rjes su mthun pa yid la byed pa bzung ngo //
translated: By the word ‚Äúand so on,‚Äù mental engagement in accordance with that is included.

original: nang gi yan lag ni nang ngo //
analyzed: nang gi yan lag ni nang ngo //
translated: Internal is internal.

original: rjes su 'jug pa ni rjes su byed pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su 'jug pa ni rjes su byed pa'o //
translated: Engagement is following.

original: brda rtsol dang de dang rjes su mthun pa'i brda 'dzin pa'i nang gi rgyu mtshan rnams yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: brda rtsol dang de dang rjes su mthun pa'i brda 'dzin pa'i nang gi rgyu mtshan rnams yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir /
translated: because the mind changes in accordance with the presence or absence of the effort to communicate and the internal causes that are consistent with that.

original: bum pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i blo dag 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i blo dag 'gyur gyi /
translated: The mind that conceives a pot and so on changes, but

original: phyi rol gyi bum pa la sogs pa'i rdzas las ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi bum pa la sogs pa'i rdzas las ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the external substance of a pot and so on does not.

original: phyi rol gyi lag pa 'degs pa la sogs pa mthong ba nyid las ni 'degs pa la sogs pa'i blo dag 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi lag pa 'degs pa la sogs pa mthong ba nyid las ni 'degs pa la sogs pa'i blo dag 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: But don‚Äôt the minds that apprehend lifting and so on change in accordance with seeing the external hand lifting and so on?

original: ji ltar na brda la rtsol ba la sogs pa dang / nang gi yan lag dang rjes su 'brel ba nyid kyi phyir zhes brjod ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar na brda la rtsol ba la sogs pa dang / nang gi yan lag dang rjes su 'brel ba nyid kyi phyir zhes brjod ce na /
translated: How can you say that the mind changes in accordance with the effort to communicate and the internal causes?

original: skyon de yod @126b pa ma yin te /
analyzed: skyon de yod @126b pa ma yin te /
translated: That fault does not exist because the mind that apprehends the hand lifting and so on does not apprehend the hand and so on as different from the body.

original: de la ni yul gzhan dag dang gzhan du 'byung ba'i chos can gyi gzugs la sogs pa 'dzin pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de la ni yul gzhan dag dang gzhan du 'byung ba'i chos can gyi gzugs la sogs pa 'dzin pa yin gyi /
translated: It apprehends form and so on that occurs in other places and other times.

original: 'degs pa la sogs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa nus pa ma mthong ba can las shes pa skye ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'degs pa la sogs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa nus pa ma mthong ba can las shes pa skye ba ni ma yin no //
translated: But consciousness does not arise from a cause that is not seen to be related to the effect by the relation of invariable concomitance, such as the cause and effect of lifting.

original: de bzhin du rnam par phye ba la sogs pa dag la yang ci rigs par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par phye ba la sogs pa dag la yang ci rigs par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, the relation of invariable concomitance should be applied to the other cases, such as the relation of the whole and the parts.

original: de bas na 'dir gzugs la sogs pa dang khyad par de 'dra ba'i yul can gyi mthong ba ni bzlog pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'dir gzugs la sogs pa dang khyad par de 'dra ba'i yul can gyi mthong ba ni bzlog pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, in this case, the perception of form, etc., and the subject that has such a specific object are not refuted.

original: 'degs pa la sogs pa'i yul can gyi rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa ni yul med pa can zhes brjod do //
analyzed: 'degs pa la sogs pa'i yul can gyi rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa ni yul med pa can zhes brjod do //
translated: The conceptual cognition that has the object of lifting, etc., is called ‚Äúwithout an object.‚Äù

original: gal te don la ltos pa med pa rgyu mtshan yod na yul gang la blo 'byung ba de ni spyi yin pa de'i tshe skra shad la sogs pa don byed nus pa med par de las gzhan pa dmigs la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan yod na rab rib can
analyzed: gal te don la ltos pa med pa rgyu mtshan yod na yul gang la blo 'byung ba de ni spyi yin pa de'i tshe skra shad la sogs pa don byed nus pa med par de las gzhan pa dmigs la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan yod na rab rib can
translated: If the reason for the existence of a cognition that does not depend on an object is that the object of a cognition is a universal, then a person with cataracts would perceive a real object, such as a hair, etc., as a result of the reason for the existence of a cognition that does not depend on an object.

original: la sogs pas dmigs pas skra shad la sogs pa de'i shes pa 'gyur ba de ltar na skra shad 'dzings pa la sogs pa spyi yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: la sogs pas dmigs pas skra shad la sogs pa de'i shes pa 'gyur ba de ltar na skra shad 'dzings pa la sogs pa spyi yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: and so on, and the consciousness of those hairs and so on is transformed. Thus, the hairs and so on would be universals.

original: skra shad sogs ni spyi min no //
analyzed: skra shad sogs ni spyi min no //
translated: Hairs and so on are not universals.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why not?

original: don du zhen pa med phyir ro //
analyzed: don du zhen pa med phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no attachment to objects.

original: rab rib can rnams kyi rang gi shes pa la snang ba'i skra shad 'dzings pa la sogs pa la yul nyid du mos pas tha snyad kyi lam la 'jug pa ma yin pa de ltar na spyi dang khyad par gyi yul can gyi dpyad pa mi bya'o //
analyzed: rab rib can rnams kyi rang gi shes pa la snang ba'i skra shad 'dzings pa la sogs pa la yul nyid du mos pas tha snyad kyi lam la 'jug pa ma yin pa de ltar na spyi dang khyad par gyi yul can gyi dpyad pa mi bya'o //
translated: Those with diseased vision do not engage in the path of verbal conventions by believing that the hairs and so on that appear to their consciousness are objects. Thus, one should not analyze the objects of universals and particulars.

original: gang la tha snyad 'dogs pa po rnams yul du zhen pa 'di la dpyad pa 'di bya'o //
analyzed: gang la tha snyad 'dogs pa po rnams yul du zhen pa 'di la dpyad pa 'di bya'o //
translated: This analysis is for those who are attached to objects as real.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig yul gang gi ngo bo nyid du 'jig rten mngon par zhen nas shes bya nyid du tha snyad du mi byed pa de ni de'i ngo bo ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig yul gang gi ngo bo nyid du 'jig rten mngon par zhen nas shes bya nyid du tha snyad du mi byed pa de ni de'i ngo bo ma yin te /
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever the world is attached to as the nature of an object and does not designate as a knowable object is not the nature of that object,

original: dper na ba lang dang rta lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na ba lang dang rta lta bu'o //
translated: like a cow and a horse.

original: rab rib can gyis mthong ba'i skra shad la sogs pa yang don 'ga' zhig spyi la sogs pa'i shes bya'i ngo bo nyid du 'jig rten mngon par zhen pas tha snyad du mi byed do zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rab rib can gyis mthong ba'i skra shad la sogs pa yang don 'ga' zhig spyi la sogs pa'i shes bya'i ngo bo nyid du 'jig rten mngon par zhen pas tha snyad du mi byed do zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The world does not conventionally designate the hairs seen by one with eye disease as the nature of any knowable object such as a universal, etc., because of the conception of object.üîΩThis is the nonobservation of the pervader.

original: gal te yul nyid du mngon par zhen pas 'jig rten tha snyad du mi byed pa'i phyir spyi ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te yul nyid du mngon par zhen pas 'jig rten tha snyad du mi byed pa'i phyir spyi ma yin na /
translated: If the universal is not a universal because the world does not conventionally designate it as such due to the conception of object,

original: de ltar na ni med pa'i spyir mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na ni med pa'i spyir mi 'gyur te /
translated: then it would not be a nonexistent universal.

original: yul nyid du zhen pa med pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: yul nyid du zhen pa med pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Because there is no conception of object.

original: de la spyi'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la spyi'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not have the nature of a universal.

original: med pa la nyes pa dag tu thal mi 'gyur /üîΩci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: med pa la nyes pa dag tu thal mi 'gyur / ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If it is nonexistent, the absurd consequence of its being nonexistent would not follow.üîΩWhy?

original: shes byar 'dzin phyir ro //
analyzed: shes byar 'dzin phyir ro //
translated: Because it is apprehended as an object of knowledge.

original: @127a * // gal te yang med pa la don gyi ngo bo nyid du zhen pas tha snyad du byas pa med pa de ltar na yang shes bya nyid du tha snyad byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: @127a * // gal te yang med pa la don gyi ngo bo nyid du zhen pas tha snyad du byas pa med pa de ltar na yang shes bya nyid du tha snyad byed pa yin gyi /
translated: Even if the world does not designate it as an object due to the conception of object, it is designated as an object of knowledge.

original: dngos po kho na shes bya ma yin te //
analyzed: dngos po kho na shes bya ma yin te //
translated: But it is not the case that only real things are objects of knowledge,

original: de med pa yang rnam pa 'ba' zhig gis yul du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med pa yang rnam pa 'ba' zhig gis yul du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because non-existent things are also objects of knowledge, since they are objects of a certain kind of cognition.

original: de dag gi yang de lta'i dngos /
analyzed: de dag gi yang de lta'i dngos /
translated: The same is true of their universals.

original: gal te yang med pa dang 'dra bar rab rib can la sogs pas mthong ba'i skra shad la sogs pa dag ni shes pa gzhan gyi shes bya nyid du 'dzin par 'dod pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te yang med pa dang 'dra bar rab rib can la sogs pas mthong ba'i skra shad la sogs pa dag ni shes pa gzhan gyi shes bya nyid du 'dzin par 'dod pa de'i tshe /
translated: If you accept that the hairs and so on seen by those with eye disease are objects of knowledge of another cognition, just like non-existent things,

original: de ltar 'dzin pa la bkag pa med phyir /
analyzed: de ltar 'dzin pa la bkag pa med phyir /
translated: then there is no refuting the apprehension of universals.

original: spyi'i ngo bo nyid du 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: spyi'i ngo bo nyid du 'dod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, you must accept that universals are real.

original: 'on kyang shes pa gang la de dag so sor snang ba'i shes pa des shes bya nyid du 'dzin pa ma yin pa de ltar na spyi ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang shes pa gang la de dag so sor snang ba'i shes pa des shes bya nyid du 'dzin pa ma yin pa de ltar na spyi ma yin no //
translated: But if the cognition of those hairs and so on is not the cognition of the object of knowledge of the cognition that perceives them individually, then they are not universals.

original: gal te rab rib can la sogs pas mthong ba la sogs pa dngos po ma yin na de ji ltar snang ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rab rib can la sogs pas mthong ba la sogs pa dngos po ma yin na de ji ltar snang ba yin zhe na /
translated: If the things seen by those with eye disease and so on are not real things, how is it that they appear?üîΩIn response, Aryadeva says:

original: bshad pa / skra la sogs pa gsal snang nyid //
analyzed: bshad pa / skra la sogs pa gsal snang nyid //
translated: The appearance of hairs and so on

original: shes pa'i ngo bo don nyid phyir //
analyzed: shes pa'i ngo bo don nyid phyir //
translated: is the nature of cognition itself.

original: shes pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis rang gi mtshan nyid yin pa'i rgyu'i phyir /
analyzed: shes pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis rang gi mtshan nyid yin pa'i rgyu'i phyir /
translated: Because the nature of consciousness is the cause of its own characteristic.

original: shes pa'i ngo bo skra la sogs pa de gsal bar snang ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: shes pa'i ngo bo skra la sogs pa de gsal bar snang ba nyid yin no //
translated: The nature of consciousness is the appearance of hair, etc.

original: shes pa de las kyang dus phyis skra la sogs pa dang 'dra bar skra la sogs par nye bar btags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa de las kyang dus phyis skra la sogs pa dang 'dra bar skra la sogs par nye bar btags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And later on, from that consciousness, there arises the conceptual cognition that designates hair, etc. in the same way that hair, etc.üîΩappears in the previous cognition.üîΩThe conceptual cognition that arises later is the one that says, ‚ÄúThis is the sound, etc. that appeared in the previous cognition.‚Äù

original: sngar gyi shes pa la snang ba'i sgra la sogs pa 'di nyid yin no zhes /üîΩskra sogs shes bya'i blo dag kyang //
analyzed: sngar gyi shes pa la snang ba'i sgra la sogs pa 'di nyid yin no zhes / skra sogs shes bya'i blo dag kyang //
translated: The conceptual cognition that arises later is the one that says, ‚ÄúThis is the sound, etc. that appeared in the previous cognition.‚ÄùüîΩThe conceptual cognition that arises later is the one that says, ‚ÄúThis is the sound, etc. that appeared in the previous cognition.‚Äù

original: rnam par rtog pa sgra las byung ba'i rnam pa can dpyod par byed pa yang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //üîΩde ni spyi'i yul can nyid yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa sgra las byung ba'i rnam pa can dpyod par byed pa yang 'byung bar 'gyur ro // de ni spyi'i yul can nyid yin no //
translated: The conceptual cognition that arises later is the one that says, ‚ÄúThis is the sound, etc. that appeared in the previous cognition.‚ÄùüîΩThe conceptual cognition that arises later is the one that says, ‚ÄúThis is the sound, etc. that appeared in the previous cognition.‚Äù

original: 'khrul pa mthong ba rnams kyis skra la sogs pa snang ba mthong ba gang yin pa de /üîΩdon med can yin te yul med ba yin no //üîΩgal te spyi ni shes ngo yi //
analyzed: 'khrul pa mthong ba rnams kyis skra la sogs pa snang ba mthong ba gang yin pa de / don med can yin te yul med ba yin no // gal te spyi ni shes ngo yi //
translated: The conceptual cognition that arises later is the one that says, ‚ÄúThis is the sound, etc. that appeared in the previous cognition.‚ÄùüîΩThe conceptual cognition that arises later is the one that says, ‚ÄúThis is the sound, etc. that appeared in the previous cognition.‚ÄùüîΩThe conceptual cognition that arises later is the one that says, ‚ÄúThis is the sound, etc. that appeared in the previous cognition.‚ÄùüîΩThe conceptual cognition that arises later is the one that says, ‚ÄúThis is the sound, etc. that appeared in the previous cognition.‚ÄùüîΩThe conceptual cognition that arises later is the one that says, ‚ÄúThis is the sound, etc. that appeared in the previous cognition.‚ÄùüîΩThe conceptual cognition that arises later is the one that says, ‚ÄúThis is the sound, etc. that appeared in the previous cognition.‚ÄùüîΩThe conceptual cognition that arises later is the one that says, ‚ÄúThis is the sound, etc. that appeared in the previous cognition.‚ÄùüîΩThe conceptual cognition that arises later is the one that says, ‚ÄúThis is the sound, etc. that appeared in the previous cognition.‚ÄùüîΩThe conceptual cognition that arises later is the one that says, ‚ÄúThis is the sound, etc. that appeared in the previous cognition.‚ÄùüîΩThe conceptual cognition that arises later is the one that says, ‚ÄúThis is the sound, etc. that appeared in the previous cognition.‚Äù

original: don nyid yin na thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: don nyid yin na thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: The conceptual cognition that arises later is the one that says, ‚ÄúThis is the sound, etc. that appeared in the previous cognition.‚ÄùüîΩThe

original: de ltar 'dod phyir skyon yod min //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de ltar 'dod phyir skyon yod min // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, there is no fault in maintaining that.

original: shes pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir spyi yang rang gi mtshan nyid yin par 'dod pa de ltar na 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: shes pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir spyi yang rang gi mtshan nyid yin par 'dod pa de ltar na 'gal ba med do //
translated: Because it is the nature of consciousness, the universal is also a particular characteristic. Thus, there is no contradiction.

original: de yang ji ltar spyi yin zhe na /üîΩbshad pa / don gyi ngo bo nyid kyis spyi /
analyzed: de yang ji ltar spyi yin zhe na / bshad pa / don gyi ngo bo nyid kyis spyi /
translated: How is that a universal?üîΩIt is a universal by the nature of the object.

original: yul gyi ngo bo nyid kyi sgo nas de spyi rnam par gzhag pa yin gyi /
analyzed: yul gyi ngo bo nyid kyi sgo nas de spyi rnam par gzhag pa yin gyi /
translated: It is established as a universal by the nature of the object,

original: shes pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: shes pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: but not by the nature of consciousness.

original: rgyu gang gis don gyi ngo bo nyid kyi sgo nas kyang de spyi'i rnam par gzhag pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu gang gis don gyi ngo bo nyid kyi sgo nas kyang de spyi'i rnam par gzhag pa yin zhe na /
translated: By what cause is it established as a universal by the nature of the object?

original: bshad pa / kun la'ang ngo bo mtshungs phyir te //
analyzed: bshad pa / kun la'ang ngo bo mtshungs phyir te //
translated: Because its nature is the same in all.

original: gsal ba don gyi @127b bya ba byed par mtshungs pa thams cad la de snang ba mtshungs pa yin te /
analyzed: gsal ba don gyi @127b bya ba byed par mtshungs pa thams cad la de snang ba mtshungs pa yin te /
translated: The appearance of that is the same in all that is similar in performing the function of the object.

original: rjes su 'gro ba'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it has the nature of being concomitant.

original: de ldog pa la brten phyir te /
analyzed: de ldog pa la brten phyir te /
translated: Because it is based on the exclusion of that.

original: mtshungs pa nyid do //
analyzed: mtshungs pa nyid do //
translated: It is the same.

original: don gzhan las ldog pa la brten pa'i sgo nas blo de ltar snang ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: don gzhan las ldog pa la brten pa'i sgo nas blo de ltar snang ba'i phyir te /
translated: because the cognition appears in that way on the basis of the exclusion of other things.

original: ldog pa'i dngos po mthong ba las skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ldog pa'i dngos po mthong ba las skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it arises from seeing the excluded thing.

original: der snang ba de'i spyi yin no //
analyzed: der snang ba de'i spyi yin no //
translated: The appearance as that is its universal.

original: de de ltar rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid rnam par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de de ltar rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid rnam par gnas pa yin no //
translated: That is how the universal and particular characteristics are established.

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid de dngos min par rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid de dngos min par rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The universal is not established as a thing.

original: de la 'dir dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la 'dir dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The intended meaning here is this.

original: sgra'i yul ni spyi yin no zhes bshad pa la yang dngos por gyur pa tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa med do zhes sngar bstsal ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: sgra'i yul ni spyi yin no zhes bshad pa la yang dngos por gyur pa tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa med do zhes sngar bstsal ba nyid yin no //
translated: When it is explained that the object of a word is a universal, it has already been refuted that there is a real thing that is either different or non-different.

original: de'i tshe'o na ni spyi'i gzugs la sogs pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i dogs pa bzlog pa'i don du de dngos po ma yin no zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de'i tshe'o na ni spyi'i gzugs la sogs pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i dogs pa bzlog pa'i don du de dngos po ma yin no zhes brjod do //
translated: At that time, in order to eliminate the qualm, ‚ÄúThen it would be a universal form and so on,‚Äù it is said, ‚ÄúIt is not a thing.‚Äù

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not the nature of form and so on.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: brjod bya nyid phyir te /
analyzed: brjod bya nyid phyir te /
translated: Because it is the content of the expression.

original: spyi ni sgra'i brjod par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi ni sgra'i brjod par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The universal is the content of the expression of the word.

original: gzugs la sogs pa yang sgra'i brjod par bya ba ma yin pa des na gzugs la sogs pa ni de lta ma yin no gzugs la sogs pa sgra'i brjod par bya ba nyid ma yin pa yang /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa yang sgra'i brjod par bya ba ma yin pa des na gzugs la sogs pa ni de lta ma yin no gzugs la sogs pa sgra'i brjod par bya ba nyid ma yin pa yang /
translated: But form, etc. are not the content of the expression of the word, therefore form, etc. are not like that.

original: dbang sogs 'bras bcas nyid phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang sogs 'bras bcas nyid phyir ro //
translated: Because the sense faculties, etc. have results.

original: gal te don gyis bya ba med pa'i gzugs te /
analyzed: gal te don gyis bya ba med pa'i gzugs te /
translated: If form, etc. are not the objects of activity of the word,

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i sgra las byung ba'i shes pas 'dzin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i sgra las byung ba'i shes pas 'dzin pa de'i phyir /
translated: then the consciousness that arises from the word form, etc. would apprehend them.

original: dbang po med pa can gyis kyang sgra las gzugs la sogs pa mthong ba de ltar na dbang po la dgos pa cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang po med pa can gyis kyang sgra las gzugs la sogs pa mthong ba de ltar na dbang po la dgos pa cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, even one who lacks a sense faculty would see form, etc. from the word. In that case, the sense faculty would not have the slightest purpose.

original: de ltar yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar yang ma yin te /
translated: But that is not so.

original: dbang po rnams kyang don dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: dbang po rnams kyang don dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: The sense faculties also have objects.

original: de'i phyir dbang po'i yul gyi shes pa la snang ba dang mtshungs par snang la sgra las byung ba'i shes pa la med pa de ltar na yul gcig pa can nyid yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir dbang po'i yul gyi shes pa la snang ba dang mtshungs par snang la sgra las byung ba'i shes pa la med pa de ltar na yul gcig pa can nyid yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since it appears in the cognition of the object of the sense faculty, but does not exist in the cognition produced from sound, they do not have the same object.

original: sgras byas pa'i shes pa la snang ba ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni sgra'i brjod par bya ba rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sgras byas pa'i shes pa la snang ba ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni sgra'i brjod par bya ba rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: That which does not appear in the cognition produced from sound is not a proper object of expression by sound.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig shes pa yul mtshungs par snang ba can byas pa'i shes pa la snang ba can du 'gyur ba ma yin pa de ni de dang yul gcig gcig pa can du 'gyur ba ma yin te /üîΩdper na bum pa'i shes pa'i yul @128a * //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig shes pa yul mtshungs par snang ba can byas pa'i shes pa la snang ba can du 'gyur ba ma yin pa de ni de dang yul gcig gcig pa can du 'gyur ba ma yin te / dper na bum pa'i shes pa'i yul @128a * //
translated: The syllogism is: That which is not the object of a cognition that appears as the same object as the cognition produced from sound does not have the same object as that,

original: dang mtshungs par snang ba can ma yin pa snam bu'i shes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dang mtshungs par snang ba can ma yin pa snam bu'i shes pa lta bu'o //
translated: like the cognition of a cloth, which is not the object of a cognition of a pot that appears as the same object.

original: sgra las byung ba'i shes pa yang dbang po'i yul gyi shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa can du 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: sgra las byung ba'i shes pa yang dbang po'i yul gyi shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa can du 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: This is the non-observation of the pervader.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: This is true,

original: gzugs la sogs pa brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid du 'dod pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid du 'dod pa nyid yin no //
translated: but you accept that form and so on are inexpressible.

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: What then is it?

original: ming dang mtshan ma rnam par shes pa las tha dad pa mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa de'i 'du byed kyi ming can brjod par bya ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ming dang mtshan ma rnam par shes pa las tha dad pa mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa de'i 'du byed kyi ming can brjod par bya ba yin no zhe na /
translated: Name and sign are not consciousness, they are not concomitant, and they are not different from consciousness. They are formations that have the name of that consciousness.

original: gal te de ltar ming la sogs pa brjod bya yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te de ltar ming la sogs pa brjod bya yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: If name and so on are the object of expression in that way,

original: ming sogs brjod yin na /
analyzed: ming sogs brjod yin na /
translated: then name and so on are the object of expression.

original: khas len na /
analyzed: khas len na /
translated: If you accept that,

original: ming la sogs pa de 'chad pa po'am /
analyzed: ming la sogs pa de 'chad pa po'am /
translated: then name and so on are not related to any of the three: the one who explains,

original: nyan pa po'am /
analyzed: nyan pa po'am /
translated: the one who listens,

original: gang brjod par bya ba'i don la 'brel bar 'gyur ba'am gsum po de dag 'ga' zhig dang yang 'brel pa ma yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: gang brjod par bya ba'i don la 'brel bar 'gyur ba'am gsum po de dag 'ga' zhig dang yang 'brel pa ma yin pa de ltar na /
translated: or the object of expression.

original: ming la sogs pa 'chad pa po //üîΩnyan po brjod bya rjes 'brel can /
analyzed: ming la sogs pa 'chad pa po // nyan po brjod bya rjes 'brel can /
translated: The speaker, the listener, the name, etc.üîΩThe listener is related to the expressed, and the name, etc.

original: ming sogs 'brel ba med pa can //
analyzed: ming sogs 'brel ba med pa can //
translated: are related to the expressed and the listener.

original: zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa 'di tsam du 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa 'di tsam du 'gyur grang na /
translated: This is the mere conceptualization.

original: re zhig 'chad pa po dang nyan pa po dang 'brel ba can ming dang mtshan ma dag brjod par bya ba nyid yin na /
analyzed: re zhig 'chad pa po dang nyan pa po dang 'brel ba can ming dang mtshan ma dag brjod par bya ba nyid yin na /
translated: First, if the name and the sign are related to the speaker and the listener, and are to be expressed,

original: don gyi bya ba byed pa phyi rol gyi don la 'chad pa po dang / nyan pa po dang 'brel ba can ming dang mtshan ma brjod par byed pa can gyi sgra las nyan pa po 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don gyi bya ba byed pa phyi rol gyi don la 'chad pa po dang / nyan pa po dang 'brel ba can ming dang mtshan ma brjod par byed pa can gyi sgra las nyan pa po 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then the listener would not engage in the sound that expresses the name and sign related to the speaker and listener, which explains the external object that performs the function of the object.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ma brjod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //üîΩming la sogs pa rjod par byed pa'i ngang tshul can gyi sgra phyi rol na gnas pa'i don ma brjod do //
analyzed: ma brjod pa nyid kyi phyir ro // ming la sogs pa rjod par byed pa'i ngang tshul can gyi sgra phyi rol na gnas pa'i don ma brjod do //
translated: Because it is not expressed.üîΩThe sound that has the nature of expressing the name, etc. does not express the external object.

original: ma brjod pa la yang sgra de las 'jug pa'i rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ma brjod pa la yang sgra de las 'jug pa'i rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not reasonable for the listener to engage in that sound, even if it is not expressed.

original: dper na ba lang brjod pa la ba lang gi sgra las rta la ma yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na ba lang brjod pa la ba lang gi sgra las rta la ma yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, when a cow is spoken of, the word cow applies to it, but not to a horse.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig sgra gang gis ma brjod pa de ni sgra de las de la 'jug pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig sgra gang gis ma brjod pa de ni sgra de las de la 'jug pa ma yin te /
translated: The application is this: Whatever is not spoken of by a certain word does not engage that object by means of that word.

original: dper na bum pa'i sgra las snam bu lta bu'o //üîΩchu la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i don byed pa'i nus pa'i don kyang 'chad pa bo dang nyan pa po dang 'brel ba can gyi ming dang mtshan ma brjod par byed pa'i ngang tshul can gyi sgra brjod par bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par
analyzed: dper na bum pa'i sgra las snam bu lta bu'o // chu la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i don byed pa'i nus pa'i don kyang 'chad pa bo dang nyan pa po dang 'brel ba can gyi ming dang mtshan ma brjod par byed pa'i ngang tshul can gyi sgra brjod par bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par
translated: For example, the word pot does not apply to a cloth.üîΩThe meaning of the expression ‚Äúthe object that is the referent of the word‚Äù is this: The object that is the referent of the word is not the object that is the referent of the word‚Äôs capacity to denote water, etc.üîΩThe object that is the referent of the word is not the object that is the referent of the word‚Äôs capacity to denote water, etc.üîΩThe object that is the referent of the word is not the object that is the referent of the word‚Äôs capacity to denote water, etc.

original: byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //üîΩde ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o // de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: The object that is the referent of the word is not the object that is the referent of the word‚Äôs capacity to denote water, etc.üîΩThe object that is the referent of the word is not the object that is the referent of the word‚Äôs capacity to denote water, etc.üîΩThe object that is the referent of the word is not the object that is the referent of the word‚Äôs capacity to denote water, etc.üîΩThe object that is the referent of the word is not the object that is the referent of the word‚Äôs capacity to denote water, etc.üîΩThe object that is the referent of the word is not the object that is the referent of the word‚Äôs capacity to denote water, etc.üîΩThe object that is the referent of the word is not the object that is the referent of the word‚Äôs capacity to denote water, etc.üîΩThe object that is the referent of the word is not the object that is the referent of the word‚Äôs capacity to denote water, etc.üîΩThe object that is the referent of the word is not the object that is the referent of the word‚Äôs capacity to denote water, etc.üîΩThe object that is the referent of the word is not the object that is the referent of the word‚Äôs capacity to denote water, etc.

original: phyi @128b rol gyi don gang yin pa dang / ming dang mtshan ma la sogs pa gang yin pa de dag la gcig nyid du zhen pa'i sgo nas ston par byed pa po dang bstan par bya ba tha snyad du byed pa yin no //
analyzed: phyi @128b rol gyi don gang yin pa dang / ming dang mtshan ma la sogs pa gang yin pa de dag la gcig nyid du zhen pa'i sgo nas ston par byed pa po dang bstan par bya ba tha snyad du byed pa yin no //
translated: The object that is the referent of the word is not the object that is the referent of the word‚Äôs capacity to denote water, etc.üîΩThe object that is the referent of the word is not

original: de la gcig pa nyid du zhen pa'i sgra'i don ni 'dir 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la gcig pa nyid du zhen pa'i sgra'i don ni 'dir 'gyur te /
translated: The meaning of the term ‚Äúidentity‚Äù is as follows:

original: phyi rol gyi don dang ming dang mtshan ma dag rang bzhin gcig nyid du 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don dang ming dang mtshan ma dag rang bzhin gcig nyid du 'gyur ba'am /
translated: External objects and names and signs would be identical in nature.

original: yang na don la ming dang mtshan ma dag gam ming dang mtshan ma dag la don nye bar 'dogs par byed pa yin pa'am /
analyzed: yang na don la ming dang mtshan ma dag gam ming dang mtshan ma dag la don nye bar 'dogs par byed pa yin pa'am /
translated: Or, names and signs would be applied to objects, or objects would be applied to names and signs,

original: gnyig la phan tshun nye bar 'dogs par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa 'di tsam du 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: gnyig la phan tshun nye bar 'dogs par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa 'di tsam du 'gyur grang na /
translated: or both would be applied to each other.

original: rang bzhin gcig tu 'gyur ba de la phyi rol gyi don nyid la ston par mi nus pa de ltar na /
analyzed: rang bzhin gcig tu 'gyur ba de la phyi rol gyi don nyid la ston par mi nus pa de ltar na /
translated: But if they were identical in nature, then external objects could not be demonstrated,

original: ming dang mtshan mar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ming dang mtshan mar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and they would not be names and signs.

original: de'i tshe yang sgra las phyi rol gyi don rtogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i tshe yang sgra las phyi rol gyi don rtogs pa'i phyir /
translated: And at that time, because external objects would be understood from words,

original: dbang po rnams 'bras bu dang ldan par mi 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: dbang po rnams 'bras bu dang ldan par mi 'gyur ba'am /
translated: the senses would not have a result.

original: ming la sogs pa brjod par bya ba'i skabs nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ming la sogs pa brjod par bya ba'i skabs nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: Or the occasion for expressing names and so on would be lost.

original: phyogs gnyis pa la yang de la don nyid gtso bor bstan pas ming dang mtshan ma yang der gzhan lhag pa phal pa nyid du rtogs pa de ltar na dbang po 'bras bu med pa can gyi gnas skabs de nyid yin no //
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa la yang de la don nyid gtso bor bstan pas ming dang mtshan ma yang der gzhan lhag pa phal pa nyid du rtogs pa de ltar na dbang po 'bras bu med pa can gyi gnas skabs de nyid yin no //
translated: In the second case, since the meaning itself is taught as primary, the name and sign are understood as secondary in relation to that. Thus, that is the state of the faculties being without result.

original: gang gi tshe don ming la sogs pa la nye bar btags pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe don ming la sogs pa la nye bar btags pa de'i tshe /
translated: When the meaning is imputed onto the name, etc.,

original: ming dang mtshan ma la gtso bor rtogs par 'gyur zhing don la phan pa rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ming dang mtshan ma la gtso bor rtogs par 'gyur zhing don la phan pa rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: at that time the name and sign are understood as primary, and the meaning is not understood as beneficial.

original: de ltar na de'i tshe don la 'jug par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na de'i tshe don la 'jug par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, at that time, one does not engage with the meaning.

original: dper na skyes bu rgyal po'i nus pa can la gang gi tshe 'di rgyal po dang 'dra ba yin no zhes bya ba rgyal po nye bar btags par 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: dper na skyes bu rgyal po'i nus pa can la gang gi tshe 'di rgyal po dang 'dra ba yin no zhes bya ba rgyal po nye bar btags par 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
translated: For example, when a person with the power of a king is imputed as a king, saying He is like a king,

original: de'i brjod pa'i sgo nas rgyal por btags pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i brjod pa'i sgo nas rgyal por btags pa ma yin gyi /
translated: at that time, he is not designated as a king by means of expression.

original: 'on kyang de nyid du zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang de nyid du zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: However, it is like saying he is just that.

original: phan tshun nye bar btags pa la yang ci rigs par dbang po 'bras bu med pa can dang 'jug par mi 'gyur ba'i skyon yod do //
analyzed: phan tshun nye bar btags pa la yang ci rigs par dbang po 'bras bu med pa can dang 'jug par mi 'gyur ba'i skyon yod do //
translated: Also, if they are mutually imputed, there is the fault that the sense faculty would be without effect and would not engage.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /üîΩgal te don la mtshungs 'dra las //
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi / gal te don la mtshungs 'dra las //
translated: This is so, but

original: 'khrul 'jug 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'khrul 'jug 'gyur na /
translated: if the engagement of error is from similarity to the object,üîΩthen

original: phyi rol gyi don 'dra ba las /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don 'dra ba las /
translated: from similarity to external objects,

original: ming dang mtshan ma mi ldan pa'i 'du byed kyang yod pa bstan pa de la tshul 'dra ba la skyes bu 'khrul ba'i don gyi rjes su 'jug par byed do zhe na /
analyzed: ming dang mtshan ma mi ldan pa'i 'du byed kyang yod pa bstan pa de la tshul 'dra ba la skyes bu 'khrul ba'i don gyi rjes su 'jug par byed do zhe na /
translated: there would be formations that do not have names and signs.

original: gal te tshul 'dra ba las 'khrul pa don la 'jug par 'gyur @129a * //
analyzed: gal te tshul 'dra ba las 'khrul pa don la 'jug par 'gyur @129a * //
translated: If engagement in the object is from error about similarity,

original: ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: ba de'i tshe /
translated: then

original: dus kun du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dus kun du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: it would not be at all times.

original: gal te tshul 'dra ba'i rgyu mtshan 'jug par 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te tshul 'dra ba'i rgyu mtshan 'jug par 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
translated: If engagement were from a sign of similarity,

original: don la 'ga' zhig 'khrul pas 'jug pa dus thams cad du ni ma yin te /
analyzed: don la 'ga' zhig 'khrul pas 'jug pa dus thams cad du ni ma yin te /
translated: then engagement in the object would not be at all times, because of error about some.

original: dper na ma tshem lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na ma tshem lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like a seamstress.

original: 'di ltar skyes bu 'di dus thams cad du sgra las 'jug pa na don nyid mthong gi 'ba' zhig gi tshe yang 'chad pa po dang nyan pa po dang 'brel pa can gyi mtshan ma nyid ma yin pa nges na chul  'dra bas byas pa'i 'khrul paüîΩlas 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar skyes bu 'di dus thams cad du sgra las 'jug pa na don nyid mthong gi 'ba' zhig gi tshe yang 'chad pa po dang nyan pa po dang 'brel pa can gyi mtshan ma nyid ma yin pa nges na chul  'dra bas byas pa'i 'khrul pa las 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, when this person engages in speech at all times, he sees the object itself, and if he is certain that the sign is not related to the speaker or the hearer, then he will not engage in speech due to a mistake caused by similarity.

original: gzhan yang yul la 'khrul par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang yul la 'khrul par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, he will not be mistaken with respect to the object.

original: ji ltar yul nges pa can gyi don 'ga' zhig don 'dra ba yod na yang 'dir khyod kyis byas pa ni 'di yin no zhes skyes bus bstan pa de las gzhan pa'i yul la /
analyzed: ji ltar yul nges pa can gyi don 'ga' zhig don 'dra ba yod na yang 'dir khyod kyis byas pa ni 'di yin no zhes skyes bus bstan pa de las gzhan pa'i yul la /
translated: Just as the object is ascertained, if some similar object exists, then the person indicates, ‚ÄúThis is what was done by you.‚Äù From that, with respect to another object,

original: so sor nges pa'i don la tshul 'dra ba las 'jug par mi 'gyur ba de ltar 'dir yang 'chad pa po dang / nyan pa po la nges pa'i ming la sogs pa'i blo brjod pa ni rnam par nges pa'i yul gzhan dang 'brel pa can gyi bum pa la sogs pa la 'jug par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: so sor nges pa'i don la tshul 'dra ba las 'jug par mi 'gyur ba de ltar 'dir yang 'chad pa po dang / nyan pa po la nges pa'i ming la sogs pa'i blo brjod pa ni rnam par nges pa'i yul gzhan dang 'brel pa can gyi bum pa la sogs pa la 'jug par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, it is not reasonable to apply the name, etc. that is ascertained for the speaker and listener to a pot, etc. that is related to another ascertained object.

original: gal te gang gi yang ming la sogs pa ldan pa ma yin pa brjod bya ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te gang gi yang ming la sogs pa ldan pa ma yin pa brjod bya ma yin gyi /
translated: If it is said that that which does not possess the name, etc. of either is not the object of expression,

original: shes pa 'ba' zhig yin pa de'i yang don brjod pa ma yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: shes pa 'ba' zhig yin pa de'i yang don brjod pa ma yin pa de ltar na /
translated: and that even consciousness alone is not the object of expression,

original: don la mi 'jug pa la sogs pa mtshungs so zhe na /
analyzed: don la mi 'jug pa la sogs pa mtshungs so zhe na /
translated: then it is the same that one does not engage with the object, and so on.

original: shes pa brjod byar mtshungs min te //
analyzed: shes pa brjod byar mtshungs min te //
translated: Consciousness is not the same as the object of expression.

original: don la mi 'jug pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: don la mi 'jug pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Because it does not engage with the object, and so on.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rnam pa de 'dra'i blo dag ni //
analyzed: rnam pa de 'dra'i blo dag ni //
translated: Because such consciousnesses arise

original: skye phyir tshul 'dra ba las 'khrul pas don la 'jug par 'dod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: skye phyir tshul 'dra ba las 'khrul pas don la 'jug par 'dod pa ma yin no //
translated: from similar conditions, it is not asserted that one engages with the object through error.

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: Well then, what is it?

original: sgra des kun nas bslang ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni ngo bo nyid kyis 'khrul pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra des kun nas bslang ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni ngo bo nyid kyis 'khrul pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The conceptual thought that is aroused by that sound is mistaken by its very nature.

original: 'khrul pa yang nyams su myong bas byas pa yin te /
analyzed: 'khrul pa yang nyams su myong bas byas pa yin te /
translated: And the mistake is made by experience.

original: don gyi rnam pa ci 'dra ba dang rjes su 'brel pa'i nyams su myong ba des bdes bsgos pa'i bag chags sgras sad par byas pa las de lta bu'i rnam pa can gyi rnam par rtog pa'i blo skye ba gang yin pa dngos su rang gi cha la
analyzed: don gyi rnam pa ci 'dra ba dang rjes su 'brel pa'i nyams su myong ba des bdes bsgos pa'i bag chags sgras sad par byas pa las de lta bu'i rnam pa can gyi rnam par rtog pa'i blo skye ba gang yin pa dngos su rang gi cha la
translated: The conceptual thought that arises from the sound arousing the latent potentialities that have been infused by the experience of whatever aspect of the object is related to it is a cognition that has that aspect.

original: dmigs pa can yin na yang /
analyzed: dmigs pa can yin na yang /
translated: Even though it is an object that is directly perceived,

original: ngo bo nyid kyis 'khrul pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis 'khrul pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: it is mistaken by its very nature.

original: dngos po 'dzin pa bzhin du snang ngo //
analyzed: dngos po 'dzin pa bzhin du snang ngo //
translated: Therefore, it appears as if it were an object.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i blo'i gzung ba'i cha nyid la don byed par rung ba yin par zhen pas don la 'jug par @129b 'gyur gyi tshul 'dra ba las ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i blo'i gzung ba'i cha nyid la don byed par rung ba yin par zhen pas don la 'jug par @129b 'gyur gyi tshul 'dra ba las ni ma yin te /
translated: Since it is conceived that the aspect that is the object of the conceptual cognition is capable of effective action, one engages with objects, not with mere representations.

original: ji ltar 'khrul pa mthong ba can gyi skyes bu nang gi 'khrul pa las skra shad la sogs pa mthong ba yin gyi don gyi bya ba byed pa'i skra la sogs pa tshul 'dra ba las mthong ba ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar 'khrul pa mthong ba can gyi skyes bu nang gi 'khrul pa las skra shad la sogs pa mthong ba yin gyi don gyi bya ba byed pa'i skra la sogs pa tshul 'dra ba las mthong ba ma yin te /
translated: Just as a person who sees a hair-net sees hair, etc. due to an internal error, not due to seeing hair, etc. that functions as an object.

original: 'on kyang de ni 'khrul pa'i rang bzhin yin na /
analyzed: 'on kyang de ni 'khrul pa'i rang bzhin yin na /
translated: But if that is the nature of error,

original: gang gis na de ltar mthong bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gis na de ltar mthong bar 'gyur /
translated: how could one see it?

original: de ltar na klan ka nyid ma yin no gzhan la de ltar min te /
analyzed: de ltar na klan ka nyid ma yin no gzhan la de ltar min te /
translated: Thus, it is not a fault.

original: ming la sogs pa brjod par 'dod pa gang yin pa de'i yul dang 'dra ba nyams su myong bas skyed pa de lta'i rnam pa can gyi rnam par rtog pa'i blo ni ngo bo nyid kyis 'khrul pa yin pa'i phyir don la 'jug par rigs pa ma yin
analyzed: ming la sogs pa brjod par 'dod pa gang yin pa de'i yul dang 'dra ba nyams su myong bas skyed pa de lta'i rnam pa can gyi rnam par rtog pa'i blo ni ngo bo nyid kyis 'khrul pa yin pa'i phyir don la 'jug par rigs pa ma yin
translated: It is not so for others, because the mind that is a conception having the aspect of that which is produced by the experience of an object similar to the one wished to be expressed by a name, etc. is essentially erroneous, and therefore it is not reasonable that it engage an object.

original: no // ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: no // ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: blo ni khas len med phyir ro //
analyzed: blo ni khas len med phyir ro //
translated: Because the mind is without assertion.

original: des yul dang 'dra ba nyams su myong ba las skye ba'i nyams su myong ba'i rnam pa can gyi rnam par rtog pa'i blo khas mi len na /
analyzed: des yul dang 'dra ba nyams su myong ba las skye ba'i nyams su myong ba'i rnam pa can gyi rnam par rtog pa'i blo khas mi len na /
translated: If you do not accept that the conceptual mind arises from the experience of an object that is similar to it,

original: gang gis na rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i ngang tshul can gyi don las don byed bar nges pa las 'jug par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gis na rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i ngang tshul can gyi don las don byed bar nges pa las 'jug par 'gyur /
translated: then how can you engage in the activity of an object that appears to conceptual thought?

original: ci ste skyon der ma gyur cig snyam pas phyi rol gyi don du snang ba'i blo khas len pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: ci ste skyon der ma gyur cig snyam pas phyi rol gyi don du snang ba'i blo khas len pa de'i tshe /
translated: If you think that this error does not arise and you accept that the mind appears as an external object,

original: phyir rol don dus nang ba can gyi blo khas len na yang ming dang mtshan ma so sor rig pa'i ngo bo can gyi rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid khas len par byed na'o //
analyzed: phyir rol don dus nang ba can gyi blo khas len na yang ming dang mtshan ma so sor rig pa'i ngo bo can gyi rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid khas len par byed na'o //
translated: then you accept that the mind is external, but you accept that the nature of consciousness is the awareness of individual names and signs.

original: rnam shes las tha dad pa ni /
analyzed: rnam shes las tha dad pa ni /
translated: The mind is not different from consciousness.

original: ming la sogs pa mi ldan pa'i 'du byed tshad can min /
analyzed: ming la sogs pa mi ldan pa'i 'du byed tshad can min /
translated: Finite nonassociated compositional factors do not possess names, etc.

original: rnam par shes pa las tha dad pa'i ming la sogs pa yod pa nyid kyi tshad ma yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa las tha dad pa'i ming la sogs pa yod pa nyid kyi tshad ma yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: There is no valid cognition that proves that names, etc., exist apart from consciousness.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: ldog pa grub pa med phyir ro //
analyzed: ldog pa grub pa med phyir ro //
translated: Because the negation is not established.

original: ji ltar don gyi rnam pa can gyi rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa las don gzhan snang ba med na /
analyzed: ji ltar don gyi rnam pa can gyi rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa las don gzhan snang ba med na /
translated: If the object does not exist as something different from the consciousness that has the aspect of the object,

original: de las gzhan pa'i dbang po la sogs pa rgyu yod na yang 'bras bu rnam par shes pa rgyu gzhan la ltos pa dang bcas par skye bar mi 'gyur bas pha rol gyi don grub pa yin pa de ltar ming la sogs pa grub pa'i phyir ldog pa
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i dbang po la sogs pa rgyu yod na yang 'bras bu rnam par shes pa rgyu gzhan la ltos pa dang bcas par skye bar mi 'gyur bas pha rol gyi don grub pa yin pa de ltar ming la sogs pa grub pa'i phyir ldog pa
translated: then even if there were a cause such as a sense faculty that is different from that consciousness, the effect, consciousness, would not arise in dependence on another cause. Therefore, the object would be established.

original: rab tu grub pa med na gang gis na des yod pa zhes bya bar 'gyur /
analyzed: rab tu grub pa med na gang gis na des yod pa zhes bya bar 'gyur /
translated: But since the negation is not established, how could it be said to exist?

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /üîΩgal te shes kun don ldan phyir //
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi / gal te shes kun don ldan phyir //
translated: This is so, butüîΩif all consciousnesses have objects,

original: cung zhig shes pa gang yin pa de thams cad don dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: cung zhig shes pa gang yin pa de thams cad don dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: then whatever is a consciousness is one that has an object,

original: shes pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩsgra las 'byung ba 'di yang shes @130a * //
analyzed: shes pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro // sgra las 'byung ba 'di yang shes @130a * //
translated: because it is a consciousness.

original: ba yin no //
analyzed: ba yin no //
translated: This sound that arises from a drum is also a consciousness.

original: de bas na de ni don dang ldan pa nyid yin gyi de yang gzugs la sogs pa ma yin na //üîΩdon gang gis don dang ldan pa des rgyu mtshan la sogs pa tshad ma can nyid ma yin /
analyzed: de bas na de ni don dang ldan pa nyid yin gyi de yang gzugs la sogs pa ma yin na // don gang gis don dang ldan pa des rgyu mtshan la sogs pa tshad ma can nyid ma yin /
translated: And if it is not established that the reason is contradictory, then it is not established that the reason is inconclusive.üîΩAnd if it is not established that the reason is inconclusive, then it is not established that the reason is unestablished.üîΩAnd if it is not established that the reason is unestablished, then it is not established that the reason is contradictory.üîΩAnd if it is not established that the reason is contradictory, then it is not established that the reason is inconclusive.üîΩAnd if it is not established that the reason is inconclusive, then it is not established that the reason is unestablished.üîΩAnd if it is not established that the reason is unestablished, then it is not established that the reason is contradictory.üîΩAnd if it is not established that the reason is contradictory, then it is not established that the reason is inconclusive.

original: de dang de ni khyab pa med pa'i phyir dang / ldog pa med pa'i phyir lhag ma dang ldan pa nyid yin pas ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de dang de ni khyab pa med pa'i phyir dang / ldog pa med pa'i phyir lhag ma dang ldan pa nyid yin pas ma nges pa yin no //
translated: And if it is not established that the reason is inconclusive, then it is not established that the reason is unestablished.üîΩAnd if it is not established that the reason is unestablished, then it is not established that the reason is contradictory.

original: rnam pa gzhan du yang 'di'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug pa yod pa de ltar na ma nges pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du yang 'di'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug pa yod pa de ltar na ma nges pa nyid yin no //
translated: And if it is not established that the reason is contradictory, then it is not established that the reason is inconclusive.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩrmi sogs la rnam gzhan mthong phyir /üîΩrigs min / sogs pa smos pas ni rab rib can la sogs pa bzung ngo //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / rmi sogs la rnam gzhan mthong phyir / rigs min / sogs pa smos pas ni rab rib can la sogs pa bzung ngo //
translated: And if it is not established that the reason is inconclusive, then it is not established that the reason is unestablished.üîΩAnd if it is not established that the reason is unestablished, then it is not established that the reason is contradictory.üîΩAnd if it is not established that the reason is contradictory, then it is not established that the reason is inconclusive.üîΩAnd if it is not established that the reason is inconclusive, then it is not established that the reason is unestablished.üîΩAnd if it is not established that the reason is unestablished, then it is not established that the reason is contradictory.üîΩAnd if it is not established that the reason is contradictory, then it is not established that the reason is inconclusive.

original: rmi lam la sogs pa ni shes pa yang de don gyis stong pa nyid du skye ba de ltar na ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: rmi lam la sogs pa ni shes pa yang de don gyis stong pa nyid du skye ba de ltar na ma nges pa yin no //
translated: And if it is not established that the reason is inconclusive, then it is not established that the reason is unestablished.üîΩAnd if it is not established that the reason is unestablished, then it is not established that the reason is contradictory.üîΩAnd if it is not established

original: gal te rmi lam na yang don gyi mtshan ma'i 'du byed las rnam par shes pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba de bas na ma nges pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rmi lam na yang don gyi mtshan ma'i 'du byed las rnam par shes pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba de bas na ma nges pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that consciousness arises from the formative forces of the signs of objects even in a dream, then it is not indeterminate.

original: de ni mi ldan pa'i 'du byed las rmi lam na yang rnam par shes pa 'byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni mi ldan pa'i 'du byed las rmi lam na yang rnam par shes pa 'byung ba ma yin no //
translated: Consciousness does not arise from non-associated formative forces even in a dream.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: sngon po la sogs snang phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs snang phyir ro //
translated: Because blue and so on appear.

original: rmi lam gyi shes pa la kha dog dang dbyibs snang ba yin gyi /üîΩkha dog dang dbyibs kyi mtshan nyid can mi ldan pa'i 'du byed ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rmi lam gyi shes pa la kha dog dang dbyibs snang ba yin gyi / kha dog dang dbyibs kyi mtshan nyid can mi ldan pa'i 'du byed ni ma yin no //
translated: Blue and so on appear to dream consciousness,üîΩbut non-associated formative forces that have the characteristics of color and shape do not.

original: sbyor ba ni kha dog dang dbyibs kyi ngo bor 'gyur pa ma yin pa de ni /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni kha dog dang dbyibs kyi ngo bor 'gyur pa ma yin pa de ni /
translated: The syllogism is: That which does not have the nature of color and shape

original: kha dog dang dbyibs kyi ngo bo'i sgo nas rang nyid 'dzin pa'i ngang tshul can gyi shes pa la snang ba ma yin te /
analyzed: kha dog dang dbyibs kyi ngo bo'i sgo nas rang nyid 'dzin pa'i ngang tshul can gyi shes pa la snang ba ma yin te /
translated: does not appear to consciousness that has the nature of color and shape and that has the mode of apprehension of grasping itself,

original: dper na bde ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na bde ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: like pleasure and so on.

original: mi ldan pa'i 'du byed kyang kha dog dang dbyibs kyi ngo bor mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o//
analyzed: mi ldan pa'i 'du byed kyang kha dog dang dbyibs kyi ngo bor mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o//
translated: This is a non-observation of a pervader.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: This is true, but

original: gal te mig la sogs pa kha dog dang dbyibs su snang ba can mi ldan pa'i 'du byed ma yin pa de ltar na yang /
analyzed: gal te mig la sogs pa kha dog dang dbyibs su snang ba can mi ldan pa'i 'du byed ma yin pa de ltar na yang /
translated: even if the eye and so on, which appear as color and shape, are not non-associated compositional factors,

original: rma lam gyi nang gi sngon po la sogs pa'i ngo bo de 'gyur ba de ltar na don dang bcas pa nyid yin pas na ma nges pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rma lam gyi nang gi sngon po la sogs pa'i ngo bo de 'gyur ba de ltar na don dang bcas pa nyid yin pas na ma nges pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: since the nature of blue and so on in dreams is transformed, they are not uncertain because they do have objects.

original: rmi lam gyi rnam par shes pa la yul sngo sogs min /
analyzed: rmi lam gyi rnam par shes pa la yul sngo sogs min /
translated: The object of a dream consciousness is not blue and so on.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: rmi lam na dmigs pa'i sngon po la sogs pa thogs med phyir ro //
analyzed: rmi lam na dmigs pa'i sngon po la sogs pa thogs med phyir ro //
translated: Because the blue and so on that are observed in dreams are unimpeded.

original: sngon po la sogs pa ni thogs pa dang bcas pa yin zhing /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa ni thogs pa dang bcas pa yin zhing /
translated: Blue and so on are impeded.

original: gnyid kyis log pa'i gnas skabs na yang khang pa bar mtshams med pa nyid las bdag phyir @130b byung ba rmi mod kyi /
analyzed: gnyid kyis log pa'i gnas skabs na yang khang pa bar mtshams med pa nyid las bdag phyir @130b byung ba rmi mod kyi /
translated: Even in the state of sleep, one dreams of going outside from a house that has no gaps.

original: thogs pa can yin pa de ltar 'jug pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: thogs pa can yin pa de ltar 'jug pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it does not operate in that way, as something impeded.

original: sbyar ba ni gang thogs pa med pa de ni sngon po la sogs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: sbyar ba ni gang thogs pa med pa de ni sngon po la sogs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If it were unimpeded, it would not be blue, etc.

original: dper na rnam par shes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na rnam par shes pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, consciousness.üîΩAnd the object perceived in a dream is also unimpeded.

original: rmi lam du dmigs pa'i yul la yang thogs pa med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rmi lam du dmigs pa'i yul la yang thogs pa med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: This is the perception of a contradiction with a pervasion.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: This is true, but

original: las de nyid kyis de 'dra ba'i ngo bo skye bar 'gyur ba yin la /
analyzed: las de nyid kyis de 'dra ba'i ngo bo skye bar 'gyur ba yin la /
translated: it is just that action which produces a body of that kind.

original: gang gis yul chod pa dag tu gnyid kyis log pa 'di bdag nyid phyir 'byung bar rmis pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gis yul chod pa dag tu gnyid kyis log pa 'di bdag nyid phyir 'byung bar rmis pa yin no //
translated: And when one falls asleep in a place where there is an obstruction, one dreams that one‚Äôs body is obstructed.

original: zhe na de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: zhe na de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: But that is not reasonable.

original: 'di ltar gal te dngos su de byung ba de'i tshe //
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te dngos su de byung ba de'i tshe //
translated: For if it were to go there directly,

original: nang na gnas pa'i lus la dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa la sogs pa de'i tshe yod par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: nang na gnas pa'i lus la dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa la sogs pa de'i tshe yod par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: then when one who is asleep in a house breathes in and out, etc.,

original: shi ba nyid yin pa'i phyir dad /
analyzed: shi ba nyid yin pa'i phyir dad /
translated: it would not be possible, because it would be dead.

original: rnam par shes pa'i rgyud gnyis med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rgyud gnyis med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no second continuum of consciousness.

original: de gnyid log pa nyid la bsnun par byed pa ni chos ma yin par mi 'gyur ro//
analyzed: de gnyid log pa nyid la bsnun par byed pa ni chos ma yin par mi 'gyur ro//
translated: It is not a crime to strike a sleeping person.

original: ci ste ma byung ba de'i tshe de ltar mthong ba la 'khrul pa don gyis stong pa nyid yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: ci ste ma byung ba de'i tshe de ltar mthong ba la 'khrul pa don gyis stong pa nyid yin pa de ltar na /
translated: But if it does not exist, then the seeing of it in that way is empty of meaning, i.e., it is an error.

original: de ni cir yang mi rung ngo //üîΩgzhan yang gzugs la sogs pa de dngos su shes pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de ni cir yang mi rung ngo // gzhan yang gzugs la sogs pa de dngos su shes pa yin gyi /
translated: But in that case, it is not suitable in any way.

original: don min no //
analyzed: don min no //
translated: Moreover, that form, etc. is directly cognized, but not the object.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩyul rung can gyis mi shes pa /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / yul rung can gyis mi shes pa /
translated: Why is that?

original: yul rung ba mtshungs pa can la sogs pa'i skyes bu rnams kyis ma bzung ba mngon sum rang gis shes pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul rung ba mtshungs pa can la sogs pa'i skyes bu rnams kyis ma bzung ba mngon sum rang gis shes pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the cause of the cognition of the object that is suitable as an object, but not of the cognition of the object that is not suitable as an object.

original: 'di ni shes pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni shes pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: This is the definition of cognition.

original: gal te de shes pa ma yin pa'i ngo bor 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te de shes pa ma yin pa'i ngo bor 'gyur na /
translated: If it were not of the nature of cognition,

original: yul rung bar mtshungs pa na gnas pa gang gis ci'i phyir mi 'dzin /
analyzed: yul rung bar mtshungs pa na gnas pa gang gis ci'i phyir mi 'dzin /
translated: then why would it not apprehend the object that is suitable as an object?

original: rnal 'byor pa gzugs gang bskyed nas rang nyid kyis mthong ba des kyang mtshan nyid la 'khrul pa ma yin te yul rung ba can nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa gzugs gang bskyed nas rang nyid kyis mthong ba des kyang mtshan nyid la 'khrul pa ma yin te yul rung ba can nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The yogi/nƒ´ who generates a form and sees it is not mistaken about the characteristics, because it is apprehended as a suitable object.

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i don ston pa /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i don ston pa /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúblue,‚Äù etc., is taught by that.

original: des ni ming sogs brjod pa yin /
analyzed: des ni ming sogs brjod pa yin /
translated: That is the expression of names, etc.

original: dper na de'i yang yul rung ba can dag gis mi shes pa rang nyid kyis shes pa'i phyir shes pa'i mtshan nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: dper na de'i yang yul rung ba can dag gis mi shes pa rang nyid kyis shes pa'i phyir shes pa'i mtshan nyid yin gyi /
translated: For example, because it is known by those who have a suitable object, it is the characteristic of knowledge, because it is known by itself.

original: tha dad par yod pa ma yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: tha dad par yod pa ma yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is not that it exists separately.

original: ji ltar spyi'i blo la don yod pa ma yin pa de ltar de bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar spyi'i blo la don yod pa ma yin pa de ltar de bshad pa yin no //
translated: As it is explained, the meaning does not exist for the cognition of universals.üîΩMoreover, it is said:

original: gzhan yang ro zhig / gang 'di mig la sogs pa'i blo //
analyzed: gzhan yang ro zhig / gang 'di mig la sogs pa'i blo //
translated: The cognition of the eye, etc.,

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul la 'dod pa ste //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul la 'dod pa ste //
translated: is asserted to be the object of form, etc.

original: khas len na tshad ma gang @131a * //
analyzed: khas len na tshad ma gang @131a * //
translated: If it is accepted, by what valid cognition

original: gis de nyid don dang ldan par 'dod /
analyzed: gis de nyid don dang ldan par 'dod /
translated: is that asserted to be meaningful?

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: That is the case, but

original: gal te don gyi nus mthong yin /
analyzed: gal te don gyi nus mthong yin /
translated: if it is the seeing of the potency of the object,

original: de las gzhan pa'i dbang po la sogs pa'i rgyu rnams yod na yang /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i dbang po la sogs pa'i rgyu rnams yod na yang /
translated: But even if the causes of the other sense faculties and so on exist,

original: 'bras bu mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: the effect, the eye consciousness and so on, will not arise.üîΩNow, to demonstrate that the nonarising of the effect depends on other causes,

original: da ni de mi skye ba de rgyu gzhan la ltos pa dang bcas pa ston par byed pa de ltar na ldog pa las don gyi nus pa mthong ba'i phyir mig la sogs pa'i blo don dang ldan pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: da ni de mi skye ba de rgyu gzhan la ltos pa dang bcas pa ston par byed pa de ltar na ldog pa las don gyi nus pa mthong ba'i phyir mig la sogs pa'i blo don dang ldan pa yin no zhe na /
translated: you may say, ‚ÄúIn that case, because the capacity of the object is seen from the cessation of the effect, the cognition of the eye and so on is meaningful.‚Äù

original: gal te de ltar 'bras bu ldog pa las don grub pa yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te de ltar 'bras bu ldog pa las don grub pa yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: If the establishment of the object is like that, that is, from the cessation of the effect,

original: don med can gzhan /
analyzed: don med can gzhan /
translated: then the cognition of the object would be without an object.

original: spyi'i yul can gyi rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa mthong bar 'gyur /
analyzed: spyi'i yul can gyi rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa mthong bar 'gyur /
translated: The cognition that has a universal as its object would be seen to be without an object.

original: de ltar de ldog pa las spyi'i nus pa nyid rtogs par mi nus te /
analyzed: de ltar de ldog pa las spyi'i nus pa nyid rtogs par mi nus te /
translated: In that case, the capacity of the universal could not be understood from the cessation of the effect,

original: yid la byed pa la sogs pa nang gi rgyu mtshan yod na yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid la byed pa la sogs pa nang gi rgyu mtshan yod na yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would exist when there is an internal cause such as attention.

original: gang yang snam bu 'dzin pa na bum pa'i spyi mi snang ba yin te /
analyzed: gang yang snam bu 'dzin pa na bum pa'i spyi mi snang ba yin te /
translated: Also, when a cloth is apprehended, the universal of a pot does not appear.

original: snam bu la med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snam bu la med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not exist in the cloth.

original: zhes bya ba de nyid 'bras bu de ldog pa'i yul yin no snyam du sems na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba de nyid 'bras bu de ldog pa'i yul yin no snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think that the object of the cessation of that effect is just that,

original: snam bu'i blo de la yang bum pa mi snang ba ni rang gi bag chags kyi nye bar len pa'i khyad par gyis blo tha dad pa rnams ni ngo bo phan tshun 'dres pa med pa'i phyir yin gyi /
analyzed: snam bu'i blo de la yang bum pa mi snang ba ni rang gi bag chags kyi nye bar len pa'i khyad par gyis blo tha dad pa rnams ni ngo bo phan tshun 'dres pa med pa'i phyir yin gyi /
translated: then in the cognition of cloth, the pot does not appear because the different cognitions are not mutually mixed in nature due to the specific appropriation of their own habitual tendencies.

original: yul tha dad pa'i phyir ni ma yin no zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: yul tha dad pa'i phyir ni ma yin no zhes bshad zin to //
translated: But it is not due to the difference of the object.üîΩThis has already been explained.

original: de bas na de la yul med pa'i phyir bum pa'i blo med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na de la yul med pa'i phyir bum pa'i blo med pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the cognition of the pot is not non-existent there because of the non-existence of the object.

original: gang gi tshe snam bu de yang blos bum pa'i ngo bor sgyur bar byed pa'am /
analyzed: gang gi tshe snam bu de yang blos bum pa'i ngo bor sgyur bar byed pa'am /
translated: When that cloth is transformed into the nature of the pot by the cognition,

original: snam bur mi rtog pas yul de la bum par dpyod par byed pa de'i tshe de las yang bum pa'i rnam par rtog pa nyid du 'gyur na de la de'i tshe bum pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: snam bur mi rtog pas yul de la bum par dpyod par byed pa de'i tshe de las yang bum pa'i rnam par rtog pa nyid du 'gyur na de la de'i tshe bum pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: or when that object is analyzed as a pot by not conceiving it as cloth, then at that time it would be a conception of a pot, but at that time the pot does not exist there.

original: snam bu bum pa'i ngo bor bsgyur ba de ltar na yang don gyis stong pa'i sa phyogs dang 'brel pa can gyi bum par snang ba'i blo nyid 'gyur ro //üîΩde nyid kyi phyir gsal ba yul gzhan na gnas pa'am /
analyzed: snam bu bum pa'i ngo bor bsgyur ba de ltar na yang don gyis stong pa'i sa phyogs dang 'brel pa can gyi bum par snang ba'i blo nyid 'gyur ro // de nyid kyi phyir gsal ba yul gzhan na gnas pa'am /
translated: The cloth is transformed into the nature of the pot, but the cognition that appears as a pot connected to a place that is empty of the object is transformed.üîΩTherefore, the universal is either located in another object or it is located in the cognition.

original: gsal ba de la gnas pa spyi yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gsal ba de la gnas pa spyi yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: If it is located in the cognition,

original: de ni blo'i yul ma yin te /üîΩde'i yul dang / 'brel pa can nyid dam /
analyzed: de ni blo'i yul ma yin te / de'i yul dang / 'brel pa can nyid dam /
translated: then it is not the object of cognition,

original: snam bu der gyur pa'am yul de nyid la bum par rnam par rtog pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgal te yul gzhan na gnas pa'i gsal ba'i spyi 'dzin pa can du 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: snam bu der gyur pa'am yul de nyid la bum par rnam par rtog pa'i phyir ro // gal te yul gzhan na gnas pa'i gsal ba'i spyi 'dzin pa can du 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
translated: because it is connected to the object or because it is imagined as cloth or as a pot in that place.üîΩIf it is located in another object, then it would be the apprehension of the universal of the object located in another place.

original: de yul gang @131b la gnas pa'i yul de'i gnas skabs nyid la rnam par rtog par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de yul gang @131b la gnas pa'i yul de'i gnas skabs nyid la rnam par rtog par 'gyur gyi /
translated: If that is the case, then it would be imagined as the state of the place where the object is located,

original: de ltar rnam par rtog pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar rnam par rtog pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but it is not imagined in that way.

original: de bas na yul gzhan na gnas pa'i don 'dzin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na yul gzhan na gnas pa'i don 'dzin pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it does not apprehend an object located in another place.

original: 'dod rgyal gyi sgra'i yul gsal ba'i khyad par rnams sam /
analyzed: 'dod rgyal gyi sgra'i yul gsal ba'i khyad par rnams sam /
translated: The object of a wish-granting sound is a particular clarity.

original: gsal ba nyung zad pa can gyi spyi'am grong dang grong khyer dang / yul dang / skyes bu dang / khang bzangs la sogs pa zhig pa'i yul can gyi shes pa'am de med na yang 'bad rtsol tsam gyi rang gi 'dod pas sbyor ba'i ngo bo can gyi shes pa dag la rnam par rtog pa'i blo yod pa yin na don yod pa gang yin /
analyzed: gsal ba nyung zad pa can gyi spyi'am grong dang grong khyer dang / yul dang / skyes bu dang / khang bzangs la sogs pa zhig pa'i yul can gyi shes pa'am de med na yang 'bad rtsol tsam gyi rang gi 'dod pas sbyor ba'i ngo bo can gyi shes pa dag la rnam par rtog pa'i blo yod pa yin na don yod pa gang yin /
translated: Or, the object of a cognition that is a generality with little clarity, or the object of a cognition that is a village, city, country, person, mansion, and so on that has been destroyed, or even if it does not exist, the nature of a cognition that is applied by one‚Äôs wish through mere effort, is a conceptual mind. If the object does not exist, what is the point of a conceptual mind?

original: gal te don med na med par 'gyur ba de bas na //
analyzed: gal te don med na med par 'gyur ba de bas na //
translated: If the object does not exist, the conceptual mind would not exist.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i blo la de las gzhan pa'i rgyu mtshan thag nye ba na yod na ldog pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i blo la de las gzhan pa'i rgyu mtshan thag nye ba na yod na ldog pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, if the reason for a conceptual mind exists nearby, it is not reversed.

original: de las tha dad pa'i rgyu la de ltos pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de las tha dad pa'i rgyu la de ltos pa ma yin no //
translated: It does not depend on a cause that is different from that.

original: de de ltar na 'chad pa po dang / nyan pa po dang / 'brel pa can gyi ming la sogs pa brjod par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de de ltar na 'chad pa po dang / nyan pa po dang / 'brel pa can gyi ming la sogs pa brjod par bya ba yin no //
translated: Thus, the speaker, the listener, and the related name and so on are to be expressed.

original: sgra las don byed par nus pa'i don nyid la 'jug par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sgra las don byed par nus pa'i don nyid la 'jug par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not reasonable to apply a word to an object that is not capable of performing a function.

original: 'brel med can la 'jug pa med //
analyzed: 'brel med can la 'jug pa med //
