translated: It is true that the word is not applied to the pot of the past, etc., in virtue of a universal that is the cause of the word as it is to the present pot.

original: 'on kyang sde la nye bar btags pa la 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang sde la nye bar btags pa la 'jug pa yin no //
translated: But it is applied in virtue of a designation.

original: nye bar btags pa la 'jug pa yang spyi dngos por gyur ba'i rten gyi sgo nas 'jug pa ma yin no snyam du sems so //
analyzed: nye bar btags pa la 'jug pa yang spyi dngos por gyur ba'i rten gyi sgo nas 'jug pa ma yin no snyam du sems so //
translated: And the application in virtue of designation is not in virtue of a universal that is a real entity as a basis.

original: gal te nye bar btags pa la rgyu mtshan 'ga' zhig yod par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te nye bar btags pa la rgyu mtshan 'ga' zhig yod par gyur na /
translated: If there were some reason for the application in virtue of designation,

original: nye bar btags pa'i sgo nas 'jug par 'gyur na /
analyzed: nye bar btags pa'i sgo nas 'jug par 'gyur na /
translated: the word would be applied in virtue of designation.

original: gang gi phyir de nyid yod pa ma yin pa de ltar na nye bar btags pa las sgra 'jug pa med pa yin no//
analyzed: gang gi phyir de nyid yod pa ma yin pa de ltar na nye bar btags pa las sgra 'jug pa med pa yin no//
translated: But since that does not exist, the word is not applied in virtue of designation.

original: de ltar na da ltar ba'i bum pa'i nye bar gang ste /
analyzed: de ltar na da ltar ba'i bum pa'i nye bar gang ste /
translated: What is the designation of the present pot?

original: sgra 'jug pa rgyu mtshan gyi chos so //
analyzed: sgra 'jug pa rgyu mtshan gyi chos so //
translated: The word is applied in virtue of a property that is the reason.

original: med pa dang ni 'das pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi bum pa med pa dang / lhan cig da ltar gyi bum pa'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: med pa dang ni 'das pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi bum pa med pa dang / lhan cig da ltar gyi bum pa'i dngos po'o //
translated: The non-existence of a pot, which is characterized by non-existence and the past, etc., is the entity of a present pot.

original: snam bu la sogs pa med pa dang / nye ba gang yin pa de gang yin /üîΩgang gis na snam bu la nye bar btags pa las bum pa'i sgras 'jug par mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: snam bu la sogs pa med pa dang / nye ba gang yin pa de gang yin / gang gis na snam bu la nye bar btags pa las bum pa'i sgras 'jug par mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: What is the non-existence of cloth, etc., and what is its proximity?üîΩBy what is the application of the word pot to a pot excluded, and by what is the application of the word pot to a non-existent excluded?

original: bum pa'i nye bar btags pa nyid kyis med pa las 'gyur ba cung zad kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: bum pa'i nye bar btags pa nyid kyis med pa las 'gyur ba cung zad kyang ma yin no //
translated: There is not the slightest difference between the two.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: This is true, but

original: ji ltar da ltar gyi bum pa chu la sogs pa 'dzin pa la sogs pa de ltar 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i bum pa dag gyur pa dang 'gyur ba de ltar 'di nye bar btags pa'i rgyu mtshan yin no zhe na //
analyzed: ji ltar da ltar gyi bum pa chu la sogs pa 'dzin pa la sogs pa de ltar 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i bum pa dag gyur pa dang 'gyur ba de ltar 'di nye bar btags pa'i rgyu mtshan yin no zhe na //
translated: the reason for the designation of the past and future pots is that they are like the present pot in the activity of holding water, etc.

original: de ltar na ni gang gi tshe de chu la sogs pa 'dzin pa la sogs pa byed par 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: de ltar na ni gang gi tshe de chu la sogs pa 'dzin pa la sogs pa byed par 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
translated: If that is so, then when the pot is in the activity of holding water, etc.,

original: bum pa nyid yin pa de ltar na de'i tshe bzlog pa nyid med do //
analyzed: bum pa nyid yin pa de ltar na de'i tshe bzlog pa nyid med do //
translated: If it is a pot, then at that time it is not the opposite.

original: zhig par gyur pa mad pa yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: zhig par gyur pa mad pa yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: When the destroyed state exists, the present pot does not exist.

original: da ltar gyi bum pa nye bar btags pa'i rgyu mtshan de la ci zhig yin /
analyzed: da ltar gyi bum pa nye bar btags pa'i rgyu mtshan de la ci zhig yin /
translated: At that time, what is the reason for the designation of the present pot?

original: de ltar na nye bar btags pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na nye bar btags pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, it is not a designation.

original: de bzhin du ma 'ongs pa yang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du ma 'ongs pa yang ngo //
translated: The same is true for the future.

original: byung ba la de byed ba'i nus pa nyid kyi sgo nas sgra bzlog pa med pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: byung ba la de byed ba'i nus pa nyid kyi sgo nas sgra bzlog pa med pa nyid yin no //
translated: The present is not the opposite because it has the capacity to produce that.

original: ma byung ba yang @138a * //
analyzed: ma byung ba yang @138a * //
translated: The non-arisen

original: de yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de yod pa ma yin no //
translated: does not exist.

original: de bas na nye bar btags pa'i rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir nye bar btags pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na nye bar btags pa'i rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir nye bar btags pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, because there is no reason for designation, it is not a designation.

original: sbyor ba ni gang la gang nye bar btags pa'i rgyu mtshan med pa de la nye bar btags pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang la gang nye bar btags pa'i rgyu mtshan med pa de la nye bar btags pa ma yin te /
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever does not have a reason for designation does not have designation,

original: dper na phyug po la sogs pa'i yon tan dang bral ba'i bran po la rgyal po nye bar mi 'dogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na phyug po la sogs pa'i yon tan dang bral ba'i bran po la rgyal po nye bar mi 'dogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: like a slave who lacks the qualities of a wealthy person and is not designated by the king.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag la yang da ltar gyi bum pa nye bar btags pa'i rgyu mtshan yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa dmigs pa'o //üîΩgzhan yang khyed cag gis tha dad pa'i khyad par can gang yin pa de dngos yin la /
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag la yang da ltar gyi bum pa nye bar btags pa'i rgyu mtshan yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa dmigs pa'o // gzhan yang khyed cag gis tha dad pa'i khyad par can gang yin pa de dngos yin la /
translated: And there is no reason for the designation of the present pot to exist in the past and future. This is the observation of the pervader.üîΩMoreover, your definition of the real and the nominal is not accepted by the world, namely, that the real is that which has a distinct particular,

original: gzhan ni phal ba yin no zhes bya ba'i dngos dang nye bar btags pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid de ni 'jig rten pa nyid kyi ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ni phal ba yin no zhes bya ba'i dngos dang nye bar btags pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid de ni 'jig rten pa nyid kyi ma yin no //
translated: and the nominal is that which is otherwise.üîΩFor,

original: 'di ltar dngos dang sgro 'dogs la //
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos dang sgro 'dogs la //
translated: The real and the nominal are not different.

original: dngos dang nye bar btags pa'i don dag la ji ltar /
analyzed: dngos dang nye bar btags pa'i don dag la ji ltar /
translated: How are the real and the nominal different in meaning?

original: seng ge mche ba dang mjug ma dang ldan pa chos can mthun pa nyid can la ltos pa med par seng ge'i shes pa 'khrul pa med pa dang / bram ze'i khye'u la seng ge la yod pa'i dpa' ba la sogs pa'i yon tan dang chos mthun pa nyid dang ldan pa las chos mthun pa nyid de la ltos nas nye bar btags pa'i sgo nas seng ge'i sgra dang shes pa 'jug pa nye bar btags pa
analyzed: seng ge mche ba dang mjug ma dang ldan pa chos can mthun pa nyid can la ltos pa med par seng ge'i shes pa 'khrul pa med pa dang / bram ze'i khye'u la seng ge la yod pa'i dpa' ba la sogs pa'i yon tan dang chos mthun pa nyid dang ldan pa las chos mthun pa nyid de la ltos nas nye bar btags pa'i sgo nas seng ge'i sgra dang shes pa 'jug pa nye bar btags pa
translated: The lion‚Äôs roar and awareness are applied to the boy by virtue of his being designated as a lion.

original: yin no // bram ze'i khye'u la seng ge zhes brjod pa na blo ni 'khrul par 'jug par 'gyur ro //üîΩgrags pa'i don bzhin du rus de'i tshe chos mthun par byed pa la ltos pa med par 'gyur ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: yin no // bram ze'i khye'u la seng ge zhes brjod pa na blo ni 'khrul par 'jug par 'gyur ro // grags pa'i don bzhin du rus de'i tshe chos mthun par byed pa la ltos pa med par 'gyur ba med pa yin no //
translated: When the boy is called a lion, the mind engages in error.üîΩBut when the boy is called a lion in accordance with the meaning of the term, there is no error.

original: dngos dang nye bar btags pa'i tha snyad kyi brjod pa 'di yang 'jig rten na yod pa de dor bar rigs pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos dang nye bar btags pa'i tha snyad kyi brjod pa 'di yang 'jig rten na yod pa de dor bar rigs pa yang ma yin no //
translated: It is not right to reject the conventional expressions of real and applied that exist in the world.

original: de bas na bum pa'i shes pa bum pa zhig pa dang / ma skyes pa dag la ma 'khrul pa yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: de bas na bum pa'i shes pa bum pa zhig pa dang / ma skyes pa dag la ma 'khrul pa yin pa de ltar na /
translated: Therefore, the consciousness of a pot is not mistaken in regard to a destroyed pot or an unborn pot.

original: ji ltar na de las sgra 'jug pa nye bar btags pa yin /üîΩbum pa'i spyi la yang spyi'i rgyu mtshan nyid can gyi shes pa ma yin pa de ltar na grags pa nyid kyis de la dngos kyi sgra 'jug pa yin gyi spyi'i rgyu mtshan can ni ma yin pas na gzhan dag la yang dngos dang nye bar btags pa'i
analyzed: ji ltar na de las sgra 'jug pa nye bar btags pa yin / bum pa'i spyi la yang spyi'i rgyu mtshan nyid can gyi shes pa ma yin pa de ltar na grags pa nyid kyis de la dngos kyi sgra 'jug pa yin gyi spyi'i rgyu mtshan can ni ma yin pas na gzhan dag la yang dngos dang nye bar btags pa'i
translated: In that case, how is the term applied to it by way of designation?üîΩAlso, the consciousness that has the universal of pot as its object is not a consciousness that has a universal as its reason. In that case, the term is applied to it by way of what is renowned, but not by way of a universal.

original: mtshan nyid 'jig rten pa nyid kyis byas ba yin na /
analyzed: mtshan nyid 'jig rten pa nyid kyis byas ba yin na /
translated: Therefore, others also have the characteristic of being either actual or designated by way of what is renowned in the world.

original: gnas med pa la zhen pas ci zhig bya /üîΩde bas na don gang la grags @138b bas don min la'ang khyad par dang bral ba la yang /
analyzed: gnas med pa la zhen pas ci zhig bya / de bas na don gang la grags @138b bas don min la'ang khyad par dang bral ba la yang /
translated: What is the use of clinging to that which is baseless?

original: 'gro ba rnams kyis sgra 'god pa /
analyzed: 'gro ba rnams kyis sgra 'god pa /
translated: Therefore, beings apply terms to objects that are renowned, even though they are not objects, and even though they are devoid of distinctions.

original: dper na seng ge'i sgra seng ge la dngos kyi sgra yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na seng ge'i sgra seng ge la dngos kyi sgra yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the term lion is applied to a lion by way of the actual term.

original: de la mtshungs phyir te /
analyzed: de la mtshungs phyir te /
translated: Because it is similar to that.

original: grags pa'i don gyi yon tan gyi cha 'dra ba'i phyir /
analyzed: grags pa'i don gyi yon tan gyi cha 'dra ba'i phyir /
translated: Because of the similarity of the aspect of the quality of the object of the expression.

original: 'khrul rtogs can gzhan phal ba yin //
analyzed: 'khrul rtogs can gzhan phal ba yin //
translated: The other, the ordinary person, is mistaken.

original: shes pa 'khrul pa ste /
analyzed: shes pa 'khrul pa ste /
translated: Consciousness is mistaken.

original: dper na bram ze'i khye'u lta bu'o //üîΩde ltar na 'das pa'i bum pa la sogs pa la yang da ltar gyi bum pa la sogs pa dang 'dra bar 'khrul pa med par nye bar btags pa ma yin pa'i blo 'jug par 'gyur ba de ltar nag nyi ga la yang dngos par gyur pa'i khyad
analyzed: dper na bram ze'i khye'u lta bu'o // de ltar na 'das pa'i bum pa la sogs pa la yang da ltar gyi bum pa la sogs pa dang 'dra bar 'khrul pa med par nye bar btags pa ma yin pa'i blo 'jug par 'gyur ba de ltar nag nyi ga la yang dngos par gyur pa'i khyad
translated: For example, like the consciousness of a brahman youth.üîΩThus, even with respect to a past pot, etc., the mind engages without superimposing the present pot, etc., in the absence of error.

original: par med pa sgra 'jug pa'i phyir nga la klan ka btsal du med pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: par med pa sgra 'jug pa'i phyir nga la klan ka btsal du med pa nyid yin no //
translated: In that way, there is no fault to be ascribed to me, because the word ‚Äúexists‚Äù is used without any difference in the nature of the thing.

original: sbyor ba ni gang shes pa 'khrul pa med pa'i yul yin pa de ni chos de dngos yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang shes pa 'khrul pa med pa'i yul yin pa de ni chos de dngos yin te /
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever is the object of a nonmistaken consciousness is the real nature of that phenomenon,

original: dper na khro bo dang khu yu dag gi shes pa ma 'khrul pa'i yul ba lang gi chos dngos yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na khro bo dang khu yu dag gi shes pa ma 'khrul pa'i yul ba lang gi chos dngos yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: like the real nature of a cow, which is the object of the nonmistaken consciousness of a cowherd.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i bum pa yang shes pa ma 'khrul pa'i yul yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i bum pa yang shes pa ma 'khrul pa'i yul yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: The past and future pot is also the object of nonerroneous consciousness. This is a natural inference.

original: grags pas shes pa ma 'khrul pa gang yin pa de ni dngos yin zhing de'i yon tan gyi chos mthun pa nyid can gyi shes pa 'khrul pa'i yul ni phal ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: grags pas shes pa ma 'khrul pa gang yin pa de ni dngos yin zhing de'i yon tan gyi chos mthun pa nyid can gyi shes pa 'khrul pa'i yul ni phal ba zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is known by the world is a real thing, and the object of a mistaken consciousness that has a quality of similarity to that real thing is called a semblance.

original: 'jig rten pa'i dngos dang phal ba'i mtshan nyid 'di bsal nas /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i dngos dang phal ba'i mtshan nyid 'di bsal nas /
translated: Having refuted the characteristics of real things and semblance things of the world,

original: khyod kyis nye bar btags pa yod pa'i don gyi yul can dngos yin zhing /
analyzed: khyod kyis nye bar btags pa yod pa'i don gyi yul can dngos yin zhing /
translated: you say that the object of a consciousness that is imputed to have an existent object is a real thing,

original: gzhan ni phal pa yin no zhes dngos dang nye bar btags pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de yang 'khrul pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan ni phal pa yin no zhes dngos dang nye bar btags pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de yang 'khrul pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: and that the other is a semblance. The characteristics of real things and imputed things that you state are also mistaken.

original: ji ltar dngos po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ji ltar dngos po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to teach this, it says:

original: ji ltar dngos po nus med la'ang //
analyzed: ji ltar dngos po nus med la'ang //
translated: Just as a thing that is powerless

original: dngos po med pa zhes bya ba'i //
analyzed: dngos po med pa zhes bya ba'i //
translated: Is called ‚Äúnonexistent‚Äù

original: mnyan pa skye bos byas pa yin //
analyzed: mnyan pa skye bos byas pa yin //
translated: By people who listen,

original: dper na 'ga' zhig gis 'ga' zhig las rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis rang gi bum pa la sogs pa la brjod par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu'i rgyu nus pa med pa ni med pa dang 'dra ba'am ri bong gi rva'am mo gsham gyi bu zhes bya ba med parüîΩrjod par byed pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'ga' zhig gis 'ga' zhig las rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis rang gi bum pa la sogs pa la brjod par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu'i rgyu nus pa med pa ni med pa dang 'dra ba'am ri bong gi rva'am mo gsham gyi bu zhes bya ba med par rjod par byed pa lta bu'o //
translated: he is saying that the cause of the pot that he wants to make is not non-existent.

original: de ltar na yod pa la yang med pa'i tha snyad ni thal ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na yod pa la yang med pa'i tha snyad ni thal ba yin no //
translated: Thus, the non-existence of an existent is a reductio.

original: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa med pa la ni bzlog pas dngos yin no //
analyzed: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa med pa la ni bzlog pas dngos yin no //
translated: The existence of a non-existent, such as the horns of a rabbit, is the opposite of that.

original: ji ltar btags bzhin du nus pa med pa'am /
analyzed: ji ltar btags bzhin du nus pa med pa'am /
translated: It is not possible to designate something as existent in the way that it is imagined.

original: nus pa la gtso bo la sogs pa'i mnyan ba skye bos byas pa @139a * //
analyzed: nus pa la gtso bo la sogs pa'i mnyan ba skye bos byas pa @139a * //
translated: The designation of a primary principle, etc., is made by people who are not capable of understanding the way things really are.

original: yin / grangs can gyis kun brtags pa'i gtso bo la sogs pa med na yang ngo //
analyzed: yin / grangs can gyis kun brtags pa'i gtso bo la sogs pa med na yang ngo //
translated: The primary principle, etc., imagined by the Samkhyas do not exist.

original: de 'dra ba yod pa nyid du 'jig rten mi 'dod do //
analyzed: de 'dra ba yod pa nyid du 'jig rten mi 'dod do //
translated: The world does not accept that such things exist.

original: de ltar na de med na yang ji ltar brtags pa bzhin du gtso bo la sogs pa 'jug pa dang / skyes bu 'ga' zhig bya ba du ma nus pa gzhan la mnyan pa 'jug par byed de /
analyzed: de ltar na de med na yang ji ltar brtags pa bzhin du gtso bo la sogs pa 'jug pa dang / skyes bu 'ga' zhig bya ba du ma nus pa gzhan la mnyan pa 'jug par byed de /
translated: Thus, even though it does not exist, the designation of pradhƒÅna, etc. is engaged as imagined, and some person who is not able to perform many actions engages in listening to another.

original: dper na 'di ni gtso dang byed pa po yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / bya ba ldog pa can ji lta kun brtags pa bzhin du 'di ni grangs can gyi skyes bu yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i mnyan pa byed pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'di ni gtso dang byed pa po yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / bya ba ldog pa can ji lta kun brtags pa bzhin du 'di ni grangs can gyi skyes bu yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i mnyan pa byed pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, ‚ÄúThis is the pradhƒÅna, the agent,‚Äù etc., and ‚ÄúThis is the SƒÅ·πÉkhya person,‚Äù etc., in which the action is negated, is like engaging in listening to what is imagined.

original: de la grangs can pa'i 'dod pa med na yang /
analyzed: de la grangs can pa'i 'dod pa med na yang /
translated: Even though the assertion of the SƒÅ·πÉkhya does not exist,

original: sgra 'jug pa ni dngos yin la gzhan du mngon par 'dod pa'i skyes bu'i ni pha la pa yin no //
analyzed: sgra 'jug pa ni dngos yin la gzhan du mngon par 'dod pa'i skyes bu'i ni pha la pa yin no //
translated: the engagement of the term is real, and the person who is the object of the desire is the son of a barren woman.

original: khyod kyi 'dod pas med pa la nye bar btags pa dang dngos po la 'jug pa dngos yin par 'gyur na /
analyzed: khyod kyi 'dod pas med pa la nye bar btags pa dang dngos po la 'jug pa dngos yin par 'gyur na /
translated: If the engagement of the term in the nonexistent that is imputed by your desire and in the existent is real,üîΩthen the engagement of the term in the nonexistent that is imputed by the desire of the SƒÅ·πÉkhya would also be real.

original: de ltar yang ma yin pa de bas na khyed cag gis dngos dang nye bar btags pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'khrul pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar yang ma yin pa de bas na khyed cag gis dngos dang nye bar btags pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'khrul pa yin no //
translated: But since it is not so, therefore your characteristics of the real and the nominal are mistaken.

original: kho bo cag ni spyi dngos por yod pa med par brda ji lta ba bzhin du sgra 'jug pa de ltar na zhen pa med pa nyid du yin no //
analyzed: kho bo cag ni spyi dngos por yod pa med par brda ji lta ba bzhin du sgra 'jug pa de ltar na zhen pa med pa nyid du yin no //
translated: We do not accept that a real universal exists, but we do accept that a word applies according to convention, and that is why we do not accept that there is no object of expression.

original: de de ltar na brjod par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir spyi dngos po med par bstan nas /
analyzed: de de ltar na brjod par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir spyi dngos po med par bstan nas /
translated: Thus, because it is an object of expression and because it is not an object of expression, we have shown that a real universal does not exist.üîΩWhat is the nature of the cognition

original: zhig las sgra las blo ci 'dra //
analyzed: zhig las sgra las blo ci 'dra //
translated: that arises from the word ‚Äúdestroyed‚Äù?

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di nyid kyi rigs pa gzhan ston pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di nyid kyi rigs pa gzhan ston pa yin te /
translated: This very argument shows another reason:üîΩThe cognition that arises from the word ‚Äúdestroyed‚Äù

original: bum pa la sogs pa zhig pa la /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa zhig pa la /
translated: with regard to a destroyed pot, etc.üîΩWhat is the nature of the cognition?üîΩThe cognition that arises from the word ‚Äúundestroyed‚Äù

original: bum pa la sogs pa'i sgra la blo ci 'dra //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa'i sgra la blo ci 'dra //
translated: with regard to an undestroyed pot, etc.

original: snang ba de 'dra blo nyid ma zhig pa la yang snang /
analyzed: snang ba de 'dra blo nyid ma zhig pa la yang snang /
translated: appears in the same way.

original: ji ltar bum par gyur pa dang / bum par 'gyur ba zhes brjod pa na /
analyzed: ji ltar bum par gyur pa dang / bum par 'gyur ba zhes brjod pa na /
translated: When one says ‚Äúa pot that has become‚Äù and ‚Äúa pot that will become,‚Äù

original: bum pa'i shes pa skye ba gang yin pa de ci 'dra bar snang ba de ltar bum pa yod do zhes bya ba'i da ltar gyi bum pa'i yul can gyi sgra las kyang /
analyzed: bum pa'i shes pa skye ba gang yin pa de ci 'dra bar snang ba de ltar bum pa yod do zhes bya ba'i da ltar gyi bum pa'i yul can gyi sgra las kyang /
translated: Whatever is the arising of the consciousness of a pot, just as it appears, so it is that a pot exists.

original: skyes bu'i dbang po'i bya ba mi byed pa'i shes pa de la yang de 'dra ba nyid du snang ngo //
analyzed: skyes bu'i dbang po'i bya ba mi byed pa'i shes pa de la yang de 'dra ba nyid du snang ngo //
translated: Also, in the case of a consciousness that does not engage the activity of a person‚Äôs sense faculty, it appears in just that way.

original: 'on kyang dus dang 'brel ba'i tha dad pa'i khyad par ni yod do //
analyzed: 'on kyang dus dang 'brel ba'i tha dad pa'i khyad par ni yod do //
translated: However, there is a difference in the connection with time.

original: rna ba la sogs rnam par shes //
analyzed: rna ba la sogs rnam par shes //
translated: Ear and so on are consciousnesses

original: don yod can la de dag med //
analyzed: don yod can la de dag med //
translated: that have objects, but those do not.

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa gzugs la sogs pa don yod pa'i yul can skye bar 'gyur ba dag la ni ji skad du bshad pa med pa'i don can gyi yul can gyi shes pa snang ba'i khyad par med pa nyid yod pa ma yin te
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa gzugs la sogs pa don yod pa'i yul can skye bar 'gyur ba dag la ni ji skad du bshad pa med pa'i don can gyi yul can gyi shes pa snang ba'i khyad par med pa nyid yod pa ma yin te
translated: In the case of eye consciousness and so on, which arise with objects such as form that exist, there is no absence of the appearance of a consciousness that has an object that does not exist, as has been explained.

original: / 'di ltar @139b ji ltar don nye ba can gsal bar snang ba'i ngang tshul can zhes bya ba'i chos mi mthun pa nyid can gyis bstan to //
analyzed: / 'di ltar @139b ji ltar don nye ba can gsal bar snang ba'i ngang tshul can zhes bya ba'i chos mi mthun pa nyid can gyis bstan to //
translated: In this way, the fact that it is not a valid means of knowledge is shown by the very fact that it is a means of knowledge, by the very fact that it is a cognition, by the very fact that it is a perception, by the very fact that it is a cognition of a pot, by the very fact that it is a cognition of a present object, by the very fact that it is a cognition of a clear object, by the very fact that it is a cognition of a nearby object.

original: de bas na dngos po med pa'i yul can gyi shes pa'i snang ba las khyad par med pa nyid kyi phyir bum pa yod pa'i yul can gyi sgra'i shes pa dngos po'i yul ma yin no zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na dngos po med pa'i yul can gyi shes pa'i snang ba las khyad par med pa nyid kyi phyir bum pa yod pa'i yul can gyi sgra'i shes pa dngos po'i yul ma yin no zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, because there is no difference from the appearance of a cognition whose object is nonexistent, it should be understood that the auditory cognition whose object is a present pot is not a cognition whose object is a real entity.

original: sbyor ba yang gang dang gang med pa'i don can gyi shes pa las shes pa khyad par med par snang ba yin pa de dang de ni dngos po'i yul can ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba yang gang dang gang med pa'i don can gyi shes pa las shes pa khyad par med par snang ba yin pa de dang de ni dngos po'i yul can ma yin te /
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever cognition appears without difference from a cognition whose object is nonexistent is not a cognition whose object is a real entity,

original: dper na med pa'i don can gyi shes pa las khyad par med par snang ba can 'das pa'i yul can gyi shes pa gnyis pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na med pa'i don can gyi shes pa las khyad par med par snang ba can 'das pa'i yul can gyi shes pa gnyis pa lta bu'o //
translated: like the second cognition whose object is the past, which appears without difference from a cognition whose object is nonexistent.

original: da ltar yul can gyi sgra las byung ba'i shes pa yang med pa'i don can 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i shes pa las khyad par med par snang ba can yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par yod par 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: da ltar yul can gyi sgra las byung ba'i shes pa yang med pa'i don can 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i shes pa las khyad par med par snang ba can yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par yod par 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: The present cognition, which is produced from the sound of the subject, is not different from the past and future cognitions, which are devoid of object.

original: gang gis yang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag shin tu med pa nyid du khas mi len pa de'i yang don byed par rung ba'i gnas skabs kyi srang gi ngo bo dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni snga phyi dag la yod pa nyid ma yin pa
analyzed: gang gis yang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag shin tu med pa nyid du khas mi len pa de'i yang don byed par rung ba'i gnas skabs kyi srang gi ngo bo dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni snga phyi dag la yod pa nyid ma yin pa
translated: The contradictory observation is this: if one does not accept that the past and future are absolutely nonexistent, then the cognition that observes the state of the balance that is capable of effective action does not exist in the past and future.

original: de ltar nag gtan tshigs sam dpe ma grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar nag gtan tshigs sam dpe ma grub pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the reason or example is not unestablished.

original: de ltar 'gyur mod kyi /üîΩspyi tsam 'dzin par byed pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de ltar 'gyur mod kyi / spyi tsam 'dzin par byed pa'i phyir //
translated: This is so,üîΩbut the two cognitions are the same

original: sems gnyis dag ni mtshungs pa yin //
analyzed: sems gnyis dag ni mtshungs pa yin //
translated: because they apprehend a mere universal.

original: da ltar gyi bum pa'i yul can gyi sgra las byung ba'i shes pa gang yin pa dang / med pa'i don can 'das pa la sogs pa'i yul can gyi shes pa gang yin pa de shes pa gnyis po de dag ni spyi kho nas mtshungs pa nyid du snang ba khyad par med pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: da ltar gyi bum pa'i yul can gyi sgra las byung ba'i shes pa gang yin pa dang / med pa'i don can 'das pa la sogs pa'i yul can gyi shes pa gang yin pa de shes pa gnyis po de dag ni spyi kho nas mtshungs pa nyid du snang ba khyad par med pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the expression ‚Äúthe two cognitions are similar in that they appear without distinction‚Äù is that the cognition that arises from the word ‚Äúvase‚Äù in regard to the present vase and the cognition that arises from the word ‚Äúnonexistent‚Äù in regard to the past vase are similar in that they apprehend only the universal.

original: de'i don ni 'di yin te /üîΩ'di ltar spyi tsam 'dzin pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de'i don ni 'di yin te / 'di ltar spyi tsam 'dzin pa nyid yin no //
translated: The meaning of this is as follows:üîΩThe cognition that arises from the word ‚Äúvase‚Äù in regard to the present vase and the cognition that arises from the word ‚Äúnonexistent‚Äù in regard to the past vase are similar in that they apprehend only the universal.

original: de ltar na da ltar gyi bum pa'i yul can gyi sgra las byung ba'i shes pa yang spyi 'ba' zhig yul yin pa de ltar na bum pa zhig pa de la yang spyi yan gar ba gnas pa nyid sgra las byung ba'i shes pas 'dzin pa'i phyir snga
analyzed: de ltar na da ltar gyi bum pa'i yul can gyi sgra las byung ba'i shes pa yang spyi 'ba' zhig yul yin pa de ltar na bum pa zhig pa de la yang spyi yan gar ba gnas pa nyid sgra las byung ba'i shes pas 'dzin pa'i phyir snga
translated: Thus, the cognition that arises from the word ‚Äúvase‚Äù in regard to the present vase has only the universal for its object. In the same way, the cognition that arises from the word ‚Äúnonexistent‚Äù in regard to the past vase has only the universal for its object.

original: ma dang phyi ma dang bar ma'i gnas skabs dag tu bum pa nyid kyi spyi yan gar ba sgra las byung ba'i shes pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid du khas len pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ma dang phyi ma dang bar ma'i gnas skabs dag tu bum pa nyid kyi spyi yan gar ba sgra las byung ba'i shes pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid du khas len pa'i phyir /
translated: Because you accept that the universal of a vase is the cause of the consciousness that arises from the word vase in all three times, the present, past, and future.

original: sgras kun nas bslang ba'i shes pa thams cad mtshungs par snang ba can yin no zhe na /
analyzed: sgras kun nas bslang ba'i shes pa thams cad mtshungs par snang ba can yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, all consciousnesses that are motivated by words have the same appearance.

original: de dang de ni rigs pa ma yin te /üîΩ'di ltar spyi de 'ba' zhig ba nyid dag kyang gsal ba la ltos ba @140a * //
analyzed: de dang de ni rigs pa ma yin te / 'di ltar spyi de 'ba' zhig ba nyid dag kyang gsal ba la ltos ba @140a * //
translated: That is illogical.üîΩBecause if that universal existed alone,

original: med pa na /
analyzed: med pa na /
translated: it would not depend on the particulars.

original: de mtshungs min dang gsal ba min //
analyzed: de mtshungs min dang gsal ba min //
translated: It would not be similar to those, nor would it be a particular.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
translated: And so on.

original: 'dzin pa rnam par bzlog pa yin /
analyzed: 'dzin pa rnam par bzlog pa yin /
translated: Thus, the apprehension of the universal is refuted.

original: gang gis na spyi yan gar ba sgra las 'dzin pa yin na gsal ba'i spyi de gsal bas gsal bar bya bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gis na spyi yan gar ba sgra las 'dzin pa yin na gsal ba'i spyi de gsal bas gsal bar bya bar 'gyur /
translated: If the universal alone were apprehended from the word, then the universal of the particular would be manifested by the particular.

original: skye ba dang rtogs pa'i gzhan gyi dbang gis gzhan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes sngar bstan zin pa nyid kyi phyir spyi yan gar ba 'dzin pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: skye ba dang rtogs pa'i gzhan gyi dbang gis gzhan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes sngar bstan zin pa nyid kyi phyir spyi yan gar ba 'dzin pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Because it is not different due to the other-dependence of arising and realization, as has been previously explained, there is no apprehension of a universal alone.

original: de bas na 'di lan nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'di lan nyid ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is not a response.

original: gzhan yang gang gi phyir de spyi yin pa de nyid kyi phyir de dngos po ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩphan tshun khyad par can dngos rnams //
analyzed: gzhan yang gang gi phyir de spyi yin pa de nyid kyi phyir de dngos po ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir / phan tshun khyad par can dngos rnams //
translated: Moreover, in order to demonstrate that it is not a thing because it is a universal,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩre zhig gdon mi za bar tha dad pa med par 'dod na yang /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / re zhig gdon mi za bar tha dad pa med par 'dod na yang /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThings that are mutually distinctive,‚Äù and so on.üîΩIf one maintains that they are not different,

original: rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis tha dad par khas blang bar bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis tha dad par khas blang bar bya ste /
translated: then one must accept that they are different in some way,

original: 'di de'i rten can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di de'i rten can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because this is the basis of that.

original: gang yang 'gro ba gcig nyid du 'dod pa des kyang rdul dang / mun pa dang / snyir stobs tha dad pa dang / de dag la sems dang ldan pa dang sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa rnams phan tshun 'dod pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: gang yang 'gro ba gcig nyid du 'dod pa des kyang rdul dang / mun pa dang / snyir stobs tha dad pa dang / de dag la sems dang ldan pa dang sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa rnams phan tshun 'dod pa nyid yin no //
translated: Moreover, even those who assert that there is only one world must accept that atoms, darkness, and the great elements are different from each other, and that they are either sentient or insentient.

original: de ltar gzhan la yang rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis gnas skabs la sogs pa'i sgo nas tha dad pa nyid yin pa de ltar na tha dad pa dgag par mi nus pa can yin pas na /
analyzed: de ltar gzhan la yang rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis gnas skabs la sogs pa'i sgo nas tha dad pa nyid yin pa de ltar na tha dad pa dgag par mi nus pa can yin pas na /
translated: In the same way, other things are different from each other in some way, either in terms of their states and so on. Thus, it is impossible to refute their difference.

original: dngos po rnams khyad par can yin no //
analyzed: dngos po rnams khyad par can yin no //
translated: Therefore, things are distinct.

original: dngos po rnams phan tshun khyad par can rnams dngos po'i khyad par spyi'i rang bzhin du ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dngos po rnams phan tshun khyad par can rnams dngos po'i khyad par spyi'i rang bzhin du ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: How could things that are distinct from each other be the nature of a universal that is a distinct thing?

original: mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They could not!

original: khyad par can dang khyad par can ma yin pa phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rang bzhin gnyis ni gcig la yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: khyad par can dang khyad par can ma yin pa phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rang bzhin gnyis ni gcig la yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The nature of distinct and indistinct things cannot exist in one thing, because they are characterized by mutual exclusion.

original: gal te khyad par can gyi ngo bo yin ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te khyad par can gyi ngo bo yin ba de'i tshe /
translated: If it is the nature of the particular,

original: spyi'i ngo bo ma yin no //
analyzed: spyi'i ngo bo ma yin no //
translated: it is not the nature of the universal.

original: sbyor ba ni gang dag 'gal ba'i rang bzhin yin pa de dag ni gcig gi rang bzhin dag ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang dag 'gal ba'i rang bzhin yin pa de dag ni gcig gi rang bzhin dag ma yin te /
translated: The argument is as follows: Those which have mutually exclusive natures cannot have the same nature.

original: dper na bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag so sor nges pa'i rang bzhin lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag so sor nges pa'i rang bzhin lta bu'o //
translated: For example, pleasure and pain have natures that are mutually exclusive.

original: khyad par can dang khyad par can ma yin pa'i ran bzhin rnam grangs ma yin pa dag kyang 'gal ba yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par can dang khyad par can ma yin pa'i ran bzhin rnam grangs ma yin pa dag kyang 'gal ba yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: The particular and the universal are also mutually exclusive, in the sense that they are not synonyms.

original: ngo bo nyid gnyis yod na yang //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gnyis yod na yang //
translated: Even if they have two natures,

original: gal te dngos po la khyad par can dang // khyad par can ma yin pa'i rang bzhin gnyis yod pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te dngos po la khyad par can dang // khyad par can ma yin pa'i rang bzhin gnyis yod pa de'i tshe /
translated: if a thing has both a particular and a universal nature,

original: de dngos gcig tu ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: de dngos gcig tu ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: how can it be a single entity?

original: khyad par can ma yin pa las @140b khyad par can gzhan yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: khyad par can ma yin pa las @140b khyad par can gzhan yin pa de ltar na /
translated: If the particular is different from the universal,

original: dngos po gnyis su 'gyur gyi dngos po gcig ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po gnyis su 'gyur gyi dngos po gcig ni ma yin no //
translated: then there are two entities, not one.

original: de bas na dngos po khyad par can gang yin pa de dag ni gang dag dang mtshungs pa'i ngo bor 'dod na /
analyzed: de bas na dngos po khyad par can gang yin pa de dag ni gang dag dang mtshungs pa'i ngo bor 'dod na /
translated: Therefore, those things that are qualified are the same in nature as those things that are qualified.

original: de las de ste spyi ngo bo gzhan nyid du 'gyur /
analyzed: de las de ste spyi ngo bo gzhan nyid du 'gyur /
translated: In that case, the universal would be different from those things that are qualified.

original: de ltar na spyi tha dad pa med pa mi rung ngo //üîΩde ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar na spyi tha dad pa med pa mi rung ngo // de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: Thus, it is not tenable that the universal is not different.üîΩThis is so, but

original: gal te de ltar ngo mtshungs na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar ngo mtshungs na /
translated: if they are the same,

original: gang gis skyi tha dad pa med pa de'i skyon de yin gyi gang gis gsal ba las tha dad pa'i khyad par can gang yin pa de dag las khyad par can ma yin pa gzhan nyid yin no //
analyzed: gang gis skyi tha dad pa med pa de'i skyon de yin gyi gang gis gsal ba las tha dad pa'i khyad par can gang yin pa de dag las khyad par can ma yin pa gzhan nyid yin no //
translated: then the error that the universal is not different from those things that are qualified would be the same as the error that those things that are qualified are different from those things that are qualified.

original: 'on kyang spyi dang ldan pa gnyis po de dag mtshungs pa ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang spyi dang ldan pa gnyis po de dag mtshungs pa ste /
translated: However, those two, the universal and those things that possess the universal, are the same.

original: spyi dang khyad par med pa can gyi ngo bo yin no zhe na /
analyzed: spyi dang khyad par med pa can gyi ngo bo yin no zhe na /
translated: The nature of those things that possess the universal is not different from the universal.

original: gal te de ltar yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te de ltar yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: If that is so,

original: spyi de dang ldan pa phan tshun phan gdags par bya ba dang / phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid ma yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: spyi de dang ldan pa phan tshun phan gdags par bya ba dang / phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid ma yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: then the universal and those things that possess the universal would not be mutually related as that which benefits and that which is benefited.

original: de dag gis spyi de zhes bya ba'i don dam pa'i 'brel ba med pa ste mi rung ngo //üîΩde 'dod ni 'brel pa can gzhan gyis kyang gzhan dag dang mtshungs pa ni ma yin no zhes bya bas yang bstan zin to //
analyzed: de dag gis spyi de zhes bya ba'i don dam pa'i 'brel ba med pa ste mi rung ngo // de 'dod ni 'brel pa can gzhan gyis kyang gzhan dag dang mtshungs pa ni ma yin no zhes bya bas yang bstan zin to //
translated: Thus, the so-called universal is not a real entity.üîΩIf you accept that, then it is established that the universal is not the same as the particulars, as has already been demonstrated.

original: de de ltar na spyi dngos por gyur pa gzhan dang gzhan ma yin pa mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de de ltar na spyi dngos por gyur pa gzhan dang gzhan ma yin pa mi rung ngo //
translated: Thus, the universal is not a real entity that is either the same as or different from the particulars.

original: ldog pa la ni sun 'byin med //
analyzed: ldog pa la ni sun 'byin med //
translated: There is no refutation of the exclusion.

original: gang gis yang spyi gzhan rnam par gcod pa tsam yin pa de'i de ni dngos po ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: gang gis yang spyi gzhan rnam par gcod pa tsam yin pa de'i de ni dngos po ma yin pa ste /
translated: The universal is the mere exclusion of other, and it is not a real entity.

original: de ltar na gzhan nyid dang gzhan nyid ma yin pa'i skyon yod pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: de ltar na gzhan nyid dang gzhan nyid ma yin pa'i skyon yod pa ma yin zhing /
translated: Thus, the errors of being the same as or different from the particulars do not occur.

original: thams cad la rnam par gcod pa mtshungs pa yod pa yin no //
analyzed: thams cad la rnam par gcod pa mtshungs pa yod pa yin no //
translated: And the exclusion of everything else is the same in all cases.

original: de ltar na ji ltar gcig gi mdzub mo'i sdigs mdzub mthe bong las tha dad pa de ltar lhag ma rnams la yang de las tha dad pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na ji ltar gcig gi mdzub mo'i sdigs mdzub mthe bong las tha dad pa de ltar lhag ma rnams la yang de las tha dad pa nyid yin no //
translated: Just as the index finger is different from the thumb, so the remaining fingers are also different from the thumb.

original: mthe bong gcig las tha dad pa gang yin pa de nyid mthe bong ma yin pa de nyid du tha dad pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: mthe bong gcig las tha dad pa gang yin pa de nyid mthe bong ma yin pa de nyid du tha dad pa med pa yin te /
translated: Whatever is different from a single thumb is not a thumb, and whatever is not a thumb is not different from a thumb.

original: tha dad pa med pa'i tha snyad kyi rten yin zhing /
analyzed: tha dad pa med pa'i tha snyad kyi rten yin zhing /
translated: It is the basis for the convention of nondifference.

original: de yang rnam par gcod pa'i ngo bo ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang rnam par gcod pa'i ngo bo ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, it is not the nature of exclusion.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de nyid dang gzhan nyid 'gyur pa'i ngang tshul can gyi rten pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de nyid dang gzhan nyid 'gyur pa'i ngang tshul can gyi rten pa ma yin no //
translated: For that very reason, it is not the substratum of difference and identity.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar spyi nyid yin na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar spyi nyid yin na /
translated: Since it is a universal in that way,üîΩit is not the nature of an entity.

original: dngos po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa de'i phyir na mtshungs pa nyid /
analyzed: dngos po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa de'i phyir na mtshungs pa nyid /
translated: Therefore, this is the summary:

original: spyi 'di dngos med mtshan nyid yin //
analyzed: spyi 'di dngos med mtshan nyid yin //
translated: A universal is defined as a nonentity.

original: dngos po la mtshungs nyid yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po la mtshungs nyid yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdus pa'o //
translated: Because sameness does not exist in entities.

original: gzhan yang spyi dngos por gyur pa gang yin pa de ci 'bras bu nyid yin nam /üîΩ'on te @141a * //üîΩ'bras bu ma yin /
analyzed: gzhan yang spyi dngos por gyur pa gang yin pa de ci 'bras bu nyid yin nam / 'on te @141a * // 'bras bu ma yin /
translated: Moreover, if a universal is an entity, is it an effect or not?üîΩIf it is an effect,

original: gal te de 'bras bu yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te de 'bras bu yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: then it is not a universal.

original: skye ba dang ldan pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skye ba dang ldan pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is endowed with arising,

original: rang bzhin gzhan dang gzhan nyid kyis du mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gzhan dang gzhan nyid kyis du mar 'gyur ro //
translated: it would be multiple due to having different natures.

original: de bas na spyi'i mtshan nyid gcig nyid nyams par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de bas na spyi'i mtshan nyid gcig nyid nyams par 'gyur na /
translated: Therefore, if the single universal is destroyed,

original: de yang 'jig par mi 'dod do //
analyzed: de yang 'jig par mi 'dod do //
translated: but it is not accepted that it is destroyed.

original: 'bras bu nyid yin pa'i stobs kyis kyang spyi mi rtag par 'gyur na de mi rtag par mi 'dod do //
analyzed: 'bras bu nyid yin pa'i stobs kyis kyang spyi mi rtag par 'gyur na de mi rtag par mi 'dod do //
translated: Also, because of the power of being the effect, the universal would be impermanent, but it is not accepted that it is impermanent.

original: de ltar spyi dngos por smra bas de 'bras bung khas blang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar spyi dngos por smra bas de 'bras bung khas blang bar mi bya'o //
translated: Thus, the proponent of real universals should not accept that it is an effect.üîΩMoreover,

original: gzhan yang / 'jig pa dngos po tsam dang ni //
analyzed: gzhan yang / 'jig pa dngos po tsam dang ni //
translated: because destruction is related to mere entities

original: rjes 'brel phyir na /
analyzed: rjes 'brel phyir na /
translated: and because it is related to the subsequent,

original: skad cig ma nyid yin no //
analyzed: skad cig ma nyid yin no //
translated: it is momentary.

original: 'jig pa ni dngos po tsam dang 'brel pa can nyid yin no zhes bstan zin to //
analyzed: 'jig pa ni dngos po tsam dang 'brel pa can nyid yin no zhes bstan zin to //
translated: It has been demonstrated that destruction is related to mere entities.

original: des na gal te spyi dngos po yin pa de'i tshe gdon mi za bar 'jig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na gal te spyi dngos po yin pa de'i tshe gdon mi za bar 'jig par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, if the universal is an entity, then without doubt it is destroyed.

original: de lta ma yin na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na /
translated: If it is not like that,

original: dngos po med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: then it would be a nonentity.

original: dngos po nyid yin na yang spyi ni /
analyzed: dngos po nyid yin na yang spyi ni /
translated: Even if it is an entity, the universal

original: rtag nyid min /
analyzed: rtag nyid min /
translated: It is not permanent.

original: mi rtag pa nyid yin na yang du ma nyid yin pa'i phyir de ltar spyi nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid yin na yang du ma nyid yin pa'i phyir de ltar spyi nyid ma yin no //
translated: And if it is impermanent, it is not a universal because it is multiple.

original: 'on te 'bras bu ma yin na /
analyzed: 'on te 'bras bu ma yin na /
translated: But if it is not an effect,

original: rigs rnams 'brel ba med pa yang //
analyzed: rigs rnams 'brel ba med pa yang //
translated: the universals are unrelated.

original: 'bras min phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras min phyir ro //
translated: Because they are not effects.

original: spyi rnams ni de dang ldan pa dang lhan cig 'di'i 'di zhes bya ba'i 'brel pa yang mi rung ngo zhes bya ba yang /üîΩltos pa zhes bya ba 'bras bur brjod //
analyzed: spyi rnams ni de dang ldan pa dang lhan cig 'di'i 'di zhes bya ba'i 'brel pa yang mi rung ngo zhes bya ba yang / ltos pa zhes bya ba 'bras bur brjod //
translated: And it is not tenable that universals are related to that which possesses them, as in ‚Äúthis is of that.‚Äù

original: ces bya ba'i skabs su bshad zin to //
analyzed: ces bya ba'i skabs su bshad zin to //
translated: We have already explained this in the section on ‚Äúdependence‚Äù as referring to an effect.

original: rigs rnams / ngo bo nyid med 'bras min phyir //
analyzed: rigs rnams / ngo bo nyid med 'bras min phyir //
translated: The universals are not effects,

original: rang bzhin med pa nyid yin te //
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa nyid yin te //
translated: therefore they are essenceless.

original: skye ba dang ldan pa gang yin pa de ni rang bzhin nyid yin la gzhan ni med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba dang ldan pa gang yin pa de ni rang bzhin nyid yin la gzhan ni med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That which possesses arising is an essence, and that which does not is not an essence.

original: 'bras bu ma yin pa ni bskyed par bya ba ma yin zhing /
analyzed: 'bras bu ma yin pa ni bskyed par bya ba ma yin zhing /
translated: That which is not an effect is not produced.

original: spyi ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: spyi ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: And universals do not exist.

original: 'dis kyang sgra las byung ba'i shes pa'i yul dngos po ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dis kyang sgra las byung ba'i shes pa'i yul dngos po ma yin te /
translated: This also shows that the object of the cognition that arises from words is not a real thing.

original: 'di ltar dngos po'i stobs las skyes pa'i shes pa gang de /
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po'i stobs las skyes pa'i shes pa gang de /
translated: In this way, the cognition that arises from the power of a real entity

original: dper na mig la sogs pa'i shes pa /
analyzed: dper na mig la sogs pa'i shes pa /
translated: is like the cognition of the eye, etc.

original: brda dag la /
analyzed: brda dag la /
translated: with regard to the conventional symbol.

original: brda'i dran pa la ltos pa ma yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: brda'i dran pa la ltos pa ma yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: It does not depend on the memory of the conventional symbol.

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is it, then?

original: dngos po rung ba nyid thag nye ba tsam las 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can yin no //
analyzed: dngos po rung ba nyid thag nye ba tsam las 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can yin no //
translated: It arises from the mere proximity of the real entity.

original: spyi ni blo la de dag ste /
analyzed: spyi ni blo la de dag ste /
translated: The universal is the cognition of those

original: brda la ltas pa med pa nyid /
analyzed: brda la ltas pa med pa nyid /
translated: without regard to the conventional symbol.

original: snang mi 'gyur /
analyzed: snang mi 'gyur /
translated: It does not appear.

original: 'on kyang brda dran pa la ltos pa nyid spyi'i blor 'gyur ba de ltar na de dngos po'i yul can ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang brda dran pa la ltos pa nyid spyi'i blor 'gyur ba de ltar na de dngos po'i yul can ma yin no //
translated: However, the cognition of the universal is dependent on the memory of the conventional symbol. Thus, it does not have a real entity for its object.

original: sbyor pa yang gang zhig brda dran pa la ltos pa'i shes pa'i @141b yul yin pa de ni dngos po ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor pa yang gang zhig brda dran pa la ltos pa'i shes pa'i @141b yul yin pa de ni dngos po ma yin te /
translated: Nor is the connection a real entity, for it is the object of a cognition that depends on the memory of the conventional symbol.

original: dper na sgra'i don gtso bo'am /
analyzed: dper na sgra'i don gtso bo'am /
translated: For example, the meaning of the word ‚Äúprimary‚Äù or ‚Äúchief‚Äù is not a real entity.

original: dper na sgra'i don dngos po thams cad skad cig ma re rer mi gnas par 'jig pa'i ngang tshul can yin no zhes bya ba'am sgra'i don 'phrod pa 'du ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na sgra'i don dngos po thams cad skad cig ma re rer mi gnas par 'jig pa'i ngang tshul can yin no zhes bya ba'am sgra'i don 'phrod pa 'du ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the meaning of the word ‚Äúsound‚Äù is that all things are momentary, and the meaning of the word ‚Äúmeeting‚Äù is that things come together.

original: ba lang nyid la sogs pa'i sgra'i don dag kyang brda'i dran pa ltos pa'i shes pa'i yul ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: ba lang nyid la sogs pa'i sgra'i don dag kyang brda'i dran pa ltos pa'i shes pa'i yul ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: The meaning of the words ‚Äúcow‚Äù and ‚Äúhorseness‚Äù are not the objects of a cognition that depends on the memory of a sign.

original: gal te gsal ba'i khyad par khra bo nyid mthong ba la ba lang gi tha snyad ma bzung ba'i rta la sogs pa mthong ba na /
analyzed: gal te gsal ba'i khyad par khra bo nyid mthong ba la ba lang gi tha snyad ma bzung ba'i rta la sogs pa mthong ba na /
translated: If one sees a variegated cow, and then sees a horse, which is not associated with the term ‚Äúcow,‚Äù

original: kho bos don gang yin pa de dang 'dir sngar mthong ngo zhes mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: kho bos don gang yin pa de dang 'dir sngar mthong ngo zhes mi 'gyur la /
translated: one does not think, ‚ÄúThe object that I saw before is this.‚Äù

original: khu yu mthong bas na /
analyzed: khu yu mthong bas na /
translated: But when one sees a variegated horse,

original: khyad par gang la yang the tshom med par de nyid 'di yin no zhes brda la ltos pa med par rjes su 'jug pa spyi'i shes pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyad par gang la yang the tshom med par de nyid 'di yin no zhes brda la ltos pa med par rjes su 'jug pa spyi'i shes pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: one has no doubt about any particular thing, and one engages in it without depending on a sign, and a cognition of the universal occurs.

original: de bas na spyi mthong bas byas pa yin no zhes rtogs pa de'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de bas na spyi mthong bas byas pa yin no zhes rtogs pa de'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, the reason is unestablished, since it is understood that the universal is seen because of the effect.

original: de ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: 'di ltar 'bras bu mtshungs pa can //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'bras bu mtshungs pa can //
translated: Because of the similarity of the effect,üîΩsome cognitions see the nature itself,

original: dngos nyid mthong ba blo 'ga' zhig / brda med na yang tha dad min //
analyzed: dngos nyid mthong ba blo 'ga' zhig / brda med na yang tha dad min //
translated: and even without a convention, they are not different.

original: rjes su 'jug pa gang yin te //
analyzed: rjes su 'jug pa gang yin te //
translated: What is it that follows?

original: don nye ba dang 'brel can yin //
analyzed: don nye ba dang 'brel can yin //
translated: It is connected with the object that is present.

original: gang dag mthong ba yod na ji ltar khro bo dang / khu yu dag la 'di ba lang yin zhing 'dir yang ba lang yin no zhes blo rjes su 'jug pa de'i don de dag ngo bo nyid kyis don tha dad pa blo gcig pa can de'i 'bras bu nyid yod pa yin no //
analyzed: gang dag mthong ba yod na ji ltar khro bo dang / khu yu dag la 'di ba lang yin zhing 'dir yang ba lang yin no zhes blo rjes su 'jug pa de'i don de dag ngo bo nyid kyis don tha dad pa blo gcig pa can de'i 'bras bu nyid yod pa yin no //
translated: When those who see a cow and a horse think, ‚ÄúThis is a cow,‚Äù and ‚ÄúThis is a horse,‚Äù the cognition that follows is the effect of those two, which have a different nature but the same cognition.

original: de bas na blo gcig pa de dag gi 'bras bu yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: de bas na blo gcig pa de dag gi 'bras bu yin pa de ltar na /
translated: Therefore, since they are the effect of that single cognition,

original: de dag nyid des bzung ba yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de dag nyid des bzung ba yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: it is said that they are apprehended by that.

original: de bas na blo de ni gsal ba'i rgyu mtshan can nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: de bas na blo de ni gsal ba'i rgyu mtshan can nyid yin gyi /
translated: Thus, that cognition has a clear sign.

original: rigs kyi rgyu mtshan can ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rigs kyi rgyu mtshan can ni ma yin no //
translated: but not on the basis of a universal.

original: dngos po de dag gis rang bzhin gyi khyad par de nyid de 'dra ba'i rang bzhin yin no zhes brjod do //
analyzed: dngos po de dag gis rang bzhin gyi khyad par de nyid de 'dra ba'i rang bzhin yin no zhes brjod do //
translated: The specific nature of those entities is just that: a specific nature of that kind.

original: de nyid ni ji ltar /
analyzed: de nyid ni ji ltar /
translated: How is that so?

original: rigs med par shes pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: rigs med par shes pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
translated: He explains: ‚Äúbecause of the absence of a universal, etc.‚Äù

original: ji ltar rigs med par mig sogs nye 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar rigs med par mig sogs nye 'dod pa'o //
translated: How is it that the eye, etc. are desired as a cause?

original: ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: What kind of cause?

original: shes pa'i 'bras can te /
analyzed: shes pa'i 'bras can te /
translated: One that has the result of consciousness.

original: gang la shes pa'i 'bras bu yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: gang la shes pa'i 'bras bu yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúone that has the result of consciousness‚Äù is a tatpuru·π£a compound.

original: ji ltar spyi med du zin kyang /
analyzed: ji ltar spyi med du zin kyang /
translated: Even though there is no universal,

original: dbang po dang snang ba dang / yid la byed pa mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba dag gis kyang /
analyzed: dbang po dang snang ba dang / yid la byed pa mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba dag gis kyang /
translated: the eye, etc. that are different in kind

original: gzugs kyi rnam par @142a * //
analyzed: gzugs kyi rnam par @142a * //
translated: produce a single consciousness of form.

original: shes pa gcig skyed par byed pa de ltar khra bo la sogs pa phan tshun 'dra ba med na yang /
analyzed: shes pa gcig skyed par byed pa de ltar khra bo la sogs pa phan tshun 'dra ba med na yang /
translated: In the same way, even though there is no mutual similarity in a multicolored object, etc.,

original: ngo bo nyid kyis 'bras bu gcig byed pa'i nus pa so sor nges pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis 'bras bu gcig byed pa'i nus pa so sor nges pa'i phyir /
translated: because of the restriction of the capacity to produce a single effect by way of their intrinsic nature,

original: de 'dra ba'i rang gi yul can gyi blo skyed par byed la /
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i rang gi yul can gyi blo skyed par byed la /
translated: It is the cause of the arising of the cognition that has it as its object.

original: gang gis ngo bo nyid kyis rnam pa gcig rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi shes pa skyed par byed do //
analyzed: gang gis ngo bo nyid kyis rnam pa gcig rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi shes pa skyed par byed do //
translated: It is the cause of the arising of the cognition that has the nature of the realization of a single aspect.

original: de ni 'bras bu gcig pa can nyid nye ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'bras bu gcig pa can nyid nye ba yin no //
translated: It is the cause of the single effect.

original: 'di nyid ni gcig gi rjes su 'jug pa'i blo'i rten yin no //üîΩgang gis rnam par phye ba yis //
analyzed: 'di nyid ni gcig gi rjes su 'jug pa'i blo'i rten yin no // gang gis rnam par phye ba yis //
translated: It is the basis of the cognition that follows after the single effect.üîΩThe universal is what causes

original: rigs ni rjes su 'gro bar byed //üîΩji ltar ba lang dang 'brel ba can gyi rigs de nyid khra bo dang khu yu la sogs pa la rjes su 'gro bar byed cing /
analyzed: rigs ni rjes su 'gro bar byed // ji ltar ba lang dang 'brel ba can gyi rigs de nyid khra bo dang khu yu la sogs pa la rjes su 'gro bar byed cing /
translated: the cognition to be differentiated.üîΩJust as the universal that is related to the cow causes the cognition to be differentiated with regard to the cow,

original: rta dang ba lang la sogs pa tha dad par mtshungs pa la ci'i phyir ma yin /
analyzed: rta dang ba lang la sogs pa tha dad par mtshungs pa la ci'i phyir ma yin /
translated: why does it not cause the cognition to be differentiated with regard to the horse, the elephant, etc.?

original: de la gsal ba rnams 'bras bu gcig byed par nus pas rigs rjes su 'gro bar byed cing gang la nus pa de med bde la tha dad pa yod na yang rigs rjes su 'jug pa ma yin no zhes bya ba de brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de la gsal ba rnams 'bras bu gcig byed par nus pas rigs rjes su 'gro bar byed cing gang la nus pa de med bde la tha dad pa yod na yang rigs rjes su 'jug pa ma yin no zhes bya ba de brjod par bya'o //
translated: The following should be stated: ‚ÄúThat which is capable of producing a single effect is a homogeneous cause, and that which is not capable of producing that effect is not a homogeneous cause, even if it exists as a separate entity.‚Äù

original: 'bras bu gcig byed par nus pa yang gcig gi rjes su 'gro ba can ma yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu gcig byed par nus pa yang gcig gi rjes su 'gro ba can ma yin te /
translated: Also, that which is capable of producing a single effect is not a homogeneous cause.

original: de'i rjes su 'gro ba ni nus pa gzhan gyi rjes su 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid kyi nus pa gzhan dang gzhan gyi rjes su 'gro zhing rjes su 'brang bas thug pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rjes su 'gro ba ni nus pa gzhan gyi rjes su 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid kyi nus pa gzhan dang gzhan gyi rjes su 'gro zhing rjes su 'brang bas thug pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because if it were a homogeneous cause, then the cause would be endless, since it would follow that the cause would follow another cause, and that cause would follow another cause, and so on.

original: de bas na tha dad pa yod na yang 'bras bu gcig nyid mtshan nyid can nye bas rnam par phye bas rigs rjes su 'gro bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na tha dad pa yod na yang 'bras bu gcig nyid mtshan nyid can nye bas rnam par phye bas rigs rjes su 'gro bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, even if there is a separate entity, it is a homogeneous cause if it has the characteristic of producing a single effect.

original: nye ba de nyid rjes su 'gro ba can gyi shes pa'i rgyu mtshan can yin pa de ltar na 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: nye ba de nyid rjes su 'gro ba can gyi shes pa'i rgyu mtshan can yin pa de ltar na 'gal ba med do //
translated: That proximity is the reason for the cognition that follows is not contradictory.

original: 'dis kyang spyi dngos po ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dis kyang spyi dngos po ma yin no //
translated: But this is not a universal.

original: rnam pa 'gas kyang rnam shes la //
analyzed: rnam pa 'gas kyang rnam shes la //
translated: Because the consciousness

original: dngos po snang ba med phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po snang ba med phyir ro //
translated: does not appear as the thing.

original: spyi de'i ngo bo ste rang bzhin gang yin pa de snang ba nyid du 'dod pa rang nyid 'dzin par khas len pa'i shes pa gsal bas dben par mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi de'i ngo bo ste rang bzhin gang yin pa de snang ba nyid du 'dod pa rang nyid 'dzin par khas len pa'i shes pa gsal bas dben par mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The nature, or essence, of that universal, which is asserted to be the appearance itself, does not appear devoid of the clarity that is accepted as the apprehending consciousness.

original: gal te spyi dngos po yod pa dang / snang ba yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te spyi dngos po yod pa dang / snang ba yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: If the universal were an existent thing and were an appearance,

original: de med par rang nyid 'dzin pa'i shes pa la bdag gi rang gi ngo bo nyid snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de med par rang nyid 'dzin pa'i shes pa la bdag gi rang gi ngo bo nyid snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then, when it is absent, the consciousness apprehending it would appear to have the nature of its own essence.

original: yul gcig pa can dbang po gcig gis gzung bar bya ba dag tu gyur pa la yang /
analyzed: yul gcig pa can dbang po gcig gis gzung bar bya ba dag tu gyur pa la yang /
translated: And even if they were the same object and were apprehended by the same sense faculty,

original: rang rang gi ngo bor rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rang rang gi ngo bor rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: they would be cognized as having their own individual natures.

original: dper na rlung dang nyi ma'i reg bya dag lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na rlung dang nyi ma'i reg bya dag lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the tactile sensations of wind and sun.

original: de bas @142b na gal te spyir 'gyur ba de'i tshe yang mthong bar 'gyur zhing snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas @142b na gal te spyir 'gyur ba de'i tshe yang mthong bar 'gyur zhing snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, if it were a universal, it would also be seen and would appear.

original: bzung du zin kyang nges pa ma yin na /
analyzed: bzung du zin kyang nges pa ma yin na /
translated: Even if it were apprehended, it would not be ascertained.

original: shes pa dang brjod pa 'jug pa des byas pa ma yin pa de ltar na rnam par rtog pa de don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes pa dang brjod pa 'jug pa des byas pa ma yin pa de ltar na rnam par rtog pa de don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not produced by the engagement of cognition and expression, then that conceptualization would be pointless.

original: sbyor ba ni gang gi ngo bo rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis kyang 'dzin par 'dod pa'i shes pa la gang dben par mi snang ba de ni de las tha dad par yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang gi ngo bo rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis kyang 'dzin par 'dod pa'i shes pa la gang dben par mi snang ba de ni de las tha dad par yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The application is this: Whatever is not seen as separate from the cognition that is asserted to apprehend it in some way does not exist separately from it,

original: dper na des spyi 'dzin pa'i shes pa la spyi gzhan mi snang ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na des spyi 'dzin pa'i shes pa la spyi gzhan mi snang ba lta bu'o //
translated: just as, for example, another universal does not appear to the cognition that apprehends a universal.

original: spyi'i ngo bo yang spyi 'dzin pa nyid du 'dod pa'i shes pa la gsal ba'i ngo bo las tha dad par snang ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: spyi'i ngo bo yang spyi 'dzin pa nyid du 'dod pa'i shes pa la gsal ba'i ngo bo las tha dad par snang ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: And the universal itself does not appear as separate from the manifest entity to the cognition that asserts the apprehension of the universal. This is the non-observation of the pervader.

original: gal te mig la sogs pa'i dbang po'i gzugs rnam par shes pa la mi snang mod kyi /
analyzed: gal te mig la sogs pa'i dbang po'i gzugs rnam par shes pa la mi snang mod kyi /
translated: Even though the form of the sense faculties such as the eyes does not appear to consciousness,

original: 'on kyang gzugs la sogs pa las tha dad par de dag yod pa ma yin pa de ltar na gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on kyang gzugs la sogs pa las tha dad par de dag yod pa ma yin pa de ltar na gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if they do not exist separately from form, etc., then your reason is not established.

original: de ni de ltar ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni de ltar ma yin te /
translated: This is not so.

original: 'di ltar dbang po de dag ni mngon sum gyi rang bzhin nyid ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar dbang po de dag ni mngon sum gyi rang bzhin nyid ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: For those faculties are not of the nature of direct perception.

original: tshu rol mthong bas rang gi ngo bo rig pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tshu rol mthong bas rang gi ngo bo rig pa ma yin no //
translated: The one who sees only what is near cannot know their nature.

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /üîΩmngon sum gyi shes pa 'bras bu 'ga' zhig gi tshe /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na / mngon sum gyi shes pa 'bras bu 'ga' zhig gi tshe /
translated: What is it then?

original: yul yod pa dag la yang 'jug pa dang ldog pa yang mthong ba de ni rgyu gzhan ston pa yin no //
analyzed: yul yod pa dag la yang 'jug pa dang ldog pa yang mthong ba de ni rgyu gzhan ston pa yin no //
translated: Sometimes the result of direct perception is the engagement and withdrawal of the faculties in relation to existent objects.üîΩThat is the cause of the faculties.

original: des brjod pa'i gzugs ci yang rung ba dbang po zhes bya bar tha snyad gdags pa yin no //üîΩgal te dbang po rnams dbang po las 'das pa'i don mthong ba'i skyes bu lta ba por 'gyur ba de'i tshe rang gi ngo bo 'dzin pa'i shes pa la /
analyzed: des brjod pa'i gzugs ci yang rung ba dbang po zhes bya bar tha snyad gdags pa yin no // gal te dbang po rnams dbang po las 'das pa'i don mthong ba'i skyes bu lta ba por 'gyur ba de'i tshe rang gi ngo bo 'dzin pa'i shes pa la /
translated: The form that is expressed by that is designated as a faculty.

original: de yi lus ni snang 'gyur te //
analyzed: de yi lus ni snang 'gyur te //
translated: If the faculties were the seer, like a person who sees forms beyond the range of the faculties, then the body would appear to the consciousness that apprehends its own nature.üîΩBut that is not so.

original: dbang po'i gzugs yin pa de ltar na the tshom med pa yin no //
analyzed: dbang po'i gzugs yin pa de ltar na the tshom med pa yin no //
translated: If it were the form of a sense faculty, then there would be no doubt.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: gzugs ldan phyir te /
analyzed: gzugs ldan phyir te /
translated: Because it has form.

original: dbang po'i rang bzhin dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po'i rang bzhin dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it has the nature of a sense faculty.

original: de bas na rang nyid 'dzin par 'dod pa'i mngon sum gyi shes pa la gang mi snang ba zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don yin ba de bas na nges pa la yin no //
analyzed: de bas na rang nyid 'dzin par 'dod pa'i mngon sum gyi shes pa la gang mi snang ba zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don yin ba de bas na nges pa la yin no //
translated: Therefore, in a direct perception that wishes to apprehend itself, the meaning of the reason ‚Äúbecause it does not appear‚Äù is that it is ascertained.

original: ji ltar dbang po'i ngo bo rang nyid mthong ba po yod na /
analyzed: ji ltar dbang po'i ngo bo rang nyid mthong ba po yod na /
translated: Just as the nature of a sense faculty is seen by itself,

original: rang gi shes pa la snang ba de ltar mngon sum gyis shes pa la rigs kyi ngo bo min te /
analyzed: rang gi shes pa la snang ba de ltar mngon sum gyis shes pa la rigs kyi ngo bo min te /
translated: the nature of a class is not seen by direct perception in the way that it appears to its cognition.

original: yan gar mthong ba med phyir ro //
analyzed: yan gar mthong ba med phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not seen separately.

original: gsal bas dpen par rigs kyi ngo bo mthong ba med pa'i @143a * //
analyzed: gsal bas dpen par rigs kyi ngo bo mthong ba med pa'i @143a * //
translated: Because the nature of a class is not seen separately by a clear [cognition].

original: rgyu'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the cause.

original: gsal ba 'dzin tshe na'ang de sgra dang // ngo bo las gzhan snang ba med //
analyzed: gsal ba 'dzin tshe na'ang de sgra dang // ngo bo las gzhan snang ba med //
translated: Even when a clear [cognition] apprehends it, there is no appearance of anything other than its own nature.

original: gsal ba 'dzin pa na gsal ba de'i ming gang yin pa dang de'i kha dog la sogs pa gang yin pa de nyid 'ba' zhig snang gi de las tha dad par gzhan spyi snang ba med do //
analyzed: gsal ba 'dzin pa na gsal ba de'i ming gang yin pa dang de'i kha dog la sogs pa gang yin pa de nyid 'ba' zhig snang gi de las tha dad par gzhan spyi snang ba med do //
translated: When a clear image is apprehended, only the name of that clear image and its color and so on appear, but apart from that, no other universal appears.

original: gang gi tshe rang nyid 'dzin par 'dod pa'i shes pa la spyi'i ngo bo mi snang ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rang nyid 'dzin par 'dod pa'i shes pa la spyi'i ngo bo mi snang ba de'i tshe /
translated: When the nature of the object that one wishes to apprehend does not appear to consciousness,

original: de ni de'i rnam par shes pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni de'i rnam par shes pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then it is not the consciousness of that object.

original: gang gi ngo bo gang la snang ba de ni de'i shes pa yin na /üîΩrang nyid 'dzin par 'dod pa'i shes pa spyi mi snang ba de ltar na de'i shes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi ngo bo gang la snang ba de ni de'i shes pa yin na / rang nyid 'dzin par 'dod pa'i shes pa spyi mi snang ba de ltar na de'i shes pa ma yin no //
translated: If the nature of an object appears to a consciousness, then that consciousness is of that object.üîΩBut when the nature of the object that one wishes to apprehend does not appear to consciousness, then it is not the consciousness of that object.

original: sbyor ba ni gang gi ngo bo shes pa gang la mi snang ba de ni shes pa'i gzung bar bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang gi ngo bo shes pa gang la mi snang ba de ni shes pa'i gzung bar bya ba ma yin te /
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever nature does not appear to a consciousness is not apprehended by that consciousness,

original: dper na sgra'i shes pa la sngon po la sogs pa'i ngo bo snang ba ma yin pa ni sgra'i shes pa'i gzung ba ma yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na sgra'i shes pa la sngon po la sogs pa'i ngo bo snang ba ma yin pa ni sgra'i shes pa'i gzung ba ma yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: like the nature of blue and so on, which does not appear to the consciousness of sound.

original: rang nyid 'dzin par 'dod pa'i shes pa la yang spyi'i ngo bo mi snang ngo zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rang nyid 'dzin par 'dod pa'i shes pa la yang spyi'i ngo bo mi snang ngo zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúNor does the universal appear to the cognition that desires to apprehend itself‚Äù is a non-observation of a pervasion.

original: rang gi yul la shes pa skyed par byed pa gang yin pa 'di ni don byed pa'i tha mar gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gi yul la shes pa skyed par byed pa gang yin pa 'di ni don byed pa'i tha mar gyur pa yin no //
translated: That which produces cognition in regard to its object is the final stage of the performance of an object‚Äôs function.

original: de'i phyir te /
analyzed: de'i phyir te /
translated: Therefore,

original: rang nyid 'dzin par 'dod pa'i shes pa la mi snang ba nyid kyi phyir spyi de ni /üîΩrang gi yul la shes tsam gyi //
analyzed: rang nyid 'dzin par 'dod pa'i shes pa la mi snang ba nyid kyi phyir spyi de ni / rang gi yul la shes tsam gyi //
translated: because that universal does not appear to the cognition that desires to apprehend itself,

original: don byed par yang mi rung ste /üîΩnus pa ma yin no //üîΩmi rung phyir te ngo bo med //
analyzed: don byed par yang mi rung ste / nus pa ma yin no // mi rung phyir te ngo bo med //
translated: it is not suitable to be the object of a mere cognition.üîΩIt is not suitable to be the object of a mere cognition because it is not capable of producing a cognition in regard to itself.

original: dngos po med pa yin te /
analyzed: dngos po med pa yin te /
translated: It is not suitable because it is devoid of an entity.

original: rnam par shes pa tsam gyi 'bras bu byed pa yang mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa tsam gyi 'bras bu byed pa yang mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is devoid of an entity because it is not capable of producing the effect of mere cognition.

original: mi rung ba nyid kyang ci'i phyir dngos po med pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: mi rung ba nyid kyang ci'i phyir dngos po med pa yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it not suitable? Because it is devoid of an entity.

original: 'di ltar de ni dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid yin /
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid yin /
translated: In this way, that is the definition of an absence.

original: 'di lta ste don med pa'i nus pa thams cad dang / bral ba 'di ni med pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'di lta ste don med pa'i nus pa thams cad dang / bral ba 'di ni med pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: The definition of non-existence is the absence of all non-existent capacities.

original: de ni spyi la yang yod pa de ltar na dngos po med pa'o //
