analyzed: de ni spyi la yang yod pa de ltar na dngos po med pa'o //
translated: It is also a universal, and thus it is a non-existent entity.

original: de de ltar spyi ni dngos po med pa yin no zhes bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: de de ltar spyi ni dngos po med pa yin no zhes bya bar gnas so //
translated: Thus, the universal is a non-existent entity.

original: ji ltar bshad las bzlog gang yin //
analyzed: ji ltar bshad las bzlog gang yin //
translated: That which is the opposite of what has been explained

original: de yang rang gi mtshan nyid 'dod //
analyzed: de yang rang gi mtshan nyid 'dod //
translated: is asserted to be an intrinsic identity.

original: ji skad du bshad pa las bzlog pa yang brjod par bya ba ma yin pa de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba med pa'i don snang ba khyad par med par shes pa'i yul ma yin pa /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa las bzlog pa yang brjod par bya ba ma yin pa de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba med pa'i don snang ba khyad par med par shes pa'i yul ma yin pa /
translated: That which is the opposite of what has been explained is also inexpressible, and it is the object of a cognition that does not perceive any difference in the appearance of the meaning of the inexpressible identity and difference.

original: mtshungs pa ma yin zhing thun mong ma yin pa gang yin pa /
analyzed: mtshungs pa ma yin zhing thun mong ma yin pa gang yin pa /
translated: It is not similar, not common,

original: brda dran pa la ltos pa @143b med pa'i rtogs pa can /
analyzed: brda dran pa la ltos pa @143b med pa'i rtogs pa can /
translated: and it is the object of a cognition that does not depend on the memory of a sign.

original: rang 'dzin pa'i shes pa la gzhan gyi ngo bos dben pa snang ba gang yin pa dang / don byed par nus pa gang yin pa de ni rang gi mtshan nyi 'dzin par 'dod do //
analyzed: rang 'dzin pa'i shes pa la gzhan gyi ngo bos dben pa snang ba gang yin pa dang / don byed par nus pa gang yin pa de ni rang gi mtshan nyi 'dzin par 'dod do //
translated: That which appears to a consciousness apprehending it as devoid of the nature of another and that which is able to perform a function is asserted to be the apprehension of its own character.

original: gang yang dngos po med pa'i ngo bo rnam par gcod pa'i mtshan nyid can du bstan pa'i spyi de yang rnam pa gsum yin te /
analyzed: gang yang dngos po med pa'i ngo bo rnam par gcod pa'i mtshan nyid can du bstan pa'i spyi de yang rnam pa gsum yin te /
translated: Also, that universal which is taught to have the characteristic of the exclusion of the nature of non-thing is also threefold.

original: dbye ba gsum yin no /
analyzed: dbye ba gsum yin no /
translated: It is threefold.

original: // / tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel pa /üîΩbam po nyi shu bzhi pa /
analyzed: // / tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel pa / bam po nyi shu bzhi pa /
translated: Commentary on Valid Knowledge

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: dngos dang dngos med gnyis rten phyir //
analyzed: dngos dang dngos med gnyis rten phyir //
translated: Because it is the basis of both thing and non-thing.

original: dngos po'i nye bar len pa can dang / dngos po med pa'i nye bar len pa can dang / gnyi ga'i nye bar len pa can no //
analyzed: dngos po'i nye bar len pa can dang / dngos po med pa'i nye bar len pa can dang / gnyi ga'i nye bar len pa can no //
translated: There is that which appropriates a thing, that which appropriates a non-thing, and that which appropriates both.

original: / de la dngos po'i nye bar len pa can ni sgra'i don gang gzugs la sogs pa la brten nas tha snyad du byas pa ste /
analyzed: / de la dngos po'i nye bar len pa can ni sgra'i don gang gzugs la sogs pa la brten nas tha snyad du byas pa ste /
translated: Among them, that which appropriates a thing is the meaning of a word that is conventionally designated in dependence on form and so on,

original: dper na skye ba nyid la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na skye ba nyid la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: for example, like arising itself.

original: med pa'i nye bar len pa can ni snang ba'i don mi dmigs pa dang skye ba dang ldan pa med pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: med pa'i nye bar len pa can ni snang ba'i don mi dmigs pa dang skye ba dang ldan pa med pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The non-existent appropriator is the non-observation of an appearing object, the non-existence of possession of arising, and so on.

original: gnyi ga'i nye bar len pa can ni mi dmigs pa tsam dang / shes bya nyid la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i nye bar len pa can ni mi dmigs pa tsam dang / shes bya nyid la sogs pa'o //
translated: The appropriator of both is mere non-observation, the mere object of knowledge, and so on.

original: gal te yod shes dngos po'i rten can yin /
analyzed: gal te yod shes dngos po'i rten can yin /
translated: If the existent consciousness has a thing as its basis,

original: gal te dngos po'i nye bar len pa can spyi 'dzin par byed pa'i shes pa yin par 'dod na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po'i nye bar len pa can spyi 'dzin par byed pa'i shes pa yin par 'dod na /
translated: if it is asserted that the consciousness apprehending a universal has the appropriation of a thing as its object,

original: 'o na ni shes pa de dngos po la dngos po'i yul can thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'o na ni shes pa de dngos po la dngos po'i yul can thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: then that consciousness would obtain a thing as its object.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: yod dang rjes 'brel phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: yod dang rjes 'brel phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, ‚Äúbecause it is related to the existent.‚Äù

original: dngos po yod na yod pa'i phyir dang / med na med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po yod na yod pa'i phyir dang / med na med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it exists when a thing exists and does not exist when it does not exist.

original: sbyor ba ni shes pa gang zhig dngos po yod na 'gyur zhing med na mi 'gyur ba de ni dngos po'i yul can yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni shes pa gang zhig dngos po yod na 'gyur zhing med na mi 'gyur ba de ni dngos po'i yul can yin te /
translated: The syllogism is: ‚ÄúThat consciousness which occurs when a thing exists and does not occur when it does not exist has a thing as its object,

original: dper na mig gi rnam par shes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na mig gi rnam par shes pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, like the visual consciousness.

original: chos thams cad kyi spyi 'dzin pa'i shes pa yang dngos po yod na 'gyur zhing med na mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rnag bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi spyi 'dzin pa'i shes pa yang dngos po yod na 'gyur zhing med na mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rnag bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: The cognition that apprehends the universals of all things also occurs when there is an existent entity, but does not occur when there is no existent entity. This is a reason based on identity.

original: skyon de yod pa min no //
analyzed: skyon de yod pa min no //
translated: That fault does not exist.

original: ci'i phyir zhe nan /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe nan /
translated: Why is that?

original: lan bshad zin phyir te /
analyzed: lan bshad zin phyir te /
translated: Because the answer has already been given.

original: brjod bya nyid phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs kyis spyi 'dzin pa'i shes pa dngos po med pa'i yul can nyid yin par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brjod bya nyid phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs kyis spyi 'dzin pa'i shes pa dngos po med pa'i yul can nyid yin par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the very object of expression, etc. The reason is taught because it demonstrates that the cognition that apprehends the universal is the subject that has a nonexistent object.

original: des kyang 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can nyid ma bstan to //
analyzed: des kyang 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can nyid ma bstan to //
translated: But that does not demonstrate that it is a nonerroneous contradiction.

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: Well then, what is it?

original: dam bcas pa la rjes su dpag pas gnod pa yin no //
analyzed: dam bcas pa la rjes su dpag pas gnod pa yin no //
translated: It is a contradiction with inference in regard to the thesis.

original: 'das stsogs gzhan du mthong @144a * //
analyzed: 'das stsogs gzhan du mthong @144a * //
translated: Because past, etc., are seen as other.

original: phyir ro // bum par gyur pa dang byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba med pa la sgra las byung ba'i shes pa dngos po med par mthong ba de ltar na gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: phyir ro // bum par gyur pa dang byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba med pa la sgra las byung ba'i shes pa dngos po med par mthong ba de ltar na gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no //
translated: The reason is not established.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: This is so, but

original: gal te dngos chos nyid nyams 'gyur //
analyzed: gal te dngos chos nyid nyams 'gyur //
translated: if the nature of the thing is lost,

original: gal te dngos po med par spyi 'dzin par shes par 'gyur ba de'i tshe //
analyzed: gal te dngos po med par spyi 'dzin par shes par 'gyur ba de'i tshe //
translated: if the cognition of the universal is admitted to be of a nonexistent,

original: dngos po'i chos nyid yin pa dam bcas pa nyams par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po'i chos nyid yin pa dam bcas pa nyams par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: then the thesis that it is the nature of the thing is lost.

original: ji skad du bshad zin pa'i skyon 'di med /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad zin pa'i skyon 'di med /
translated: This fault does not arise, as has already been explained.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: dngos po 'dzin pa sngon 'gro can //
analyzed: dngos po 'dzin pa sngon 'gro can //
translated: Because the cognition of the universal has the apprehension of the thing as its antecedent.

original: spyi de'i shes pa'am spyi'i shes pa de yin par 'gyur ro zhes dgongs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩspyi ni gzugs la sogs pa bzhin du bdag nyid dngos po'i ngo bo nyid kyis shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: spyi de'i shes pa'am spyi'i shes pa de yin par 'gyur ro zhes dgongs pa'i phyir ro // spyi ni gzugs la sogs pa bzhin du bdag nyid dngos po'i ngo bo nyid kyis shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The cognition of the universal is the cognition of the universal, or the cognition of the universal, because it is intended that it is so.

original: dngos po'i chos su 'dod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po'i chos su 'dod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The universal is not admitted to be a property of the thing because it is the object of cognition by the nature of its own entity, like form, etc.

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /üîΩgzugs la sogs pa mthong bas bsgos pa'i bag chags la brten nas rnam par rtog pa skye ba na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na / gzugs la sogs pa mthong bas bsgos pa'i bag chags la brten nas rnam par rtog pa skye ba na /
translated: What is it?

original: rang nyid kyis gzung ba'i rnam pa la gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam pa nyid du zhen pas /
analyzed: rang nyid kyis gzung ba'i rnam pa la gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam pa nyid du zhen pas /
translated: When a conceptual consciousness arises in dependence on the latent potentialities that are the impregnations of the view of the transitory collection, it conceives the aspect that it itself apprehends as form and so on.

original: 'jug pa de ltar na gzugs la sogs pa mthong ba'i stobs kyis skye ba'i phyir dang / der zhen pa'i phyir dngos po'i chos yin no zhes tha snyad du byas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'jug pa de ltar na gzugs la sogs pa mthong ba'i stobs kyis skye ba'i phyir dang / der zhen pa'i phyir dngos po'i chos yin no zhes tha snyad du byas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus, because it arises through the power of seeing form and so on and because it conceives of them, it is conventionally said that it is a phenomenon that is an object.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rang gi mtshan nyid gcig ma gtogs par gzhal bya'i khyad par gzhan cung zad kyang don byed par nus pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rang gi mtshan nyid gcig ma gtogs par gzhal bya'i khyad par gzhan cung zad kyang don byed par nus pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: This is the meaning. Therefore, except for the one that is the specifically characterized, there is not any other object that is capable of functioning.

original: de bas na /üîΩrang gi mtshan nyid gcig gzhal bya //
analyzed: de bas na / rang gi mtshan nyid gcig gzhal bya //
translated: Thus:

original: gzhal bya yin par 'os pas na gzhal bya'o //
analyzed: gzhal bya yin par 'os pas na gzhal bya'o //
translated: One specifically characterized object is the object of comprehension.üîΩIt is an object of comprehension because it is suitable to be an object of comprehension.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid gcig pu kho na la skyes bu rtog pa dang ldan pa don byed pa don du gnyer bas yod pa dang med pa nyid du dpyad par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid gcig pu kho na la skyes bu rtog pa dang ldan pa don byed pa don du gnyer bas yod pa dang med pa nyid du dpyad par bya ba yin no //
translated: Only with respect to a unique particular can a person who is endowed with thought and who seeks to accomplish a purpose analyze whether it exists or does not exist.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: rang gi mtshan nyid la dpyod pa'i rten gzhan med pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid la dpyod pa'i rten gzhan med pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: Because there is no other basis for analyzing a particular.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid de las don byed grub phyir te /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid de las don byed grub phyir te /
translated: Because the capacity to perform a function is established from that particular,

original: rgyu'i phyir skyes bu'i don byed pa don du gnyer ba don byed nus pa'i dngos po dpyod pa'i sgo nas yul du byed par yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu'i phyir skyes bu'i don byed pa don du gnyer ba don byed nus pa'i dngos po dpyod pa'i sgo nas yul du byed par yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: the person who seeks to accomplish a purpose analyzes the capacity to perform a function, and not anything else, by way of the object that is the cause of the purpose.

original: don byed par nus pa yang rang gi mtshan nyid kho na yin pa de ltar na de yod pa dang / de med pa nyid du dpyod par byed pa yin pa de bas na de nyid la /
analyzed: don byed par nus pa yang rang gi mtshan nyid kho na yin pa de ltar na de yod pa dang / de med pa nyid du dpyod par byed pa yin pa de bas na de nyid la /
translated: The capacity to perform a function is a particular itself. Therefore, one analyzes whether it exists or does not exist.üîΩTherefore, it is said:

original: yod med nyid du dpyod phyir te /
analyzed: yod med nyid du dpyod phyir te /
translated: Because one analyzes whether it exists or does not exist.

original: rgyu'i @144b phyir rang gi mtshan nyid gcig pu kho na gzhal bya yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rgyu'i @144b phyir rang gi mtshan nyid gcig pu kho na gzhal bya yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the object of comprehension is only the unique particular, not anything else.

original: spyi la yang dpyod pa 'jug pa nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: spyi la yang dpyod pa 'jug pa nyid ma yin nam /
translated: But is it not the case that the universal is also the domain of investigation?

original: de ji ltar na gcig pu kho na gzhal bya yin zhes brjod ce na /
analyzed: de ji ltar na gcig pu kho na gzhal bya yin zhes brjod ce na /
translated: How can it be said that only the unique particular is the object of comprehension?

original: bden te / 'on kyang spyi la dpyod pa yang rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rten can yin no //
analyzed: bden te / 'on kyang spyi la dpyod pa yang rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rten can yin no //
translated: It is true, but the investigation of the universal also has the unique particular as its basis.

original: de lta na 'ga' zhig de dngos po nyid yin zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: de lta na 'ga' zhig de dngos po nyid yin zhes ston par byed do //
translated: Thus, it shows that something is a real thing.

original: des na ci ste 'ba' zhig la rung ba'am ma yin no zhes dngos po'i rjes su 'brangs nas dpyad pa yin no //
analyzed: des na ci ste 'ba' zhig la rung ba'am ma yin no zhes dngos po'i rjes su 'brangs nas dpyad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is proper to investigate whether something is real or not, following the facts.

original: de lta ma yin na med pa nyid du nges pa la dpyod pa cung zad kyang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na med pa nyid du nges pa la dpyod pa cung zad kyang mi rung ngo //
translated: Otherwise, it would be improper to investigate anything at all, since it would be ascertained as nonexistent.

original: med pa'i yul gyi dpyod pa yang dngos po rten can nyid yin te /
analyzed: med pa'i yul gyi dpyod pa yang dngos po rten can nyid yin te /
translated: The investigation of a nonexistent object also has a real basis,

original: dngos po nyid la yod pa dang med pa nyid dpyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po nyid la yod pa dang med pa nyid dpyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the existence or nonexistence of a real thing is investigated.

original: gal te 'o na gzhal bya gcig kho na yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'o na gzhal bya gcig kho na yin na /
translated: If there is only one object of comprehension,

original: slob dpon gyis rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid las gzhal bya gzhan yod pa ma yin no zhes yul rna pa gnyis gsungs te /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid las gzhal bya gzhan yod pa ma yin no zhes yul rna pa gnyis gsungs te /
translated: why did the Acarya say that there is no other object of comprehension than the particular and the universal,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid la gzhal ya gnyis pa yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid la gzhal ya gnyis pa yod pa'i phyir /
translated: since there are two objects of comprehension in the particular?

original: slob dpon gzhal bya gnyis nyid bzhed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: slob dpon gzhal bya gnyis nyid bzhed pa ma yin no //
translated: The Acarya did not accept two objects of comprehension.

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: What then did he accept?

original: rang gi mtshan nyid /üîΩde yi rang gzhan ngo bo dag / rtogs phyir te /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid / de yi rang gzhan ngo bo dag / rtogs phyir te /
translated: The particular and the universal.

original: rgyu'i phyir gzhal bya gnyis su bzhed /üîΩrang gi mtshan nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo mngon sum gyi shes pas rtogs pa'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid gcig nyid yin no //
analyzed: rgyu'i phyir gzhal bya gnyis su bzhed / rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo mngon sum gyi shes pas rtogs pa'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid gcig nyid yin no //
translated: The two are accepted as objects of comprehension because of the cause of comprehending the nature of the particular and the universal.üîΩThe particular is one object of comprehension because the nature of the particular is comprehended by a direct perception.

original: de nyid la rjes su dpag pa'i shes pas gzung ba'i rnam pa'i sgo nas de'i ngo bor zhen pas rtogs pa'i phyir spyi bshad do //
analyzed: de nyid la rjes su dpag pa'i shes pas gzung ba'i rnam pa'i sgo nas de'i ngo bor zhen pas rtogs pa'i phyir spyi bshad do //
translated: The universal is explained as an object of comprehension because it is comprehended by an inferential cognition that apprehends it through the aspect of its image.

original: ji ltar na gzhan gyi ngo bo'i sgo nas rang gi mtshan nyid rtogs pa yin no zhes bya ba de rtogs par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na gzhan gyi ngo bo'i sgo nas rang gi mtshan nyid rtogs pa yin no zhes bya ba de rtogs par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How could one understand the statement ‚ÄúOne understands the intrinsic identity of the external object through the other-exclusion‚Äù?

original: 'di ltar rnam rtog pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i rjes su dpag pa phyi rol nyid du snang ba'i cha rang gi mtshan nyid ma yin pa la rang gi mtshan nyid du zhen pas skyes bu 'di'i don byed nus pa'i don nyid la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam rtog pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i rjes su dpag pa phyi rol nyid du snang ba'i cha rang gi mtshan nyid ma yin pa la rang gi mtshan nyid du zhen pas skyes bu 'di'i don byed nus pa'i don nyid la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, the inference that is the consequence of conceptual thought, which is the aspect that appears as external, engages the object that is able to perform a function, although it is not the intrinsic identity, because it is conceived to be the intrinsic identity.

original: de lta ma yin na gal te spyi rjes su dpag pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na gal te spyi rjes su dpag pa de'i tshe /
translated: Otherwise, if the universal were inferred,

original: don byed pa sgrub par byed pa de nyid la 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: don byed pa sgrub par byed pa de nyid la 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: then it would engage that very object that is able to perform a function.

original: de tsam rtogs pa'i bsam pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de tsam rtogs pa'i bsam pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it would have the intention to understand that alone.

original: de'i yul gyi don rtogs pas ldog par 'dod pa'i dus phyis me la 'jug par mi 'gyur ba'i de nyid 'jug par mi 'gyur te /üîΩde la gang zhig gi @145a * //
analyzed: de'i yul gyi don rtogs pas ldog par 'dod pa'i dus phyis me la 'jug par mi 'gyur ba'i de nyid 'jug par mi 'gyur te / de la gang zhig gi @145a * //
translated: When it understands the object that is its object, it would not engage fire at a later time, because it would have already engaged it.

original: tshe yang nus pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: tshe yang nus pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It would not engage it, because it would be powerless.

original: rang bzhin du gnas pa dag gis bum pa yong su bcad nas bum pa yongs su bcad par nges pa la gnas pa snam bus bsgrub par bya ba'i don byed pa la 'jug pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin du gnas pa dag gis bum pa yong su bcad nas bum pa yongs su bcad par nges pa la gnas pa snam bus bsgrub par bya ba'i don byed pa la 'jug pa ma yin no //
translated: Those who are naturally skeptical do not engage in the activity of accomplishing the object to be accomplished on the basis of the exclusion of the pot, which is ascertained as the exclusion of the pot.

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i don byed par rtogs pa'i don du rang gi mtshan nyid las rjes su dpag pa las kyang 'jug pa yin pa de bas na de'i ngo bor zhen pa yin no zhes rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i don byed par rtogs pa'i don du rang gi mtshan nyid las rjes su dpag pa las kyang 'jug pa yin pa de bas na de'i ngo bor zhen pa yin no zhes rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: And they also engage in inference from the specific property of the subject in order to understand the activity of accomplishing the object to be accomplished. Therefore they understand that it is the nature of that.

original: de de ltar na ji ltar rnam par rtog pa'i rjes su dpag pa de rang gi cha las dngos po nyid du zhen pas de de ltar ma yin no //üîΩji ltar mngon zhen med pa yi //
analyzed: de de ltar na ji ltar rnam par rtog pa'i rjes su dpag pa de rang gi cha las dngos po nyid du zhen pas de de ltar ma yin no // ji ltar mngon zhen med pa yi //
translated: But it is not like that, because conceptual inference is conceived to be a real thing on the basis of its own part.üîΩHow is it that the cause of non-erroneous

original: rgyu yis gnyis pa /
analyzed: rgyu yis gnyis pa /
translated: knowledge is not accepted?

original: gzhan gyi ngo bor rtogs pa la 'khrul pa dag tu bzhed pa gang yin pa de ni der zhen pas don byed pa la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi ngo bor rtogs pa la 'khrul pa dag tu bzhed pa gang yin pa de ni der zhen pas don byed pa la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The cause of non-erroneous knowledge is not accepted in the case of the other nature, which is understood to be erroneous. This is because it engages in the activity of accomplishing the object by conceiving it to be that.

original: gal te gzhan gyis rtogs /
analyzed: gal te gzhan gyis rtogs /
translated: If it is conceived by another,

original: gal te gzhan mi gsal ba'i tshul rnam par rtog pa'i rjes su dpag pa gzung ba'i rnam pa'i sgo nas rang gi mtshan nyid du zhen pas don de'i gsal ba'i ngo bor rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te gzhan mi gsal ba'i tshul rnam par rtog pa'i rjes su dpag pa gzung ba'i rnam pa'i sgo nas rang gi mtshan nyid du zhen pas don de'i gsal ba'i ngo bor rtogs pa yin no //
translated: If the other is not clear, then the inference that follows the thought is the realization of the clear nature of that object, because it is conceived to be the intrinsic identity of the object that is apprehended.

original: de yang don ji ltar ba bzhin ma yin pa la zhen pas 'khrul par 'dod do //
analyzed: de yang don ji ltar ba bzhin ma yin pa la zhen pas 'khrul par 'dod do //
translated: Moreover, since it is conceived to be just as the object is, it is asserted to be nonerroneous.

original: 'o na de tshad ma nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: 'o na de tshad ma nyid ma yin te /
translated: Well, it is not a valid cognition.

original: 'di ltar smig rgyu la sogs pa 'khrul pa'ang tshad ma nyid ma yin /
analyzed: 'di ltar smig rgyu la sogs pa 'khrul pa'ang tshad ma nyid ma yin /
translated: Thus, even an error such as a mirage is not a valid cognition.

original: 'ang gi sgras ni spyi'i rnam par shes pa rang gi mtshan nyid rtogs pa gzhan nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'ang gi sgras ni spyi'i rnam par shes pa rang gi mtshan nyid rtogs pa gzhan nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The word even means that a consciousness that is a general mental state does not become another that realizes its intrinsic identity.

original: sbyor ba dag ni gang zhig gang las gzhan gyi ngo bo yin pa de ni rtogs pa na de rtogs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: sbyor ba dag ni gang zhig gang las gzhan gyi ngo bo yin pa de ni rtogs pa na de rtogs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: The syllogism is this: Whatever is a different nature from something else does not realize that when it realizes the other,

original: dper na sgra rtogs pas gzugs rtogs pa ma yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na sgra rtogs pas gzugs rtogs pa ma yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: for example, the realization of sound is not the realization of form.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyang rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa'i gzung ba'i rnam pa las gzhan gyi ngo bo yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa yin par sems so //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyang rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa'i gzung ba'i rnam pa las gzhan gyi ngo bo yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa yin par sems so //
translated: The reason is contradictory to the pervasion, because the intrinsic identity is the nature of something other than the aspect of the object of the conceptual consciousness.

original: gang 'khrul pa yin pa de ni tshad ma ma yin te /
analyzed: gang 'khrul pa yin pa de ni tshad ma ma yin te /
translated: Whatever is mistaken is not a valid cognition,

original: dper na mig ser gyi nad can gyis ser po mthong ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na mig ser gyi nad can gyis ser po mthong ba lta bu'o //
translated: like, for example, the perception of yellow by one with jaundice.

original: rjes su dpag pa yang 'khrul pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa nyid yin par sems so //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa yang 'khrul pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa nyid yin par sems so //
translated: Inference is also mistaken, because the reason is contradictory to the pervasion.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi bsam pa can gyi tshad ma nyid yin pa de bas na 'khrul pa ma yin pa dang rang gi ngo bo nyid du rtogs @145b pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi bsam pa can gyi tshad ma nyid yin pa de bas na 'khrul pa ma yin pa dang rang gi ngo bo nyid du rtogs @145b pa yin no //
translated: Since it is a valid cognition that has the intrinsic identity as its object, it is not mistaken and realizes its own nature.

original: bzlog pa'i sbyor ba dag ni gang /
analyzed: bzlog pa'i sbyor ba dag ni gang /
translated: What are the reverse formulations?

original: tshad ma nyid yin pa de ni 'khrul par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: tshad ma nyid yin pa de ni 'khrul par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Whatever is a valid cognition is not mistaken,

original: dper na mngon sum lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na mngon sum lta bu'o //
translated: like, for example, direct perception.

original: rjes su dpag pa yang tshad ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa yin no snyam du sems so //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa yang tshad ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa yin no snyam du sems so //
translated: Inference is also a means of valid cognition is the apprehension of a contradictory pervasion.

original: gang zhig gang gi rtogs pa yin pa de ni de'i ngo bo nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang gi rtogs pa yin pa de ni de'i ngo bo nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: Whatever is the understanding of something becomes the nature of that,

original: dper na mig gis gzugs rtogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na mig gis gzugs rtogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: like the eye's understanding of form.

original: rjes su dpag pa yang rang gi mtshan nyid rtogs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin par sems so //üîΩbsam pa la ni slu med phyir //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa yang rang gi mtshan nyid rtogs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin par sems so // bsam pa la ni slu med phyir //
translated: Inference is also the understanding of its own characteristic is the inference of an essential property.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed do //
translated: The answer is given by because there is no deception in the intention.

original: 'khrul pa yin yang tshad ma yin //
analyzed: 'khrul pa yin yang tshad ma yin //
translated: Even if there is error, it is a means of valid cognition.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bsam pa la ni slu med phyir //
analyzed: bsam pa la ni slu med phyir //
translated: Because there is no deception in the intention.

original: rtogs pa po gang don byed par nus pa'i don la zhen pa can de ltar 'dod pa'i don la mi slu ba ni tshad ma nyid yin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa po gang don byed par nus pa'i don la zhen pa can de ltar 'dod pa'i don la mi slu ba ni tshad ma nyid yin no //
translated: For one who understands, if one is attached to an object that is capable of effective action, then not being deceived with regard to the intended object is itself a means of valid cognition.

original: gal te de 'dra ba de yod pa ma yin no zhes sgrub pa de'i tshe ma nges pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te de 'dra ba de yod pa ma yin no zhes sgrub pa de'i tshe ma nges pa yin te /
translated: If you prove that such a thing does not exist, then it is not established,

original: nor bu'i 'od la nor bur zhen pa can gyis don de thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nor bu'i 'od la nor bur zhen pa can gyis don de thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the person who is attached to the light of the gem as a gem obtains that object.

original: ci ste yang 'di ni don ji lta ba bzhin du ma yin pa 'dzin pa yin no zhes sgrub pa de'i tshe sgrub pa la sgrub pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: ci ste yang 'di ni don ji lta ba bzhin du ma yin pa 'dzin pa yin no zhes sgrub pa de'i tshe sgrub pa la sgrub pa nyid yin no //
translated: But if you prove that it is a non-apprehension of the object as it is, then the proof is itself unproven.

original: thal ba dang po nyid la ma nges pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: thal ba dang po nyid la ma nges pa nyid yin te /
translated: The first reductio is not established,

original: 'di ltar de ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni /
translated: because it is like this:

original: rtogs pa rnam pa gzhan du mthong /
analyzed: rtogs pa rnam pa gzhan du mthong /
translated: The cognition sees the object in a different way.

original: dper na nor bu'i 'od la nor bur zhen pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na nor bu'i 'od la nor bur zhen pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the attachment to the light of the gem as a gem.

original: don dam par mi 'dzin pa bsgrub par bya ba yin na /
analyzed: don dam par mi 'dzin pa bsgrub par bya ba yin na /
translated: If the non-apprehension of the ultimate is to be proven,

original: 'dod pa sgrub pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa sgrub pa nyid yin no //
translated: then the desired object is proven.

original: bzlog pa'i sbyor ba dang po la nor bu'i 'od la nor bu'i blos ma nges pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: bzlog pa'i sbyor ba dang po la nor bu'i 'od la nor bu'i blos ma nges pa nyid yin no //
translated: In the first formulation of the contrapositive, the apprehension of the light of the gem as a gem is not established.

original: gnyis pa la yang ma grub pa yin te /
analyzed: gnyis pa la yang ma grub pa yin te /
translated: In the second, it is not established,

original: 'di ltar phyogs 'di yan gla btab zin to //
analyzed: 'di ltar phyogs 'di yan gla btab zin to //
translated: because this position has already been refuted.

original: 'di ltar rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa dngos po 'dzin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni brjod bya nyid ces bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyis bstan zin to //üîΩnor bu sgron ma'i 'od dag la //
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa dngos po 'dzin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni brjod bya nyid ces bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyis bstan zin to // nor bu sgron ma'i 'od dag la //
translated: Thus, the statement ‚Äúthe conceptual cognition does not apprehend the thing‚Äù has been demonstrated by the reason ‚Äúbecause it is the expressed object.‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas thal ba dang bzlog pa dag la de nyid ma nges pa nyid ston par byed do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas thal ba dang bzlog pa dag la de nyid ma nges pa nyid ston par byed do //
translated: The consequence and the counter-consequence are shown to be indeterminate by the statement ‚Äúthe light of the gem and the light of the lamp,‚Äù etc.

original: nor bu'i 'od dang sgron ma'i 'od ni nor bu dang sgron ma'i 'od de /
analyzed: nor bu'i 'od dang sgron ma'i 'od ni nor bu dang sgron ma'i 'od de /
translated: The light of the gem and the light of the lamp are the light of the gem and the light of the lamp.

original: de dag yul du gyur pa dag la'o //
analyzed: de dag yul du gyur pa dag la'o //
translated: They are the objects.

original: skyes bu gang gi nor bu'i blo yis mngon rgyugs pa /
analyzed: skyes bu gang gi nor bu'i blo yis mngon rgyugs pa /
translated: The person who, by the cognition of the gem, is in the presence of the gem,üîΩand the person who, by the cognition of the lamp, is in the presence of the lamp,

original: log pa'i shes par khyad med na'ang //
analyzed: log pa'i shes par khyad med na'ang //
translated: are not distinguished as to whether their cognition is erroneous or non-erroneous.

original: ji ltar don byed la khyad @146a * //üîΩyod // de ltar ji bzhin don min na'ang //
analyzed: ji ltar don byed la khyad @146a * // yod // de ltar ji bzhin don min na'ang //
translated: But how is there a distinction as to whether they perform a function or not?

original: 'khrul pa nyid yin na yang ngo //
analyzed: 'khrul pa nyid yin na yang ngo //
translated: Even though they are erroneous,üîΩhow is there a distinction as to whether they are in accordance with the object or not?

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?üîΩInference and the cognition of what is to be known are established as valid cognitions.

original: rjes dpag dang ni der snang dag / tshad ma nyid du rnam par gzhag / rgyu gang gis she na /
analyzed: rjes dpag dang ni der snang dag / tshad ma nyid du rnam par gzhag / rgyu gang gis she na /
translated: By what reason?

original: don byed pa dang rjes 'brel pas //
analyzed: don byed pa dang rjes 'brel pas //
translated: Because they are related to the performance of a function.

original: 'di las ji ltar 'dod pa'i don la mi slu ba kho na yin pa de ni tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di las ji ltar 'dod pa'i don la mi slu ba kho na yin pa de ni tshad ma yin no //
translated: The means of valid knowledge is just that which is nondeceptive with regard to the object as it is desired.

original: skyes bu gcig nor bu'i 'od la nor bu dang / cig shos mar me'i 'od la nor bu'i blo can gyi skyes bu gnyis po de dag ni nor bur 'khrul par 'dra ba yin te /
analyzed: skyes bu gcig nor bu'i 'od la nor bu dang / cig shos mar me'i 'od la nor bu'i blo can gyi skyes bu gnyis po de dag ni nor bur 'khrul par 'dra ba yin te /
translated: Two men, one of whom has the idea of a jewel with regard to the light of a jewel, and the other of whom has the idea of a jewel with regard to the light of a lamp, are both mistaken with regard to the jewel.

original: nor bu rang gi ngo bo bzung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nor bu rang gi ngo bo bzung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they do not apprehend the essence of the jewel.

original: de ltar na gcig ni nor bu'i blos 'jug pa na nor bu thob pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na gcig ni nor bu'i blos 'jug pa na nor bu thob pa yin te /
translated: Thus, one of them, when he engages with the idea of a jewel, obtains the jewel,

original: de ni nor bu dang 'brel pa'i shes pa de las de la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni nor bu dang 'brel pa'i shes pa de las de la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he engages with it on the basis of the cognition that is related to the jewel.

original: cig shos ni ma yin te 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cig shos ni ma yin te 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The other does not, because he is not related to it.

original: de ltar na don byed pa dang rjes su 'brel pas de dag las gcig ni mi slu ba yin la cig shos ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na don byed pa dang rjes su 'brel pas de dag las gcig ni mi slu ba yin la cig shos ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par yin no //
translated: Thus, because of the connection with the object that is capable of effective action, one of them is nondeceptive, but the other is not. This is the difference.

original: de ltar na rjes su dpag pa dang / der snang ba dag 'khrul pa'i shes pa yin par khyad par med na yang gcig ni don byed par nus pa'i don dang phrad pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na rjes su dpag pa dang / der snang ba dag 'khrul pa'i shes pa yin par khyad par med na yang gcig ni don byed par nus pa'i don dang phrad pa yin te /
translated: Thus, although inference and the appearance of that are non-distinct in being mistaken consciousnesses, one is in contact with an object that is able to perform a function.

original: de las brgyud nas skyes pas de dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las brgyud nas skyes pas de dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is produced from that indirectly, it is related to that.

original: cig shos ni ma yin pa de ltar gcig tshad ma yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: cig shos ni ma yin pa de ltar gcig tshad ma yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: The other is not. Thus, one is valid knowledge, but the other is not.

original: de de ltar na rang gi mtshan nyid kho na rang gi ngo bo dang gzhan gyi ngo bo'i sgo nas rtogs pa'i phyir de dag gi mtshan nyid ci 'dra ba dang / gzhal bya gnyis nyid du rnam par gzhag nas /
analyzed: de de ltar na rang gi mtshan nyid kho na rang gi ngo bo dang gzhan gyi ngo bo'i sgo nas rtogs pa'i phyir de dag gi mtshan nyid ci 'dra ba dang / gzhal bya gnyis nyid du rnam par gzhag nas /
translated: Thus, because one realizes only the intrinsic identity and the extrinsic identity of those, having established the two objects of comprehension as they are,

original: da ni ji ltar gzhal bya gnyis nyid yin pa'i phyir tshad ma nyid kho na bstan par bzhed nas /üîΩgang la don gyi nus pa las //
analyzed: da ni ji ltar gzhal bya gnyis nyid yin pa'i phyir tshad ma nyid kho na bstan par bzhed nas / gang la don gyi nus pa las //
translated: now, in order to teach only valid knowledge because of the two objects of comprehension,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúFrom the capacity of the object . . .‚Äù and so on.

original: gang la don gyi nus pa las //
analyzed: gang la don gyi nus pa las //
translated: From the capacity of the object,

original: zhes bya ba gang la zhes bya ba de'i don gyi nus pa ste stobs las so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gang la zhes bya ba de'i don gyi nus pa ste stobs las so //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom the power of the object‚Äù means from the power of the object‚Äôs capacity.

original: don de yul rung ba la nye ba dang nye ba ma yin pa dag las zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don de yul rung ba la nye ba dang nye ba ma yin pa dag las zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the object is near or not near a suitable sense organ.

original: rjes 'gro ldog pa can gyi blo //
analyzed: rjes 'gro ldog pa can gyi blo //
translated: The cognition that follows and reverses

original: mthong ba'i rnam pa de nges par snang ba can no //
analyzed: mthong ba'i rnam pa de nges par snang ba can no //
translated: is seen to have the aspect of that.

original: de yod na yod pa'i rjes su byed pa'i sgo nas skye ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de yod na yod pa'i rjes su byed pa'i sgo nas skye ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it arises by following the existence of that.

original: don de 'dra ba /
analyzed: don de 'dra ba /
translated: The object is like that.

original: de la 'dzin pa rang dbang can //
analyzed: de la 'dzin pa rang dbang can //
translated: The independent apprehension of that

original: gzhal bya la brten pa can gyi rang gi ngo bo 'dzin pa can ni ma yin no zhes @146b bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhal bya la brten pa can gyi rang gi ngo bo 'dzin pa can ni ma yin no zhes @146b bya ba'i don to //
translated: is not the apprehension of its own nature that depends on the object of comprehension. This is the meaning.

original: des na dmigs pa bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: des na dmigs pa bshad pa yin no //
translated: Thus the object is explained.

original: de ltar na blo'i snang bas rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa gang yin pa de ni mngon sum gyi yul la yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na blo'i snang bas rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa gang yin pa de ni mngon sum gyi yul la yin no //
translated: In that case, the object of perception is that which is followed and reversed by the cognition that appears as that.

original: de las gzhan dngos dbang po 'das //
analyzed: de las gzhan dngos dbang po 'das //
translated: Apart from that, the object is beyond the senses.

original: don gang yang yul du rung ba nye ba dang nye ba ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa'i ngang tshul can gyi blo dngos su mi byed pa de ni lkog tu gyur pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: don gang yang yul du rung ba nye ba dang nye ba ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa'i ngang tshul can gyi blo dngos su mi byed pa de ni lkog tu gyur pa'i don yin no //
translated: The object that is not directly perceived is the one that is not present, and is characterized by the absence of the presence of the cognition that follows the presence and absence of the object.

original: mngon sum dang lkog tu gyur pa'i mtshan nyid de yang /
analyzed: mngon sum dang lkog tu gyur pa'i mtshan nyid de yang /
translated: The characteristics of the directly perceived and the indirectly perceived are

original: rtogs pa po'i da ltar gyi gnas skabs la ltos pas yin no //üîΩde lta ma yin na lta ba po dang snang ba nyid kyi gnas skabs kyi khyad par gzhan du gyur pa na /
analyzed: rtogs pa po'i da ltar gyi gnas skabs la ltos pas yin no // de lta ma yin na lta ba po dang snang ba nyid kyi gnas skabs kyi khyad par gzhan du gyur pa na /
translated: dependent on the present state of the cognizer.üîΩOtherwise, if the cognizer and the object were to be in a different state,

original: mngon sum dang lkog tu gyur pa dag rnam pa gzhan du 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid mtshon pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum dang lkog tu gyur pa dag rnam pa gzhan du 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid mtshon pa yin no //
translated: the characteristics of the directly perceived and the indirectly perceived would be different.

original: de de ltar na 'di ltar don 'ga' zhig gis mngon sum yin pa de thams cad snang ba'i rang bzhin gyi gnas skabs yin par khas len pa'i phyir dang so sor nges pa'i ngo bor gzung ba ma yin par lkog tu gyur pa /
analyzed: de de ltar na 'di ltar don 'ga' zhig gis mngon sum yin pa de thams cad snang ba'i rang bzhin gyi gnas skabs yin par khas len pa'i phyir dang so sor nges pa'i ngo bor gzung ba ma yin par lkog tu gyur pa /
translated: Thus, in this way, all that is direct perception in terms of some object is accepted as being the state of the nature of appearance, and it is not apprehended as the nature of a particular determination.

original: ci'i mtshan nyid can yin no zhes tha snyad du byas so //
analyzed: ci'i mtshan nyid can yin no zhes tha snyad du byas so //
translated: It is said to be conventionally designated as having the characteristic of being hidden.

original: de bas na mdor bsdu na gang gis rang gi ngo bo 'dzin pa de ni mngon sum yin zhing /
analyzed: de bas na mdor bsdu na gang gis rang gi ngo bo 'dzin pa de ni mngon sum yin zhing /
translated: Therefore, in brief, that which apprehends its own nature is direct perception.

original: gzhan ni lkog tu gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ni lkog tu gyur pa yin no //
translated: The other is hidden.üîΩThat which is asserted to be the hidden object of a conceptual consciousness is not hidden because it apprehends the nature of that object.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa'i gzung ba lkog tu gyur pa'i don yin par 'dod pa gang yin pa de ni des de'i rang gi ngo bo 'dzin pas na de lkog tu gyur pa ma yin pa de ltar na mngon sum dang lkog tu gyur pa'i mtshan nyid
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa'i gzung ba lkog tu gyur pa'i don yin par 'dod pa gang yin pa de ni des de'i rang gi ngo bo 'dzin pas na de lkog tu gyur pa ma yin pa de ltar na mngon sum dang lkog tu gyur pa'i mtshan nyid
translated: In that case, the characteristics of direct perception and hidden phenomena

original: tha dad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tha dad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: would not be different.

original: dbang po'i sgo nas rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po'i sgo nas rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not realized through the sense faculties.

original: lkog tu gyur pa ma yin pa la yang dbang po las de'i rang bzhin las ngo bo lhag pa 'dzin pa med pa na /
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa ma yin pa la yang dbang po las de'i rang bzhin las ngo bo lhag pa 'dzin pa med pa na /
translated: And if it is not hidden, then since the nature of that object is not apprehended by the sense faculty as something superior to its own nature,üîΩby what means is it not apprehended?

original: gang gis na de'i sgo nas mi rtogs pa'i phyir mngon sum nyid ma yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gis na de'i sgo nas mi rtogs pa'i phyir mngon sum nyid ma yin par 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, it is not non-perception.

original: dbang po'i sgo nas bde ba la sogs pa mngon sum nyid du 'dod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang po'i sgo nas bde ba la sogs pa mngon sum nyid du 'dod pa ma yin no //
translated: We do not assert that pleasure, etc. are directly perceived by the sense faculties.

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: rang gi ngo ngo rtogs pa las yin no //
analyzed: rang gi ngo ngo rtogs pa las yin no //
translated: They are directly perceived by the self-awareness that experiences them.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pas rang gi ngo bo rtogs pa de ltar dbang pos kyang yin pa de ltar na khyad par med pa'i phyir dbang po don med pa yin no zhes bya ba skyon 'di gzhan yin no //üîΩdon de la phan tshun mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba gsal ba dang mi gsal ba'i @147a * //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pas rang gi ngo bo rtogs pa de ltar dbang pos kyang yin pa de ltar na khyad par med pa'i phyir dbang po don med pa yin no zhes bya ba skyon 'di gzhan yin no // don de la phan tshun mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba gsal ba dang mi gsal ba'i @147a * //
translated: The error that you have stated, namely, that if the sense faculties are the direct perceivers of objects, then the sense faculties would be useless because there would be no difference between the sense faculties and the self-awareness that experiences them, is not correct.

original: rnam pa yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: rnam pa yod pa ma yin la /
translated: The object does not have the aspect of being either manifest or unmanifest, since it has no other characteristics.

original: gang rnam pa gsal ba 'dzin pa las dbang po 'bras bu dang bcas par 'gyur ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: gang rnam pa gsal ba 'dzin pa las dbang po 'bras bu dang bcas par 'gyur ro zhes bshad do //
translated: The sense faculty together with its effect is the cause of the retention of the clear image.

original: rnam par brtag par bya ba gang yan pa de'i ngo bo mngon sum gyi sgo nas rnam pa ji ltar yang gzung bar bya ba ma yin gyi 'on kyang rnam par rtog pa thams cad ni don nyams su myong bas byas pa'i 'khrul pa de yin no //
analyzed: rnam par brtag par bya ba gang yan pa de'i ngo bo mngon sum gyi sgo nas rnam pa ji ltar yang gzung bar bya ba ma yin gyi 'on kyang rnam par rtog pa thams cad ni don nyams su myong bas byas pa'i 'khrul pa de yin no //
translated: The object that is to be imagined is not apprehended by the mode of direct perception, but rather all imagination is the error that is produced by the experience of the object.

original: de la skyon yod pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: de la skyon yod pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: There is no fault in this,

original: 'khrul pa yin na yang rnam par rtog pa gang gi brgyud pa yang nye ba na yod pa yin na /
analyzed: 'khrul pa yin na yang rnam par rtog pa gang gi brgyud pa yang nye ba na yod pa yin na /
translated: because even though there is error, the continuum of the imagination is close by.

original: 'di ltar rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa'i gzung ba'i cha nyid la rang gi mtshan nyid du zhen pa'i ngo bo de nyid du nges par byas nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa'i gzung ba'i cha nyid la rang gi mtshan nyid du zhen pa'i ngo bo de nyid du nges par byas nas /
translated: Thus, having ascertained the aspect of the object of the consciousness of imagination to be the nature of the object,

original: skyes bu 'jug pa ni don dang phrad pa yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu 'jug pa ni don dang phrad pa yin no //
translated: the person engages in the object and encounters the object.

original: rnam par rtog pa de nyid tshad ma yin gyi gzhan don mthong ba sngon du song ba can las skyes pa'i phyir brgyud nas 'ongs pa yin du zin kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa de nyid tshad ma yin gyi gzhan don mthong ba sngon du song ba can las skyes pa'i phyir brgyud nas 'ongs pa yin du zin kyang ma yin no //
translated: That very conceptualization is a valid cognition, because it arises from the prior perception of the object. Even though it is indirectly derived, it is not a valid cognition.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: ma mthong bdag nyid ngo bo de //
analyzed: ma mthong bdag nyid ngo bo de //
translated: The nature of the unseen self

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi ngang gi ngo bo ma mthong ba de ni dngos su rtogs pa de yod pa tsam gyis /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi ngang gi ngo bo ma mthong ba de ni dngos su rtogs pa de yod pa tsam gyis /
translated: The nature of the unseen self, which is the intrinsic nature of the particular, is directly realized by the mere existence of that realization.

original: rtogs pa 'di rten don gzhan yin //
analyzed: rtogs pa 'di rten don gzhan yin //
translated: This realization is for the sake of another object.

original: don gzhan grub pas de grub pa yin te //
analyzed: don gzhan grub pas de grub pa yin te //
translated: The establishment of another object is the establishment of that.

original: de'i gzhan la brten pa can grub pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i gzhan la brten pa can grub pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is established as dependent on that other.

original: rtags can rtogs pa ni de'i rang gi ngo bo ma bzung na yang rtags 'dzin pa bzhin du de mi slu ba'i phyir te rtogs pa zhes tha snyad gdags te des kyang lkog gi don rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtags can rtogs pa ni de'i rang gi ngo bo ma bzung na yang rtags 'dzin pa bzhin du de mi slu ba'i phyir te rtogs pa zhes tha snyad gdags te des kyang lkog gi don rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though the realization of the sign does not grasp its intrinsic nature, it is non-deceptive like the grasping of the sign, and is designated as realization because it realizes the hidden object.

original: rten gyi don du 'dod pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: rten gyi don du 'dod pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: That which is accepted as the meaning of the basis

original: gal te de rten bsgrub par bya ba'i chos me ma yin pa rnam par gcod pa gang yin pa de'i rten sa phyogs la sogs pa'i chos can no //
analyzed: gal te de rten bsgrub par bya ba'i chos me ma yin pa rnam par gcod pa gang yin pa de'i rten sa phyogs la sogs pa'i chos can no //
translated: If it is the property to be established, then the subject is the property possessor, which is the basis of the exclusion of non-fire.

original: gal te chos can de dang 'brel pa can 'gyur na'o //
analyzed: gal te chos can de dang 'brel pa can 'gyur na'o //
translated: If it is related to that subject.

original: 'dis ni chos can dang 'brel pa can bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni chos can dang 'brel pa can bstan to //
translated: This shows the subject and the property possessor.

original: yang rnam pa gzhan du don gzhan zur gyis bstan pa ste /
analyzed: yang rnam pa gzhan du don gzhan zur gyis bstan pa ste /
translated: Moreover, in another way, the other meaning is indirectly indicated.

original: gang la lkog tu gyur pa'i don rtogs pa'i rten gyi don snang ba de chos can no //üîΩbsgrub par bya ba gang la rten chos can yod pa de ni de rten can no //
analyzed: gang la lkog tu gyur pa'i don rtogs pa'i rten gyi don snang ba de chos can no // bsgrub par bya ba gang la rten chos can yod pa de ni de rten can no //
translated: The subject is that which appears as the basis for the understanding of the hidden meaning.üîΩThe property possessor is that which has the subject as its basis, where the property to be established exists.

original: gal te bsgrub par bya ba'i chos de dang 'brel pa can du 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: gal te bsgrub par bya ba'i chos de dang 'brel pa can du 'gyur ba ste /
translated: If it is related to that property to be established.

original: med na mi 'byung bar 'gyur na'o //
analyzed: med na mi 'byung bar 'gyur na'o //
translated: If it is invariably concomitant.

original: 'dis ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the positive and negative concomitance.

original: de ltar na gal te tshul gsum @147b dang ldan pa yin na /
analyzed: de ltar na gal te tshul gsum @147b dang ldan pa yin na /
translated: Thus, if it has the three modes,

original: de tshe go byed yin /
analyzed: de tshe go byed yin /
translated: then it is an indicator.

original: de lta ma yin na 'ba' zhig las thams cad la thams cad rtogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'ba' zhig las thams cad la thams cad rtogs pa'i phyir /
translated: If it were not so, then all would be understood from all, because of the understanding of all from all.

original: thams cad la thams cad kyi go bar byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad la thams cad kyi go bar byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: And so all would be understood from all.

original: de pas na chos can dang 'brel pas can gyi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dang ldan pa'i don las bskal pa'i don rtogs pa yin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de pas na chos can dang 'brel pas can gyi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dang ldan pa'i don las bskal pa'i don rtogs pa yin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be said that the meaning of the exclusion is understood from the meaning of the concomitance and the counter-pervasion that are related to the subject.

original: don de 'dra ba las de rtogs pa de ni so sor nges pa'i tshul gyis ma yin te //
analyzed: don de 'dra ba las de rtogs pa de ni so sor nges pa'i tshul gyis ma yin te //
translated: The understanding of that from such a meaning is not by the mode of individual determination,

original: de med na yang de yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med na yang de yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it exists even when that does not exist.üîΩBut,

original: 'on kyang / de tshe go byed rjes 'gro ba //
analyzed: 'on kyang / de tshe go byed rjes 'gro ba //
translated: at that time, the concomitance of the indicator

original: spyi yis ngo bo nyid du rtogs //
analyzed: spyi yis ngo bo nyid du rtogs //
translated: is understood as the nature of the universal.

original: rtags ni rtags can nyid yod na yod pa'i phyir go bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rtags ni rtags can nyid yod na yod pa'i phyir go bar byed pa yin no //
translated: The indicator is the indicator itself when it exists, because it exists.

original: don tsam yod na 'gyur ba gang yin ba de ni don tsam yin la de ni go bar byed pa'i rjes su 'gro bar byed bas na go bar byed pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: don tsam yod na 'gyur ba gang yin ba de ni don tsam yin la de ni go bar byed pa'i rjes su 'gro bar byed bas na go bar byed pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'o //
translated: That which is the mere object when it exists is the mere object, and that is the concomitance of the indicator, so it is the concomitance of the indicator.

original: go bar byed pa'i rjes su 'gro ba yang de yin la spyi'i ngo bo yang yin pas na de skad ces bya'o//
analyzed: go bar byed pa'i rjes su 'gro ba yang de yin la spyi'i ngo bo yang yin pas na de skad ces bya'o//
translated: It is a universal because it is a general entity.

original: gang gi tshe go bar byed pa'i rjes su 'gro ba spyi'i ngo bo yin pa de ltar na go bar byed pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i spyi'i ngo bo nyid du rtogs pa de'i tshe //
analyzed: gang gi tshe go bar byed pa'i rjes su 'gro ba spyi'i ngo bo yin pa de ltar na go bar byed pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i spyi'i ngo bo nyid du rtogs pa de'i tshe //
translated: When a universal is understood to be a general entity that is concomitant with the awareness of the particular,

original: bskal pa'i don rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog pa dang ldan pa'i rtags las nges pa yin gyi so sor nges pa'i ngo bor yang ma yin te /
analyzed: bskal pa'i don rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog pa dang ldan pa'i rtags las nges pa yin gyi so sor nges pa'i ngo bor yang ma yin te /
translated: then the meaning of the word is ascertained from the evidence of the concomitance and the counter-pervasion of the universal, not from the evidence of the particular.

original: don tsam dang rtags kyi 'brel pa grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don tsam dang rtags kyi 'brel pa grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the relation between the word and the meaning is established in general.

original: gang gi phyir 'brel pa can gyi don las lkog tu gyur pa'i don la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'brel pa can gyi don las lkog tu gyur pa'i don la /
translated: Because the relation between the word and the meaning is established in general,

original: spyi nyid du rtogs pa 'byung bar 'gyur gyi rnam pa gzhan du ma yin pa /
analyzed: spyi nyid du rtogs pa 'byung bar 'gyur gyi rnam pa gzhan du ma yin pa /
translated: the awareness of the meaning arises from the universal, not from the particular.

original: de'i phyir lkog gyur don thams cad khyad par du ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir lkog gyur don thams cad khyad par du ni /
translated: Therefore, all hidden objects are ascertained by universals, not by particulars.

original: dper na me rtsva las 'byung ba dang / lo ma las 'byung ba dang gsal ba dang / chen po dang / chung du zhes bya ba rang gi rnam pa so sor nges par rtogs mi 'gyur /
analyzed: dper na me rtsva las 'byung ba dang / lo ma las 'byung ba dang gsal ba dang / chen po dang / chung du zhes bya ba rang gi rnam pa so sor nges par rtogs mi 'gyur /
translated: For example, one would not understand the individual determinations of the aspects of fire, such as that it arises from fuel, that it arises from leaves, that it is bright, that it is large, that it is small.

original: nges par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: nges par mi 'gyur te /
translated: One would not understand them with certainty.

original: 'on kyang me yod pa tsam yin no //üîΩ'brel pa can gyi chos dag las /
analyzed: 'on kyang me yod pa tsam yin no // 'brel pa can gyi chos dag las /
translated: But it is just the existence of fire.üîΩFrom the properties that are related,üîΩfrom the reason that has the property of pervasion,

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dang ldan pa'i rtags dag las de dang ldan pa'i chos can la /üîΩbsgrub par bya ba'i chos /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dang ldan pa'i rtags dag las de dang ldan pa'i chos can la / bsgrub par bya ba'i chos /
translated: in the subject that has that property,

original: rtogs skye ba gang /
analyzed: rtogs skye ba gang /
translated: the arising of the understanding of the property to be established,

original: de ni rjes dpag yin no //
analyzed: de ni rjes dpag yin no //
translated: that is inference.

original: chos can las skyes zhes bya ba 'dis ni chos can dang 'brel pa can bstan to //
analyzed: chos can las skyes zhes bya ba 'dis ni chos can dang 'brel pa can bstan to //
translated: By saying ‚Äúarises from the subject,‚Äù it shows that it is related to the subject.

original: 'brel pa can gyis zhes bya ba 'dis ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa bstan to //üîΩtshul @148a * //
analyzed: 'brel pa can gyis zhes bya ba 'dis ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa bstan to // tshul @148a * //
translated: By saying ‚Äúfrom the related,‚Äù it shows the pervasion.üîΩThe three modes of the reason

original: gsum pa'i rtags las lkog tu gyur pa'i don la /
analyzed: gsum pa'i rtags las lkog tu gyur pa'i don la /
translated: in the hidden object,

original: spyi'i ngo bo nyid du rtogs pa de yang rjes su dpag pa nyid gang yin pa'i rgyu de nyid kyi lkog tu gyur pa'i don de dag gi sgrub byed gcig rjes su dpag pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: spyi'i ngo bo nyid du rtogs pa de yang rjes su dpag pa nyid gang yin pa'i rgyu de nyid kyi lkog tu gyur pa'i don de dag gi sgrub byed gcig rjes su dpag pa nyid yin no //
translated: And that realization of the general nature is itself the only proof of those hidden objects, namely, inference itself.

original: 'dis ni rjes su dpag pa las gzhan pa las rtogs pa yod ba ma yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni rjes su dpag pa las gzhan pa las rtogs pa yod ba ma yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: This shows that there is no other means of knowing besides inference.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar na rang gi ngo bo rtogs pa gang yin pa de ni mngon sum yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar na rang gi ngo bo rtogs pa gang yin pa de ni mngon sum yin la /
translated: Because of that, whatever realization there is of a nature is perception.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i rtags yod na lkog tu gyur pa'i don gzhan thams cad ni rjes su dpag par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i rtags yod na lkog tu gyur pa'i don gzhan thams cad ni rjes su dpag par bya ba yin te /
translated: And whatever realization there is of all other hidden objects, given the existence of the reason explained above, is inference.

original: rnam pa gzhan gyis rtogs pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan gyis rtogs pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro//
translated: Because it is impossible to realize them in any other way.

original: de phyir / mngon sum lkog tu gyur pa las //üîΩgzhal bya gzhan ni yod ma yin //
analyzed: de phyir / mngon sum lkog tu gyur pa las // gzhal bya gzhan ni yod ma yin //
translated: Therefore,üîΩThere is no other object of knowledge

original: gang zhig gzhan ni sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig gzhan ni sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: Besides the hidden one.üîΩThat is what is established.

original: gang gis na rjes su dpag pa las tshad ma'i khyad par gzhan cung zad yod par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gis na rjes su dpag pa las tshad ma'i khyad par gzhan cung zad yod par 'gyur /
translated: By what means could there be any other kind of valid cognition besides inference?

original: de phyir gzhal bya gnyis nyid kyis //
analyzed: de phyir gzhal bya gnyis nyid kyis //
translated: Therefore, because of the two kinds of objects of valid knowledge,

original: tshad ma dag ni gnyis nyid bzhed //
analyzed: tshad ma dag ni gnyis nyid bzhed //
translated: the two valid knowledges are accepted.

original: mngon sum gyi rang gi don gyi ngo bo rtogs pa ni mngon sum gyi tshad ma yin la /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi rang gi don gyi ngo bo rtogs pa ni mngon sum gyi tshad ma yin la /
translated: The realization of the nature of one‚Äôs own object by direct perception is direct perception valid knowledge.

original: lkog tu gyur pa'i ji skad bshad pa'i gzhan gyi yan lag tsam gyi rtogs pa rjes su dpag pa yin pa de ltar na tshad ma ni gnyis kho na yin no //
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa'i ji skad bshad pa'i gzhan gyi yan lag tsam gyi rtogs pa rjes su dpag pa yin pa de ltar na tshad ma ni gnyis kho na yin no //
translated: The realization of the hidden, which is the mere otherness explained above, is inference. Thus there are only two valid knowledges.

original: gzhal bya gnyis ni mthong phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhal bya gnyis ni mthong phyir ro //
translated: Because of the two kinds of objects of valid knowledge.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid dang cig shos te /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid dang cig shos te /
translated: One‚Äôs own characteristics and the other.

original: gzhal bya gnyis bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhal bya gnyis bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of teaching the two objects of valid knowledge.

original: gsum gcig grangs ni bsal ba'am //
analyzed: gsum gcig grangs ni bsal ba'am //
translated: The number three is eliminated by one.

original: gzhal bya gnyis bstan pas tshad ma gsum la sogs pa bsal ba dang / tshad ma gcig bsal cing slob dpon gyis mngon sum ma yin pa'i tshad ma yang yod do zhes bstan to //
analyzed: gzhal bya gnyis bstan pas tshad ma gsum la sogs pa bsal ba dang / tshad ma gcig bsal cing slob dpon gyis mngon sum ma yin pa'i tshad ma yang yod do zhes bstan to //
translated: Because of teaching the two objects of valid knowledge, three valid knowledges and so on are eliminated, and because of teaching that there is valid knowledge that is not direct perception, one valid knowledge is eliminated.

original: gang gi phyir gzhal bya gzhan gsum pa med pa'i phyir tshad ma gsum la sogs pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzhal bya gzhan gsum pa med pa'i phyir tshad ma gsum la sogs pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Because there is no third kind of object of apprehension, the three means of valid cognition and so on do not exist.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: This is so, but

original: gal te med na gzhal bya nyid //
analyzed: gal te med na gzhal bya nyid //
translated: if it does not exist, it is not an object of apprehension.üîΩThe object of apprehension is one, because it is not a sense object other than perception.

original: min phyir gcig yin mngon sum las gzhan pa'i don 'ba' zhig lkog tu 'gyur ba'i don 'jigs rten pha rol la sogs pa 'ba' zhig kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: min phyir gcig yin mngon sum las gzhan pa'i don 'ba' zhig lkog tu 'gyur ba'i don 'jigs rten pha rol la sogs pa 'ba' zhig kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The world beyond, and so on, which are only hidden objects, do not exist.

original: 'o na ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: med pa nyid yin zhing med pa nyid kyi phyir gzhal bya ma yin la /
analyzed: med pa nyid yin zhing med pa nyid kyi phyir gzhal bya ma yin la /
translated: Because it does not exist, it is not an object of apprehension.

original: gzhal bya ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir mngon sum gyi dngos po gzhal bya gcig nyid yin no //
analyzed: gzhal bya ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir mngon sum gyi dngos po gzhal bya gcig nyid yin no //
translated: Because it is not an object of apprehension, the object of apprehension is one, the entity of perception.

original: sbyor ba ni gang med pa de ni gzhal bya ba yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang med pa de ni gzhal bya ba yin te /
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever does not exist is not an object of apprehension,

original: dper na ri bong gi rva la sogs pa @148b lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na ri bong gi rva la sogs pa @148b lta bu'o //
translated: like the horn of an ass, and so on.üîΩThe universal does not exist.

original: spyi yang med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa yin par sems so //
analyzed: spyi yang med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa yin par sems so //
translated: I think that this is the observation of a contradiction with the pervader.

original: kho bo'ang 'dod /
analyzed: kho bo'ang 'dod /
translated: I also accept that.

original: de ni kho bo cag kyang 'dod pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ni kho bo cag kyang 'dod pa nyid yin no //
translated: We also accept that.

original: gzhal bya gnyis su rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhal bya gnyis su rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: The object of comprehension is posited as twofold.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid las gzhal bya gzhan spyi ni yod pa ma yin pa de ltar na grub pa la sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid las gzhal bya gzhan spyi ni yod pa ma yin pa de ltar na grub pa la sgrub pa yin no //
translated: The object of comprehension is not different from the particular, and thus this is a proof of what is already established.

original: med pa gzhal bya nyid ma yin pa nyid du bsgrub par bya ba la gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: med pa gzhal bya nyid ma yin pa nyid du bsgrub par bya ba la gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin no //
translated: The reason is indeterminate in proving that the nonexistent is not an object of comprehension.

original: 'di ltar des kyang tshad ma gzhan 'ba' zhig gis 'jig rten pha rol med par nges par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar des kyang tshad ma gzhan 'ba' zhig gis 'jig rten pha rol med par nges par bya ba yin la /
translated: In that case, it is only by another valid cognition that one ascertains that there is no world beyond.

original: de yang nges par byed pa ni gzhal bya nyid las ma 'das pa'i phyir rang nyid kyis ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang nges par byed pa ni gzhal bya nyid las ma 'das pa'i phyir rang nyid kyis ma nges pa yin no //
translated: And that ascertainment is not beyond being an object of comprehension, and thus it is not ascertained by itself.

original: de lta ma yin na 'jigs rten pha rol la sogs pa med pa'i yul can gyi tshad ma med pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'jigs rten pha rol la sogs pa med pa'i yul can gyi tshad ma med pa de'i tshe /
translated: Otherwise, if there is no valid cognition that has as its object the nonexistence of a world beyond, etc.,

original: 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa med pa ni de rang gi rnam par ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa med pa ni de rang gi rnam par ma nges pa yin no //
translated: then the object of that nonexistence of a world beyond, etc., is not ascertained by itself.

original: de nyid la rnam par nges pa med na yang /
analyzed: de nyid la rnam par nges pa med na yang /
translated: And even though there is no ascertainment of that,

original: gzhan yang de la rtogs pa skyed pa rmi nus pa yin na de la med pa'i nges pa yang yod pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang de la rtogs pa skyed pa rmi nus pa yin na de la med pa'i nges pa yang yod pa yin no //
translated: there is also the ascertainment that it is not possible for there to be an awareness of it.

original: de bas na de nges pa yod na /
analyzed: de bas na de nges pa yod na /
translated: Therefore, if there is ascertainment of that,

original: med pa'i nges pa gang yin pa de nyid tshad ma gnyis yin /
analyzed: med pa'i nges pa gang yin pa de nyid tshad ma gnyis yin /
translated: that very ascertainment of nonexistence is the two valid cognitions.

original: rjes su dpag pa zhes bya ba'i tshad ma gzhan shugs kyis 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa zhes bya ba'i tshad ma gzhan shugs kyis 'gyur ro //
translated: The other valid cognition called inference is implied.

original: de bas na med pa'i gzhal bya yin pa de ltar na dper bsgrub par bya bas stong pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na med pa'i gzhal bya yin pa de ltar na dper bsgrub par bya bas stong pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the example is empty of the probandum.

original: sbyor ba yang gang zhig rnam pa 'ba' zhig gis nges pa yin pa de ni tshad mas yongs su dpyad par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba yang gang zhig rnam pa 'ba' zhig gis nges pa yin pa de ni tshad mas yongs su dpyad par bya ba yin te /
translated: And the syllogism is: Whatever is ascertained by a mere aspect is to be analyzed by a valid cognition,

original: dper na mngon sum gyi don lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na mngon sum gyi don lta bu'o //
translated: like the object of a direct perception.

original: med pa yang rnam pa 'ba' zhig gis nges par 'dod do zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: med pa yang rnam pa 'ba' zhig gis nges par 'dod do zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: And nonexistence is asserted to be ascertained by a mere aspect. This is a natural inference.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: This is the case, but

original: mngon sum nyid las 'jig rten pha rol dang skyes bu khyad par med pa la sogs pa grub pa de ltar na tshad ma gnyis pa yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: mngon sum nyid las 'jig rten pha rol dang skyes bu khyad par med pa la sogs pa grub pa de ltar na tshad ma gnyis pa yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the world is established by direct perception itself, and that there is no difference between the world beyond and a person, then there is no second valid cognition.

original: de ni med la dbang skyes blo ma yin /
analyzed: de ni med la dbang skyes blo ma yin /
translated: That is not so, because it is not a cognition arisen from the sense faculties.

original: mngon sum las med pa grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum las med pa grub pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not established to be without direct perception.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dbang po las skyes pa'i blo de ni /
analyzed: dbang po las skyes pa'i blo de ni /
translated: Because that cognition arisen from the sense faculties

original: don gyi stobs las skye phyir ro //
analyzed: don gyi stobs las skye phyir ro //
translated: arises from the power of the object.

original: mngon sum las med pa grub par 'dod pas de med pa'i yul can nyid du bstan par 'gyur na /
analyzed: mngon sum las med pa grub par 'dod pas de med pa'i yul can nyid du bstan par 'gyur na /
translated: If you assert that it is established to be without direct perception, then it would be shown to be a subject that does not exist.

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: But that is also unreasonable.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: don gyi nus pa la ltos nas skye pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don gyi nus pa la ltos nas skye pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it arises in dependence on the potency of the object.

original: de lta ma yin na @149a * //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na @149a * //
translated: If it were not so,

original: don yod pa nyid dang yul rung ba nye ba nyid la ltos pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: don yod pa nyid dang yul rung ba nye ba nyid la ltos pa med pa yin no //
translated: it would not depend on the mere existence of the object and the proximity of the object.

original: ci ste blo don gyi nus pa nyid la ltos pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste blo don gyi nus pa nyid la ltos pa yin zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the cognition depends on the potency of the object itself,

original: de'i tshe na /
analyzed: de'i tshe na /
translated: then at that time,

original: don nus pa la ltos med na //
analyzed: don nus pa la ltos med na //
translated: if the object does not depend on potency,üîΩthen

original: chod pa la sogs pa des kyang dngos po'i sun pa nyid la gags byed pa med pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: chod pa la sogs pa des kyang dngos po'i sun pa nyid la gags byed pa med pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: And even if there is an obstruction, etc., there is no obstruction to the negation of the thing.

original: chod pa la sogs yod na yang //
analyzed: chod pa la sogs yod na yang //
translated: Even if there is an obstruction, etc.,

original: dbang skyes blo ni skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: dbang skyes blo ni skye bar 'gyur //
translated: the cognition produced by the sense faculty arises.

original: ji ltar na rang nyid dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa /
analyzed: ji ltar na rang nyid dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa /
translated: How can a cognition that has the characteristic of perceiving itself

original: gzhan dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi mngon sum gyis med pa grub par 'dod ce na /
analyzed: gzhan dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi mngon sum gyis med pa grub par 'dod ce na /
translated: establish the nonexistence of something else that has the characteristic of being perceived?

original: de la yang mngon sum ni med pa'i yul can ma yin no //
analyzed: de la yang mngon sum ni med pa'i yul can ma yin no //
translated: In this case, perception does not have a nonexistent object.

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is it, then?

original: de nyid kyis dngos bo nyid yongs su gcod par byed mod kyi /
analyzed: de nyid kyis dngos bo nyid yongs su gcod par byed mod kyi /
translated: It does indeed determine the thing itself.

original: 'on kyang gzhan gang yin pa de zhes brjod do //
analyzed: 'on kyang gzhan gang yin pa de zhes brjod do //
