translated: But it is said that it determines the other, that is, the absence of another.

original: de ldog pa'i sgo nas des de nyid kyi rang bzhin nges pa 'ba' zhig yongs su gcod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ldog pa'i sgo nas des de nyid kyi rang bzhin nges pa 'ba' zhig yongs su gcod pa'i phyir /
translated: By the exclusion of that, it determines only the nature of that itself.

original: gzhan rnam par gcod par byed pa yin no zhes brjod do //
analyzed: gzhan rnam par gcod par byed pa yin no zhes brjod do //
translated: Therefore, it is said to exclude the other.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: This is how it is.

original: gal te mngon sum ldog pa las //
analyzed: gal te mngon sum ldog pa las //
translated: If perception determines the absence of another

original: med pa'ang nges pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: med pa'ang nges pa nyid yin no //
translated: and non-existence is ascertained.

original: kho bo ni mngon sum 'jug par gyur pa med pa sgrub pa yin no zhes mi smra'o //
analyzed: kho bo ni mngon sum 'jug par gyur pa med pa sgrub pa yin no zhes mi smra'o //
translated: We do not say that the non-existence of what has entered into the range of perception is established.

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na mngon sum de nyid ldog pa ni gnas skabs gzhan yin zhing de ldog pa las med pa nges pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na mngon sum de nyid ldog pa ni gnas skabs gzhan yin zhing de ldog pa las med pa nges pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you ask what we do say, we say that the non-existence of that perception is ascertained from the cessation of that perception, which is a different state.

original: de ltar na ni 'gal ba'am mngon sum nyid ldog pa las med pa nges pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na ni 'gal ba'am mngon sum nyid ldog pa las med pa nges pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba yin no //
translated: If that is so, then you contradict your own words, for you say that the non-existence of what is contradictory with perception is ascertained from the cessation of perception.

original: de ldog pa las nges par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni mngon sum las 'gyur pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ldog pa las nges par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni mngon sum las 'gyur pa ma yin te /
translated: That which is ascertained from the cessation of that is not ascertained from perception,

original: mngon sum de dang de med pa de gcig pa nyid du mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum de dang de med pa de gcig pa nyid du mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not tenable that that perception and the non-existence of that are the same.

original: gcig nyid du yin na yang dngos po bzhin du don gyi bya ba byed pa'i phyir de med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gcig nyid du yin na yang dngos po bzhin du don gyi bya ba byed pa'i phyir de med pa ma yin no //
translated: And if they are the same, then like an existent thing, it would perform the function of an object, and therefore it would not be non-existent.

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: If you ask what it is,

original: dngos po nyid yin no //
analyzed: dngos po nyid yin no //
translated: it is an existent thing.

original: de bas na med pa sgrub par byed pa mngon sum yin no zhes smra bas de yod pa nyid du nye bar 'jog pa las med pa de sgrub par byed pa nyid yin ba /
analyzed: de bas na med pa sgrub par byed pa mngon sum yin no zhes smra bas de yod pa nyid du nye bar 'jog pa las med pa de sgrub par byed pa nyid yin ba /
translated: Therefore, when one says that non-existence is established by perception, one is positing the existence of that perception, and it is that existence which is the proof.

original: de ldog pa las zhes bya ba'i tshig las yod pa nyid ldog pas sgrub par byed pa nyid ma yin par smras par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ldog pa las zhes bya ba'i tshig las yod pa nyid ldog pas sgrub par byed pa nyid ma yin par smras par 'gyur ro //
translated: And from the words ‚Äúby the cessation of that,‚Äù one is saying that it is the cessation of existence which is the proof.

original: sgrub pa byed pa nyid ma yin pa de dang de ni 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: sgrub pa byed pa nyid ma yin pa de dang de ni 'gal ba yin no //
translated: And that which is not a proof is contradictory.

original: sbyor ba dag ni gang zhig gi sgrub par byed pa yin pa @149b de ni de grub pa ni thag nye ba na yod pa can du 'gyur te /
analyzed: sbyor ba dag ni gang zhig gi sgrub par byed pa yin pa @149b de ni de grub pa ni thag nye ba na yod pa can du 'gyur te /
translated: And that which is a proof is that which is proximate to the establishment of that which is to be established.

original: dper na 'bras bu can gyi me la sogs pa'am gzugs la sogs pa'i sgrub par byed pas sgron ma la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'bras bu can gyi me la sogs pa'am gzugs la sogs pa'i sgrub par byed pas sgron ma la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, fire, etc. are the proofs of the existence of smoke, etc. and the lamp, etc. are the proofs of form, etc.

original: med pa yang mngon sum sgrub par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: med pa yang mngon sum sgrub par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: ‚ÄúNon-existence is also a proof of perception‚Äù is a natural inference.

original: gang zhig gang la yod pa ma yin pa de ni /
analyzed: gang zhig gang la yod pa ma yin pa de ni /
translated: That which does not exist in something is not a proof of that.

original: de'i rtogs par byed pa'am gsal bar byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i rtogs par byed pa'am gsal bar byed pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not the revealer or the illuminator of that.

original: dper na gzugs kyi sgron ma med pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na gzugs kyi sgron ma med pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the nonexistence of a lamp of form.

original: mngon sum yang med par rtogs pa la yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum yang med par rtogs pa la yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: And also, ‚Äúnonexistence is not in the realization of nonexistence,‚Äù is the nonapprehension of the pervader.

original: de bas na mngon sum las med pa grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na mngon sum las med pa grub pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, nonexistence is not established by perception.

original: gang yang kho bo cag mi dmigs pa mngon sum gyis grub par 'dod pa de la med pa yul du byed pa'i phyir mngon sum gyi tshad mas grub pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gang yang kho bo cag mi dmigs pa mngon sum gyis grub par 'dod pa de la med pa yul du byed pa'i phyir mngon sum gyi tshad mas grub pa ma yin gyi /
translated: And also, ‚Äúwe do not assert that nonapprehension is established by perception,‚Äù because it does not take nonexistence as its object, it is not established by the valid knowledge of perception.

original: 'on kyang shes pa gcig la 'drer rung bar snang ba'i don dag las /
analyzed: 'on kyang shes pa gcig la 'drer rung bar snang ba'i don dag las /
translated: However, from among the objects that appear to be suitable to be mixed in a single cognition,

original: de dngos po gcig nyid gzhan dang 'dre ba can ma yin pa nyid de las grub pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de dngos po gcig nyid gzhan dang 'dre ba can ma yin pa nyid de las grub pa nyid yin no //
translated: it is established from that very fact that a single entity is not a mixer with another.

original: de yang dngos po gzhan grub pa nyid na /
analyzed: de yang dngos po gzhan grub pa nyid na /
translated: And also, when the existence of another entity is established,

original: med pa grub pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa grub pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: nonexistence is established.

original: de ltar 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But that is not the case with other worlds and so on.

original: de dang mtshungs par rung ba'i gnas skas can gyi dngos po gzhan dang 'dre ba med pa can rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang mtshungs par rung ba'i gnas skas can gyi dngos po gzhan dang 'dre ba med pa can rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not mixed with other things of the same kind, and because it is not a cognition.

original: de dag ni shes pa gcig la 'dra ba mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni shes pa gcig la 'dra ba mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not possible for them to be similar in a single cognition.

original: gzhan gyis mngon sum ldog pa las med pa zhes bya ba'i nges pa khas len na /
analyzed: gzhan gyis mngon sum ldog pa las med pa zhes bya ba'i nges pa khas len na /
translated: If you accept that the absence of a cognition is a non-cognition,

original: ldog pa de 'khrul pa med pa can gang las yin te /
analyzed: ldog pa de 'khrul pa med pa can gang las yin te /
translated: then from what is that non-cognition non-erroneous?

original: rtogs pa po'i mngon sum log pa las rnam pa gzhan du yang snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtogs pa po'i mngon sum log pa las rnam pa gzhan du yang snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the cognition of the cognizer is reversed, and it appears in another way.

original: ci ste 'di'i 'khrul pa med pa 'ga' zhig gis /
analyzed: ci ste 'di'i 'khrul pa med pa 'ga' zhig gis /
translated: But if it is non-erroneous in some cases,

original: sgrub par byed pa de'i tshe rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa can de med pa dang lhan cig khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa de'i tshe rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa can de med pa dang lhan cig khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: then at that time, the presence of the reason and the absence of the probandum must be accepted together.

original: gal te rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa can yin pa de'i tshe de nyid rjes 'gro dang / ldog pa can gyi rtags yin no //
analyzed: gal te rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa can yin pa de'i tshe de nyid rjes 'gro dang / ldog pa can gyi rtags yin no //
translated: If it is present in the presence of the reason and absent in its absence, then that itself is the reason that is concomitant with the probandum.

original: de ltar na rjes su dpag pa tshad mar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na rjes su dpag pa tshad mar 'gyur te /
translated: In that case, inference would be a valid cognition.

original: 'khrul pa med par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khrul pa med par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: in order to demonstrate that there is no error.

original: kyang gi sgra ni rim pa gzhan du sbyar ba yin te /
analyzed: kyang gi sgra ni rim pa gzhan du sbyar ba yin te /
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù is to be connected to the other sequence.

original: 'dis kyang grub pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis kyang grub pa yin no //
translated: This also is established.

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: tshad ma gnyis so //
analyzed: tshad ma gnyis so //
translated: The two valid cognitions.

original: gang las she na /
analyzed: gang las she na /
translated: From what?

original: gzhan sems nyid ni rtogs pa las //
analyzed: gzhan sems nyid ni rtogs pa las //
translated: From the realization of the mind of another.

original: yang na kyang gi sgra ni nges par gzung ba yin te /
analyzed: yang na kyang gi sgra ni nges par gzung ba yin te /
translated: Or else, the word ‚Äúalso‚Äù is for the purpose of emphasis.

original: @150a * // grub pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: @150a * // grub pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is established, just that.

original: tshu rol mthong ba can dag gi mngon sum gzhan dang 'brel pa can gyi blo shes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tshu rol mthong ba can dag gi mngon sum gzhan dang 'brel pa can gyi blo shes pa ma yin no //
translated: The direct perception of those who see only what is near is not the cognition of the mind of another.

original: de bas na rnam pa gzhan du rtogs pa yang rjes su dpag pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na rnam pa gzhan du rtogs pa yang rjes su dpag pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the understanding in another way is also inference.

original: sems rtogs pa zhes bya ba yang med pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: sems rtogs pa zhes bya ba yang med pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: And the so-called realization of the mind is not non-existent.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: smra stsogs la ni 'jug phyir dang // rgyu'i phyir /
analyzed: smra stsogs la ni 'jug phyir dang // rgyu'i phyir /
translated: Because of engagement in speech, etc., and because of the cause.

original: de yi ngo bo nges par 'grub //
analyzed: de yi ngo bo nges par 'grub //
translated: The nature of that is established.

original: sems kyi nges pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyi nges pa'o //
translated: The ascertainment of the mind.

original: gang gi phyir skyes bu 'di gsong bor smra ba la sogs pa'i smra ba la 'jug pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir skyes bu 'di gsong bor smra ba la sogs pa'i smra ba la 'jug pa de'i phyir /
translated: Because this person engages in speech such as ‚Äúspeak clearly,‚Äù therefore,

original: nges par gzhan sems dang ldan pa yin no zhes rtogs so //
analyzed: nges par gzhan sems dang ldan pa yin no zhes rtogs so //
translated: it is understood that he definitely has another mind.üîΩThe application is this: Whoever engages in the conventional expression of having a mind is one who definitely has a mind.üîΩFor example, it is like the one who is beautiful in this life engaging in the conventional expression of having a mind.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang la sems dang ldan pa tha snyad du 'jug par bya ba la 'jug par byed pa de ni sems dang ldan pa nges pa can yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang la sems dang ldan pa tha snyad du 'jug par bya ba la 'jug par byed pa de ni sems dang ldan pa nges pa can yin te /
translated: The pervasion is this: Whoever engages in the conventional expression of having a mind is one who definitely has a mind.üîΩFor example, it is like the one who is beautiful in this life engaging in the conventional expression of having a mind.

original: dper na tshu rol mdzes pa la de nyid bdag nyid sems dang ldan pa la /
analyzed: dper na tshu rol mdzes pa la de nyid bdag nyid sems dang ldan pa la /
translated: The pervasion is this: Whoever engages in the conventional expression of having a mind is one who definitely has a mind.

original: tha snyad 'jug par byed pa lta bu'o //üîΩji skad du bshad pa'i tshu rol mdzes pa'i bu srog dang bcas pa yang tha snyad la 'jug par byed do zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: tha snyad 'jug par byed pa lta bu'o // ji skad du bshad pa'i tshu rol mdzes pa'i bu srog dang bcas pa yang tha snyad la 'jug par byed do zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs so //
translated: The pervasion is this: Whoever engages in the conventional expression of having a mind is one who definitely has a mind.üîΩThe pervasion is this: Whoever engages in the conventional expression of having a mind is one who definitely has a mind.üîΩThe pervasion is this: Whoever engages in the conventional expression of having a mind is one who definitely has a mind.üîΩThe pervasion is this: Whoever engages in the conventional expression of having a mind is one who definitely has a mind.üîΩThe pervasion is this: Whoever engages in the conventional expression of having a mind is one who definitely has a mind.üîΩThe pervasion is this: Whoever engages in the conventional expression of having a mind is one who definitely has a mind.üîΩThe pervasion is this: Whoever engages in the conventional expression of having a mind is one who definitely has a mind.üîΩThe pervasion is this: Whoever engages in the conventional expression of having a mind is one who definitely has a mind.üîΩThe pervasion is this: Whoever engages in the conventional expression of having a mind is one who definitely has a mind.üîΩThe pervasion is this: Whoever engages in the conventional expression of having a mind is one who definitely has a mind.üîΩThe pervasion is this: Whoever engages in the conventional expression of having a mind is one who definitely has a mind.üîΩThe pervasion is this: Whoever engages in the conventional expression of having a mind is one who definitely has a mind.üîΩThe pervasion is this: Whoever engages in the conventional expression of having a mind is one who definitely has a mind.

original: de ni gzhan gyi sems rtogs par byed pa smra ba la sogs pa'i rtags so //üîΩgzhan yang shing sha pa dang du ba'i khyad par dang / chu brtan pa la sogs pa ste //
analyzed: de ni gzhan gyi sems rtogs par byed pa smra ba la sogs pa'i rtags so //üîΩgzhan yang shing sha pa dang du ba'i khyad par dang / chu brtan pa la sogs pa ste //
translated: The pervasion is this: Whoever engages in the conventional expression of having a mind is one who definitely has a mind.üîΩThe pervasion is this: Whoever engages in the conventional expression

original: shing dang me dang rten la sogs pa ni rtogs par byed pa nyid ni tshad ma nyid yin no //üîΩci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: shing dang me dang rten la sogs pa ni rtogs par byed pa nyid ni tshad ma nyid yin no // ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: The tree, the fire, the support, etc. are valid cognitions in so far as they are the cause of the cognition.üîΩWhy?

original: mi slu phyir /
analyzed: mi slu phyir /
translated: Because they are not deceptive.

original: bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du mi slu ba'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du mi slu ba'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are the cause of a cognition that is not deceptive in regard to the object as it is in itself.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: This is true, but

original: gal te la la dag tu ni //
analyzed: gal te la la dag tu ni //
translated: if, in certain cases,

original: 'khrul phyir yid brtan med yin zhes //
analyzed: 'khrul phyir yid brtan med yin zhes //
translated: the mind is not trusted because of error,

original: gal te yang shing sha pa dang du ba'i khyad par dang / chu brtan ba la sogs pa shing dang me dang rten la sogs pa la yang mi slu ba de ltar de'i mtshan nyid can gzhan la 'khrul pa mthong ba de ltar na /
analyzed: gal te yang shing sha pa dang du ba'i khyad par dang / chu brtan ba la sogs pa shing dang me dang rten la sogs pa la yang mi slu ba de ltar de'i mtshan nyid can gzhan la 'khrul pa mthong ba de ltar na /
translated: if the tree, the smoke, the particular, the water, the support, etc. are not deceptive in regard to the tree, the fire, the cause, the water, the support, etc. , but are deceptive in regard to other characteristics,

original: thams cad la yang yid brtan du med pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: thams cad la yang yid brtan du med pa yin zhe na /
translated: then, in all cases, the mind cannot be trusted.

original: rtags la 'khrul pa ni yod pa yin te /
analyzed: rtags la 'khrul pa ni yod pa yin te /
translated: Error is possible in regard to the reason.üîΩBut the reason is not deceptive in regard to what it is a reason for.

original: 'on kyang rtags log mthong phyir de de 'dra /üîΩkhyod la snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang rtags log mthong phyir de de 'dra /üîΩkhyod la snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It is only in regard to another thing that it is deceptive.

original: shing sha ba la sogs pa shing la sogs pa la mi slu ba'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de thams cad ni de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba dag gis 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shing sha ba la sogs pa shing la sogs pa la mi slu ba'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de thams cad ni de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba dag gis 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Whatever is the nature of nondeception in regard to the tree, etc., and the tree, etc., is related to them by identity and origination.

original: 'brel pa de yang rtags kyi mi slu ba'i mtshan nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'brel pa de yang rtags kyi mi slu ba'i mtshan nyid yin te /
translated: And that relation is the characteristic of nondeception in the evidence.

original: de gang la yod pa de ni slu bar byed pa @150b ma yin te /
analyzed: de gang la yod pa de ni slu bar byed pa @150b ma yin te /
translated: That which has that is not deceptive.

original: slu bar byed pa dag la ni de'i ngo bo yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: slu bar byed pa dag la ni de'i ngo bo yod pa ma yin no //
translated: For those that are deceptive do not have that nature.

original: rtags slu ba med pa can de 'dra ba de ni nye bar mtshon pa med pa'i phyir rtags nyid ma yin la /
analyzed: rtags slu ba med pa can de 'dra ba de ni nye bar mtshon pa med pa'i phyir rtags nyid ma yin la /
translated: That evidence which has nondeceptive evidence is not evidence, because it is not an indicator.

original: cung zad tsam chos mthun pa nyid las rtags nyid du zhen cing de la 'jug pa la slu ba mthong pa'i phyir khyed cag la rtags thams cad 'khrul pa yin no zhes de de 'dra bar snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: cung zad tsam chos mthun pa nyid las rtags nyid du zhen cing de la 'jug pa la slu ba mthong pa'i phyir khyed cag la rtags thams cad 'khrul pa yin no zhes de de 'dra bar snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But because of the mere similarity, there is the assumption of evidence and the engagement in it, and because of the perception of deception, for you, all evidence is mistaken.

original: de tsam gyis ni rtags yang dag pa nyid kyang 'khrul pa yin par mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de tsam gyis ni rtags yang dag pa nyid kyang 'khrul pa yin par mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: But by that alone, the correct evidence is not mistaken.

original: 'on kyang rtogs pa po rtags kyi rjes su 'brang mi nus pas skyon de byas pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang rtogs pa po rtags kyi rjes su 'brang mi nus pas skyon de byas pa yin no //
translated: But the one who understands is not able to follow the reason, so this fault is made.

original: de ltar na dngos po gang las du ba dang shing sha pa la sogs pa'i rtags las la lar me dang shing la sogs pa'i dngos po la ni'o //
analyzed: de ltar na dngos po gang las du ba dang shing sha pa la sogs pa'i rtags las la lar me dang shing la sogs pa'i dngos po la ni'o //
translated: Thus, from a thing, such as smoke and a shirisha tree, in some cases, a thing such as fire and a tree is understood.

original: 'ga'i tshe skyes bu 'di la rtogs pa 'grub /
analyzed: 'ga'i tshe skyes bu 'di la rtogs pa 'grub /
translated: At some time, the understanding is established in this person.

original: me la sogs pa de las du ba la sogs pa de ni nges pa skyes pa yin gyi /
analyzed: me la sogs pa de las du ba la sogs pa de ni nges pa skyes pa yin gyi /
translated: From that fire and so on, that smoke and so on is definitely produced,

original: 'dod rgyal du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dod rgyal du ni ma yin no //
translated: but not by chance.

original: de'i rang bzhin nyid du'ang 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin nyid du'ang 'gyur /
translated: And it would be its nature.

original: bsgrub par bya ba shing la sogs pa de'i shir sha pa la sogs pa rang bzhin nyid yin par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba shing la sogs pa de'i shir sha pa la sogs pa rang bzhin nyid yin par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: And that which is to be established, such as a tree, would be the nature of the shirisha tree and so on.

original: des ni 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi 'brel pa'i mtshan nyid bstan to //
analyzed: des ni 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi 'brel pa'i mtshan nyid bstan to //
translated: By that, the definition of the relation of the effect and nature reasons is taught.

original: 'brel pa ni de yod na yod cing /
analyzed: 'brel pa ni de yod na yod cing /
translated: The relation is that when it exists, it exists,

original: de med na med pa yin te /
analyzed: de med na med pa yin te /
translated: and when it does not exist, it does not exist.

original: du ba la sogs pa'i don gzhan dang de ni rang gi rgyu ste /
analyzed: du ba la sogs pa'i don gzhan dang de ni rang gi rgyu ste /
translated: Smoke and so on are other objects, and that is its cause.

original: me la sogs pa rang rgyu mchan med par don ni yod ma yin /
analyzed: me la sogs pa rang rgyu mchan med par don ni yod ma yin /
translated: Fire, etc., do not exist without their own causes.

original: du ba la sogs pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: du ba la sogs pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Smoke, etc., do not exist,

original: rgyu med pa can du thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu med pa can du thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it follows that they would be without a cause.

original: rang bzhin dag ste shing la sogs pa med par shing sha pa la sogs pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin dag ste shing la sogs pa med par shing sha pa la sogs pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The specific natures, such as the oak tree, etc., do not exist without the tree, etc.,

original: de med na de nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med na de nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because if they did not exist, they would not exist.

original: de gang las she na /
analyzed: de gang las she na /
translated: From what?

original: shing gi bdag nyid kyi khyad par nyid la shing sha pa la sogs par tha snyad btags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shing gi bdag nyid kyi khyad par nyid la shing sha pa la sogs par tha snyad btags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the convention ‚Äúoak tree,‚Äù etc., is designated in relation to the specific nature of the tree, etc.

original: rang bzhin yongs su spangs nas dngo bo gzhan du mi 'gyur ba de ltar na ma 'khrul ba yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin yongs su spangs nas dngo bo gzhan du mi 'gyur ba de ltar na ma 'khrul ba yin no //
translated: When it is not the case that the specific nature is abandoned and becomes another entity, it is like that, i.e., non-erroneous.

original: de dag ni 'bras bu dang rang bzhin nyid du gyur pa'i don dag go //
analyzed: de dag ni 'bras bu dang rang bzhin nyid du gyur pa'i don dag go //
translated: Those are the objects that are the effect and the specific nature.

original: mthong ba ni mi slu bar ro //
analyzed: mthong ba ni mi slu bar ro //
translated: Seeing is non-deceptive.

original: ngo bo gang yin pa ni de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid can dang / de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: ngo bo gang yin pa ni de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid can dang / de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid can no //
translated: The nature is characterized by arising from that and characterized by being of the nature of that.

original: de nyid gzhan gyi de lta bu'i rigs can gyi rtags dag gi yang mtshan nyid yin /
analyzed: de nyid gzhan gyi de lta bu'i rigs can gyi rtags dag gi yang mtshan nyid yin /
translated: That is also the definition of other such reasons.

original: gal te srid par 'gyur ba de'i tshe de mi slu ba'i rang bzhin can nyid yin te /üîΩde las mi slu bar de ltar @151a * //
analyzed: gal te srid par 'gyur ba de'i tshe de mi slu ba'i rang bzhin can nyid yin te / de las mi slu bar de ltar @151a * //
translated: If it were possible, then it would have the nature of non-deception.üîΩFrom that, it would not deceive.

original: na yid brtan du med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: na yid brtan du med pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, it would not be undependable.üîΩThat which does not have the definition of a reason is not a reason.

original: gang la rtags kyi mtshan nyid de yod pa ma yin pa de ni rtags 'gyur ba de ltar na de 'khrul ba las gnod pa cung zad kyang med de /
analyzed: gang la rtags kyi mtshan nyid de yod pa ma yin pa de ni rtags 'gyur ba de ltar na de 'khrul ba las gnod pa cung zad kyang med de /
translated: Thus, there is not the slightest harm from error.

original: rtags ma yin pa skyon can yin pas kyang rtags skyon can du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtags ma yin pa skyon can yin pas kyang rtags skyon can du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if a non-reason is faulty, a reason is not faulty.

original: mthong ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas mi dmigs pa 'khrul ba ma yin par bstan to //
analyzed: mthong ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas mi dmigs pa 'khrul ba ma yin par bstan to //
translated: He teaches that non-apprehension is not erroneous in ‚ÄúIf one sees . . . ‚Äù and so on.

original: rang bzhin snang ba yin na dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin snang ba yin na dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur ba yin no //
translated: If the nature appears, it becomes the characteristic of apprehension.

original: de ni rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa yin nas gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa yin nas gsungs pa yin no //
translated: That is stated from the perspective of the non-apprehension of the nature.

original: rang gi rgyu mtshan khyab par byed pa'am /
analyzed: rang gi rgyu mtshan khyab par byed pa'am /
translated: The reason is pervasion or cause.

original: rgyu snang ba yin no zhes bya ba de ni khyab par byed pa dang rgyu mi dmigs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu snang ba yin no zhes bya ba de ni khyab par byed pa dang rgyu mi dmigs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa'o //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThe cause is appearance‚Äù is made in terms of the non-apprehension of the pervader and cause.

original: rang bzhin rgyu mtshan snang ba ste //
analyzed: rang bzhin rgyu mtshan snang ba ste //
translated: The nature of the reason is appearance.

original: snang ba'i rang bzhin can de yod la /
analyzed: snang ba'i rang bzhin can de yod la /
translated: That which has the nature of appearance exists.

original: mthong ba yi ni rgyu gzhan dag / snang ba la sogs pa yod na'o //
analyzed: mthong ba yi ni rgyu gzhan dag / snang ba la sogs pa yod na'o //
translated: The cause of seeing exists when there is appearance, etc.

original: des ni ldog pa tsam rtags ma yin no //
analyzed: des ni ldog pa tsam rtags ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, mere reversal is not the reason.

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is it then?

original: gzhan dmigs pa yin no zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: gzhan dmigs pa yin no zhes ston par byed do //
translated: It is the apprehension of something else.

original: mi snang na yang /
analyzed: mi snang na yang /
translated: Even when there is no appearance,

original: mig dmigs na'ang ste //
analyzed: mig dmigs na'ang ste //
translated: if the eye is apprehended,

original: ji skad bshad pa'i rang bzhin mi dmigs pa la sogs pa yod pa yod na'ang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i rang bzhin mi dmigs pa la sogs pa yod pa yod na'ang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the existence of the non-apprehension of the nature as explained, etc. exists. This is the meaning of ‚Äúwhen there is‚Äù.

original: yod pa yang ji ltar yin te /
analyzed: yod pa yang ji ltar yin te /
translated: How can there be existence?

original: ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: It is non-existence.

original: gang gi zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi zhe na /
translated: Whose?

original: de ldan gyi ste /
analyzed: de ldan gyi ste /
translated: Of that possessor.

original: ngi skad du bshad pa'i mi dmigs pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: ngi skad du bshad pa'i mi dmigs pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: It has the non-apprehension as explained.

original: rang bzhin mi dmigs pa dang ldan pa dang / khyab par byed pa me dmigs pa dang ldan pa dang / rgyu mi dmigs pa dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin mi dmigs pa dang ldan pa dang / khyab par byed pa me dmigs pa dang ldan pa dang / rgyu mi dmigs pa dang ldan pa ste /
translated: The three kinds of non-apprehension are: non-apprehension of the nature, non-apprehension of the pervader, and non-apprehension of the cause.

original: bum pa bdag nyid la sogs pa dang / shing sha pa la sogs pa dang du ba la sogs pa ci rigs par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: bum pa bdag nyid la sogs pa dang / shing sha pa la sogs pa dang du ba la sogs pa ci rigs par byed pa yin no //
translated: They are applied respectively to the pot, the tree, and the smoke.

original: de de ltar na 'brel ba ni rtags kyi mtshan nyid yin la de yang gcig tu ma 'khrul pa can yin no //
analyzed: de de ltar na 'brel ba ni rtags kyi mtshan nyid yin la de yang gcig tu ma 'khrul pa can yin no //
translated: Thus, the definition of the logical mark is the relation, and that is not erroneous in any case.

original: de bas na rjes su dpag pa tshad mar mi 'dod pa gang yin pa des ji skad bshad pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'brel pa ni cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na rjes su dpag pa tshad mar mi 'dod pa gang yin pa des ji skad bshad pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'brel pa ni cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, those who do not accept inference as a means of valid knowledge must accept that the relation defined as above does not exist at all.

original: de len yang mi slu ba yang nges bar khas len pa can nyid yin te /
analyzed: de len yang mi slu ba yang nges bar khas len pa can nyid yin te /
translated: And they must accept that the relation is non-deceptive.

original: de 'dra ba la 'khrul ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de 'dra ba la 'khrul ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no error in such a relation.

original: khas mi len na yang gal te 'ga' zhig dang lhan cig bstan par nus pa de'i tshe yang rjes su dpag pa ma yin ma spangs pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: khas mi len na yang gal te 'ga' zhig dang lhan cig bstan par nus pa de'i tshe yang rjes su dpag pa ma yin ma spangs pa nyid yin no //
translated: If you do not accept this, then even if you are able to demonstrate that there is a relationship between the reason and the probandum, you have still not avoided the fault of having an unestablished reason.

original: 'dir gtan @151b tshigs 'ba' zhig gi 'brel pa ston cing bstan kyang zin to //
analyzed: 'dir gtan @151b tshigs 'ba' zhig gi 'brel pa ston cing bstan kyang zin to //
translated: Here, we have shown the relationship between the reason and the probandum, and we have also demonstrated it.

original: nges na rjes su dpag pa med pa'i skabs med do //
analyzed: nges na rjes su dpag pa med pa'i skabs med do //
translated: If you understand it, then there is no occasion for inference.

original: ci ste de ltar na yang rjes su dpag pa tshad ma nyid ma yin par 'dod pa de'i che spyi'i blo ni tshad min na'ang lkog tu gyur pa'i don gyi yul can rtags las skyes pa'i blo ni'o //
analyzed: ci ste de ltar na yang rjes su dpag pa tshad ma nyid ma yin par 'dod pa de'i che spyi'i blo ni tshad min na'ang lkog tu gyur pa'i don gyi yul can rtags las skyes pa'i blo ni'o //
translated: But if you still maintain that inference is not a valid form of cognition, then the cognition of a universal cannot be a valid form of cognition, because it is a cognition of a hidden object that arises from a reason.

original: de med thob 'gyur /
analyzed: de med thob 'gyur /
translated: You would have to accept that.

original: de'i blos rnam par gzhag par gyur pa yod pa can lkog tu gyur pa'i don de med pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i blos rnam par gzhag par gyur pa yod pa can lkog tu gyur pa'i don de med pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: You would have to accept that the cognition of a hidden object that is established by that cognition does not exist.

original: de ltar na gang gis mthong ba nyid 'ba' zhig tshad ma yin pa de'i de la mthong pa 'jug pa de nyid yod pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na gang gis mthong ba nyid 'ba' zhig tshad ma yin pa de'i de la mthong pa 'jug pa de nyid yod pa yin no //
translated: Thus, for one who maintains that only seeing is a valid form of cognition, that seeing is the only means of knowing that an object exists.

original: gang yang sa phyogs dang kun dga' rab la sogs pa sngar mthong ba de las mthong ba log pa de ltar na de yang de'i tshe med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang yang sa phyogs dang kun dga' rab la sogs pa sngar mthong ba de las mthong ba log pa de ltar na de yang de'i tshe med par 'gyur ro //
translated: And if the place, the grove, etc., which were seen before, are not seen now, then they would not exist at that time.

original: mthong bar 'gyur ba rtogs par bya ba gang yin pa de yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mthong bar 'gyur ba rtogs par bya ba gang yin pa de yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: And that which is to be understood as seen does not exist.

original: snang ba med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: snang ba med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no appearance.

original: de bas na mthong ba nyid 'jug pa dang ldog pa dngos po dag la 'jug par byed pa dang ldog par byed pa de ltar byed pa por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na mthong ba nyid 'jug pa dang ldog pa dngos po dag la 'jug par byed pa dang ldog par byed pa de ltar byed pa por 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, seeing itself is the agent of engagement and disengagement with regard to things.

original: des na lkog tu gyur pa'i don med pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: des na lkog tu gyur pa'i don med pa nyid yin no //
translated: Thus, the non-existence of the hidden object is just like that.

original: ci dang 'dra bar zhe na /
analyzed: ci dang 'dra bar zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: pha rol gyi dngos po bzhin ji ltar 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa mthong ba yod pa ma yin pa de ltar de yod pa nyid ma yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: pha rol gyi dngos po bzhin ji ltar 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa mthong ba yod pa ma yin pa de ltar de yod pa nyid ma yin par 'dod do //
translated: Just as the existence of the other world, etc., is not seen, so it is maintained that it does not exist.

original: de ltar 'dir yang khyod kyi 'dod pas lkog tu gyur pa'i don thams cad med par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar 'dir yang khyod kyi 'dod pas lkog tu gyur pa'i don thams cad med par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, in this case, too, all hidden objects would be non-existent, according to your assertion.

original: tshad ma nyid med par khyad par med pa'i phyir dang / mngon sum las gzhan pa'i tshad ma nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma nyid med par khyad par med pa'i phyir dang / mngon sum las gzhan pa'i tshad ma nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no difference between the valid cognition and the invalid cognition, and because there is no valid cognition other than perception.

original: yod pa yin na yang 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa yang med par nges pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yod pa yin na yang 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa yang med par nges pa ma yin te /
translated: Even if it does exist, it is not ascertained that the world beyond does not exist,

original: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no difference.

original: de ltar na ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar na ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: This is so, but

original: gal te dbang po rnams /
analyzed: gal te dbang po rnams /
translated: if the sense faculties

original: dus gzhan du ni rtogs 'gyur na /
analyzed: dus gzhan du ni rtogs 'gyur na /
translated: perceive at another time,

original: dbang po rnams kyi dmigs pa kho na yod do zhes ni mi smra'o //
analyzed: dbang po rnams kyi dmigs pa kho na yod do zhes ni mi smra'o //
translated: we do not say that the object of the sense faculties exists.

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: What do we say?

original: de dag gis mthong bar gyur pa dang mthong par 'gyur ba rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis /
analyzed: de dag gis mthong bar gyur pa dang mthong par 'gyur ba rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis /
translated: That which is perceived by them, or that which will be perceived by them in some way,

original: 'dzin par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de yin na /
analyzed: 'dzin par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de yin na /
translated: is apprehended.

original: de ltar de yod pa ma yin pa gang yin pa de nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ltar de yod pa ma yin pa gang yin pa de nyid yin no //
translated: That which does not exist in this way, that is what it is.

original: gal te de ltar yid pa de'i tshe mthong ba log pa na pha rol gyi dngos po la yang rnam grangs kyis mthong bar 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya ba gang las yin /
analyzed: gal te de ltar yid pa de'i tshe mthong ba log pa na pha rol gyi dngos po la yang rnam grangs kyis mthong bar 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya ba gang las yin /
translated: If that is so, then when the seeing is reversed, the object on the other side is not seen by implication either.

original: @152a * // rnam grangs kyis kyang dbang po rnams kyis 'di bzung ba ma yin no zhes bya 'di la nges pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: @152a * // rnam grangs kyis kyang dbang po rnams kyis 'di bzung ba ma yin no zhes bya 'di la nges pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no certainty that the object is not apprehended by the sense faculties by implication either.

original: gal te rnam grangs kyis kyang dbang po las 'das pa bzung ba ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rnam grangs kyis kyang dbang po las 'das pa bzung ba ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the object beyond the range of the sense faculties is not apprehended by implication either,

original: ma yin te gzung par bya ba la dbang po las 'das pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te gzung par bya ba la dbang po las 'das pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: that is not so, because there is no object beyond the range of the sense faculties to be apprehended.

original: rtogs pa po'i mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams dang / gnas skabs kyi khyad par la ltos na don la dbang po las 'das pa nyid du brjod do //
analyzed: rtogs pa po'i mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams dang / gnas skabs kyi khyad par la ltos na don la dbang po las 'das pa nyid du brjod do //
translated: The sense faculties of the eye, etc., of the cognizer are said to be beyond the range of the sense faculties in relation to the object in dependence on the specific state of the sense faculties.

original: de gzugs la sogs pa'i khyad par gzhan la yin no //
analyzed: de gzugs la sogs pa'i khyad par gzhan la yin no //
translated: It is in relation to other specific forms, etc.

original: de dad 'dra bar gnas skabs gzhan thob pa dag gis kyang mngon par 'dus byas pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dad 'dra bar gnas skabs gzhan thob pa dag gis kyang mngon par 'dus byas pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: even though they are in a different state, like faith.

original: 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa yang 'gyur ba de ltar na 'ga' zhig kyang dus gzhan du mi 'dzin pa'i nges pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa yang 'gyur ba de ltar na 'ga' zhig kyang dus gzhan du mi 'dzin pa'i nges pa med pa yin no //
translated: Thus, there is no certainty that something is not apprehended at another time.

original: de ltar na yang med pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na yang med pa yin no //
translated: Even so, it does not exist.

original: de ltar na yang de min te //
analyzed: de ltar na yang de min te //
translated: Even so, it is not so.

original: dbang po rnams kyis dus gzhan du rtogs pa ma yin pa gang yin pa de yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang po rnams kyis dus gzhan du rtogs pa ma yin pa gang yin pa de yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not reasonable to say that what is not apprehended by the sense faculties at another time does not exist.

original: ci'i ; phyir zhe na /üîΩdbang po yin ni nus stsogs la /
analyzed: ci'i ; phyir zhe na / dbang po yin ni nus stsogs la /
translated: Why is that?

original: dbang po'i blo ni med phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po'i blo ni med phyir ro //
translated: Because the cognition of the sense faculties does not exist in relation to potency, etc.üîΩThe cognition of the sense faculties does not exist in relation to potency, etc.

original: mig la sogs pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa skyed pa'i nus pa 'ga' zhig gi tshe yang dus gzhan du dbang pos rtogs par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa skyed pa'i nus pa 'ga' zhig gi tshe yang dus gzhan du dbang pos rtogs par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: At no time is that which is to be apprehended by the sense faculties not apprehended by the sense faculties, because there is no potency of the sense faculties, etc., to generate visual consciousness, etc.

original: stsogs pa smos pas ni zas la sogs pa ni bru ba bzlog pa la sogs pa'i nus pa bzung ngo //
analyzed: stsogs pa smos pas ni zas la sogs pa ni bru ba bzlog pa la sogs pa'i nus pa bzung ngo //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù in the root text indicates that the potential of the eye sense faculty and so on is to prevent the occurrence of hunger and so on.

original: de ltar na 'di med pa thob pa yin na nus pa yang yod pa de'i phyir dbang po rnams kyis dus gzhan du gzung ba ma yin pa gang yin pa de yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na 'di med pa thob pa yin na nus pa yang yod pa de'i phyir dbang po rnams kyis dus gzhan du gzung ba ma yin pa gang yin pa de yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, if the potential of the eye sense faculty and so on is something that exists, then it is illogical to say that the eye sense faculty and so on are not apprehended at other times because they do not exist.

original: ci ste yang dbang po'i nus pa la sogs pa de yang yod pa nyid ma yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: ci ste yang dbang po'i nus pa la sogs pa de yang yod pa nyid ma yin pa de ltar na /
translated: But if the potential of the eye sense faculty and so on does not exist,

original: de med pa rtogs pa nyid du 'dod pa de'i tshe med pa rtogs pa yin na ni /
analyzed: de med pa rtogs pa nyid du 'dod pa de'i tshe med pa rtogs pa yin na ni /
translated: then, in that case, you are forced to admit that the apprehension of the nonexistence of the eye sense faculty and so on is the apprehension of something that does not exist.

original: blo skye rgyu mtshan can med 'gyur //
analyzed: blo skye rgyu mtshan can med 'gyur //
translated: If that is so, then the arising of the cognition would be causeless.

original: mig la sogs pa'i blo'i skye ba ni rgyu'i tshogs pa la rag lus pa med par skye ba'i phyir glo bur ba yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i blo'i skye ba ni rgyu'i tshogs pa la rag lus pa med par skye ba'i phyir glo bur ba yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: The arising of the cognition of the eye sense faculty and so on would be causeless because it would arise without depending on the collection of causes.

original: de bas na blo ni gzhan la ltos pa med pa'i phyir rtag tu yod pa'am med pa nyid du 'gyur na de ltar ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na blo ni gzhan la ltos pa med pa'i phyir rtag tu yod pa'am med pa nyid du 'gyur na de ltar ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the mind does not depend on anything else, it would always exist or not exist. But that is not the case.

original: de bas na de las gzhan pa'i rgyu gzhan yod kyang 'bras bu rnam par shes pa mi skye bas mig la @152b sogs pa'i nus pa mthong ba yin no zhes rnam par gzhag pa la bsnyon par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na de las gzhan pa'i rgyu gzhan yod kyang 'bras bu rnam par shes pa mi skye bas mig la @152b sogs pa'i nus pa mthong ba yin no zhes rnam par gzhag pa la bsnyon par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, even though there is another cause other than that, since the effect, consciousness, does not arise, the potency of the eye, etc. is seen. Thus it is not possible to deny the presentation.

original: dbang po la sogs pa'i nus pa dbang po las 'das pa de nyid rang gi ngo bo'i sgo nas rtogs pa med pa'i phyir khyad par du rtogs pa ma yin gyi spyi'i sgo nas rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbang po la sogs pa'i nus pa dbang po las 'das pa de nyid rang gi ngo bo'i sgo nas rtogs pa med pa'i phyir khyad par du rtogs pa ma yin gyi spyi'i sgo nas rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since that potency of the eye, etc., which is beyond the senses, is not cognized by way of its own nature, it is not cognized as a particular, but it is cognized by way of a universal.

original: de'i tshe lkog tu gyur pa'i don de la spyi 'dzin min no //
analyzed: de'i tshe lkog tu gyur pa'i don de la spyi 'dzin min no //
translated: At that time, it does not apprehend a universal with regard to that hidden object.

original: rnam rtog med par zhes bu ba'i dbang po'i nus pa la sogs pa sgrub par byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa ni mngon sum gyi tshad mar 'gyur bar rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam rtog med par zhes bu ba'i dbang po'i nus pa la sogs pa sgrub par byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa ni mngon sum gyi tshad mar 'gyur bar rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: A conceptual cognition that establishes the capacity of the sense faculty and so on is not suitable to be a valid form of direct perception.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar rang gi mtshan nyid la mngon sum 'jug par 'gyur gyi lkog tu gyur ba la ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar rang gi mtshan nyid la mngon sum 'jug par 'gyur gyi lkog tu gyur ba la ma yin no //
translated: Because direct perception engages with intrinsic characteristics, not with hidden objects.

original: ji ltar zhe na /üîΩrnam par rtog pa med nyid kyis //
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na / rnam par rtog pa med nyid kyis //
translated: How is that?üîΩBecause it is nonconceptual.

original: rnam par rtog pa nyid ma yin pa'i rgyu nyid kyis te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa nyid ma yin pa'i rgyu nyid kyis te /
translated: Because it is not conceptual,

original: 'og nas skabs su bab ba ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'og nas skabs su bab ba ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: as will be shown in the appropriate context below.

original: spyi'i shes pa ni rnam par rtog pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: spyi'i shes pa ni rnam par rtog pa nyid yin no //
translated: A cognition of a universal is conceptual.

original: rnam par rtog pa nyid yin pa'i rgyu de'i phyir rjes dpag yin gyi /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa nyid yin pa'i rgyu de'i phyir rjes dpag yin gyi /
translated: Because it is conceptual, it is inference.

original: de mngon sum gyi tshad ma ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de mngon sum gyi tshad ma ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not a valid form of direct perception.

original: gzhal bya nges na kha dog gi //
analyzed: gzhal bya nges na kha dog gi //
translated: When the object of comprehension is ascertained,

original: mi rtag pa ni rtogs mi 'gyur //
analyzed: mi rtag pa ni rtogs mi 'gyur //
translated: impermanence is not realized.

original: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid dag las gzhal bya gzhan yod pa ma yin no zhes nges pa khas len na ni /
analyzed: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid dag las gzhal bya gzhan yod pa ma yin no zhes nges pa khas len na ni /
translated: If you accept that there is no object of comprehension other than the characteristics of the particular and the universal,

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i kha dog la sogs pa'i skad cig ma tha ma 'jig pa mthong ba dag gis kha dag mi rtag ces bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i kha dog la sogs pa'i skad cig ma tha ma 'jig pa mthong ba dag gis kha dag mi rtag ces bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then you would not understand such things as ‚Äúsound is impermanent‚Äù through seeing the destruction of the final moment of the color of blue, etc.

original: stsogs pa smos pas ni sgra la sogs pa bzung ngo //
analyzed: stsogs pa smos pas ni sgra la sogs pa bzung ngo //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes sound, etc.

original: de ltar na sgra la sogs pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid yin la /
analyzed: de ltar na sgra la sogs pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid yin la /
translated: Thus, sound, etc. are the particular,

original: mi rtag pa la sogs pa ni spyi yin te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa la sogs pa ni spyi yin te /
translated: and impermanence, etc. are the universal,

original: spyi dang khyad par 'di dag kyang 'dres par 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi dang khyad par 'di dag kyang 'dres par 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because these universals and particulars are apprehended as mixed.

original: spyi de nyid dam rang gi mtshan nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: spyi de nyid dam rang gi mtshan nyid ma yin no //
translated: That universal is not the particular.

original: de bas na spyi dang khyad par gyi gzhal bya gzhal byar yang mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: de bas na spyi dang khyad par gyi gzhal bya gzhal byar yang mi 'gyur na /
translated: Therefore, the object of comprehension that is a universal or a particular would not be an object of comprehension.

original: gzhal bya yin pa de bas na //
analyzed: gzhal bya yin pa de bas na //
translated: Because of that,

original: de blo sgra 'di mi rtog go //
analyzed: de blo sgra 'di mi rtog go //
translated: the mind and the word do not conceive it.

original: zhes bya ba'i spyi dang khyad par gyi ngo bo 'dzin pa'i blo mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag las chad ma gzhan yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i spyi dang khyad par gyi ngo bo 'dzin pa'i blo mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag las chad ma gzhan yin no //
translated: The cognition that apprehends the nature of a universal and a particular is a valid cognition that is different from direct perception and inference.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: re zhig de mngon sum gyi tshad ma nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig de mngon sum gyi tshad ma nyid ma yin te /
translated: First, it is not a valid cognition of direct perception,

original: spyi yang 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi yang 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it apprehends a universal.

original: rjes su dpag pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not inference,

original: rtags med par yang de ltar rtogs pa yod phyir @153a * //
analyzed: rtags med par yang de ltar rtogs pa yod phyir @153a * //
translated: because it exists even when there is no reason,

original: te khyad par 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: te khyad par 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it apprehends a particular.

original: shes pa khyad par dag ni mthong ba gang de yang tshad ma gzhan yin no //
analyzed: shes pa khyad par dag ni mthong ba gang de yang tshad ma gzhan yin no //
translated: The cognition that sees a particular is a different valid cognition.

original: 'di ltar ma mngon sum gyi dus gcig gi tshe me la sogs pa bcad pa nyid kyang gang gi tshe dus gzhan du du ba la sogs pa de nyid kyis me de nyid 'di yin no zhes yongs su gcod par byed pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: 'di ltar ma mngon sum gyi dus gcig gi tshe me la sogs pa bcad pa nyid kyang gang gi tshe dus gzhan du du ba la sogs pa de nyid kyis me de nyid 'di yin no zhes yongs su gcod par byed pa de'i tshe /
translated: Thus, at the time of direct perception, when fire and so on are ascertained, when at another time smoke and so on ascertain that very fire,

original: khyad par mthong ba'i rjes su dpag pa de la mer 'dzin pa gang yin pa de ni spyi nyid mthong ba'i rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma las gzhan yin no //
analyzed: khyad par mthong ba'i rjes su dpag pa de la mer 'dzin pa gang yin pa de ni spyi nyid mthong ba'i rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma las gzhan yin no //
translated: In particular, the apprehension of fire in the case of inference from an effect is different from the valid knowledge that is the inference of the universal itself.

original: 'dir rjes su dpag par 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid de nyid khyad par mthong ba de la med pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir rjes su dpag par 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid de nyid khyad par mthong ba de la med pa yin no //
translated: Here, the characteristic of the object to be inferred does not exist in the case of the perception of the particular.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rtags kyi 'brel pa ma grub phyir /
analyzed: rtags kyi 'brel pa ma grub phyir /
translated: Because the relation of the reason is not established.

original: khyad par rtags kyi 'brel pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par rtags kyi 'brel pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the relation of the reason with the particular is not possible.

original: rnam pa de dag gis tshad ma mang po nyid dang de srid pa nyid du 'gyur te /üîΩgzhal bya mang ba nyid kyi phyir ram /
analyzed: rnam pa de dag gis tshad ma mang po nyid dang de srid pa nyid du 'gyur te / gzhal bya mang ba nyid kyi phyir ram /
translated: By those aspects, there would be many valid cognitions and they would be possible,üîΩbecause there are many objects of comprehension,

original: yul gcig nyid la shes pa du ma 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul gcig nyid la shes pa du ma 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: or because many consciousnesses engage a single object.

original: de da ltar na gnyi ga yang ston par byed de /
analyzed: de da ltar na gnyi ga yang ston par byed de /
translated: In that case, both are taught.

original: kha dog gi mi rtag pa rtogs pa'i phyir dang khyad par gyi don gyi yul yod pas gzhal bya mang phyir te /
analyzed: kha dog gi mi rtag pa rtogs pa'i phyir dang khyad par gyi don gyi yul yod pas gzhal bya mang phyir te /
translated: Because of comprehending the impermanence of color and because of the existence of the object of a particular meaning, there are many objects of comprehension.

original: rgyu'i phyir mang po nyid yin no //
analyzed: rgyu'i phyir mang po nyid yin no //
translated: Because of the cause, there are many.

original: gang dag ce na /
analyzed: gang dag ce na /
translated: What are they?

original: tshad ma yang ngo //
analyzed: tshad ma yang ngo //
translated: They are valid cognitions.

original: yul gcig la yang tshad ma du ma nyid ni 'jug phyir tshad ma mang po nyid yin no //
analyzed: yul gcig la yang tshad ma du ma nyid ni 'jug phyir tshad ma mang po nyid yin no //
translated: There are many valid cognitions because many valid cognitions engage a single object.

original: ji ltar zhe na dper na khyad par mthong pa'i tshad mas khyad par 'dzin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na dper na khyad par mthong pa'i tshad mas khyad par 'dzin pa lta bu'o //
translated: How is this? For example, a valid cognition that perceives a particular perceives a particular.

original: de ni 'o na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gzhung 'dis /
analyzed: de ni 'o na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gzhung 'dis /
translated: The text beginning with ‚ÄúIf that is so‚Äù indicates

original: gcig gsum grangs sel kyang mi 'gyur //
analyzed: gcig gsum grangs sel kyang mi 'gyur //
translated: that the number one and three are eliminated.

original: kyang gi sgra ni rim pa gzhan du sbyar ba yin te /
analyzed: kyang gi sgra ni rim pa gzhan du sbyar ba yin te /
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù is connected to another line.

original: gsum dang gcig gi grangs ni sel ba'am /
analyzed: gsum dang gcig gi grangs ni sel ba'am /
translated: The number three and the number one are eliminated.üîΩThe two objects of comprehension are seen.

original: gzhal bya gnyis ni mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: gzhal bya gnyis ni mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: The text indicates that this explanation does not exist.

original: re zhig gcig gi grangs bsal ba ma yin no //
analyzed: re zhig gcig gi grangs bsal ba ma yin no //
translated: First, the number one is not eliminated.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩyul la nges pa med phyir /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / yul la nges pa med phyir /
translated: Why?üîΩBecause there is no certainty about the object.

original: gang gi tshe spyi'i yul can rjes su dpag pa kho na ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi tshe spyi'i yul can rjes su dpag pa kho na ma yin gyi /
translated: When the object is not only a generality,

original: 'on kyang yul gcig la yang tshad ma gzhan 'jug par byed pa de'i tshe mngon sum gyi 'jug pa yang spyi dang rjes su 'brel pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on kyang yul gcig la yang tshad ma gzhan 'jug par byed pa de'i tshe mngon sum gyi 'jug pa yang spyi dang rjes su 'brel pa'i phyir /
translated: However, when another valid cognition is engaged with respect to a single object, then the engagement of direct perception is also related to a universal.

original: mngon sum ma yin pa'i yul rtogs pa'i don du rjes su dpag pa rtogs pa ma yin pa de ltar na tshad ma gcig nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mngon sum ma yin pa'i yul rtogs pa'i don du rjes su dpag pa rtogs pa ma yin pa de ltar na tshad ma gcig nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, in order to understand an object that is not directly perceived, inference is not understood, and in that case there would be only one valid cognition.

original: gsum la sogs pa'i grangs bsal ba yang @153b ma yin no //
analyzed: gsum la sogs pa'i grangs bsal ba yang @153b ma yin no //
translated: And the elimination of the number three and so on would also be impossible.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: gzhal bya gzhan ni yod phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhal bya gzhan ni yod phyir ro //
translated: Because there are other objects of comprehension.

original: gzhal bya gnyis nyid kyis tshad ma gnyis 'dod na /
analyzed: gzhal bya gnyis nyid kyis tshad ma gnyis 'dod na /
translated: If two valid cognitions are asserted due to the mere existence of two objects of comprehension,

original: gang gi tshe spyi dang khyad par gyi mtshan nyid can gyi gzhal bya gzhan yod pa de'i tshe tshad ma gzhan yod par 'gyur ba de ltar na tshad ma gnyis kho na ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe spyi dang khyad par gyi mtshan nyid can gyi gzhal bya gzhan yod pa de'i tshe tshad ma gzhan yod par 'gyur ba de ltar na tshad ma gnyis kho na ma yin no //
translated: then when there is another object of comprehension that has the character of a universal and a particular, at that time there would be another valid cognition. Thus there would not be only two valid cognitions.

original: kha dog gi mi rtag pa nyid rtogs pa'i spyi dang khyad par gyi mtshan nyid can gyi yul gzhal bya gzhan 'god pa'i skabs nyid yod pa ma yin te /üîΩdon byed nus dang mi nus phyir //
analyzed: kha dog gi mi rtag pa nyid rtogs pa'i spyi dang khyad par gyi mtshan nyid can gyi yul gzhal bya gzhan 'god pa'i skabs nyid yod pa ma yin te / don byed nus dang mi nus phyir //
translated: There is no occasion for positing another object of comprehension, which is characterized by a universal and a particular, in order to understand the impermanence of color.üîΩBecause it is taught that there is no other object of comprehension by such passages as,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhal bya gzhan med par bstan zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhal bya gzhan med par bstan zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of the ability or inability to perform a function.‚Äù

original: de'i sgo nas gang gis na tshad ma mang po nyid kyi skabs yod pa yin /
analyzed: de'i sgo nas gang gis na tshad ma mang po nyid kyi skabs yod pa yin /
translated: By means of that, how could there be an occasion for many valid cognitions?

original: de ltar na yang brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar na yang brjod par bya ste /
translated: Even so, this should be stated:

original: skyon 'dir thal bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: skyon 'dir thal bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: This fault does not arise,

original: dper na sgra mi rtag ces bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa spyi dang khyad par rtogs par byed pa'i tshad ma gzhan du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: dper na sgra mi rtag ces bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa spyi dang khyad par rtogs par byed pa'i tshad ma gzhan du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: because, for example, in the case of the statement ‚ÄúSound is impermanent,‚Äù there is another valid cognition that understands the universal and the particular.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: kha dog spyi la sbyor phyir ro //
analyzed: kha dog spyi la sbyor phyir ro //
translated: Because it is applied to the universal of color.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa de kha dog gi spyi mi rtag pa nyid dang sbyor ba yin gyi /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa de kha dog gi spyi mi rtag pa nyid dang sbyor ba yin gyi /
translated: That conceptual consciousness applies the universal of impermanence to the universal of color,

original: khyad par ni ma yin te /
analyzed: khyad par ni ma yin te /
translated: but not to the particular.

original: des de mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des de mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not apprehend that.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: This is so, but

original: gal te spyi mi rtag pa nyid dang sbyor ba de'i tshe spyi dngos po med pa'i de'i tshe mi rtag pa la sogs pa de dag gis 'thob par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gal te spyi mi rtag pa nyid dang sbyor ba de'i tshe spyi dngos po med pa'i de'i tshe mi rtag pa la sogs pa de dag gis 'thob par 'gyur gyi /
translated: if one were to apply the generality impermanence, then at that time, since the generality is a non-entity, those impermanences, etc. would be obtained,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi ni ma yin te /
translated: but not the particular inherent characteristic,

original: de la mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not engage with that.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang la mi 'jug pa de ni dngos po de'i chos su 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang la mi 'jug pa de ni dngos po de'i chos su 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: If one does not engage with something, then that is not the quality of that thing,

original: dper na skye ba med pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na skye ba med pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: like non-arising, etc.

original: mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa dngos med ngo bo min /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa dngos med ngo bo min /
translated: Impermanence, etc. are not the nature of non-entities,

original: 'on kyang dngos po nyid kyi rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang dngos po nyid kyi rang bzhin yin no //
translated: but rather the nature of entities.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de nyid kyi ste dngos po'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi ste dngos po'o //
translated: Because of that, that is, because of the entity.

original: de ltar mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par grub pa dag gis bsgrubs phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par grub pa dag gis bsgrubs phyir ro //
translated: In that case, impermanence, etc. are established by the established forms of impermanence, etc.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: This is so, but

original: gal te gzhan la gzhan grub min //
analyzed: gal te gzhan la gzhan grub min //
translated: if one thing is not established by another,

original: spyi la mi rtag pa la sogs pa sgrub pa yin gyi rang gi mtshan nyid la ma yin na /
analyzed: spyi la mi rtag pa la sogs pa sgrub pa yin gyi rang gi mtshan nyid la ma yin na /
translated: If the universal is established as impermanent, etc. in general, but not as having its own characteristic,

original: de ji ltar na mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang / 'brel pa can gyi spyi sgrub pa yin na dngos po rnam par rtog pa'i yul las 'das pa la mi rtag pa'i rnam par rtog par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar na mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang / 'brel pa can gyi spyi sgrub pa yin na dngos po rnam par rtog pa'i yul las 'das pa la mi rtag pa'i rnam par rtog par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: how can the universal, which is related to the aspects of impermanence, etc., be established as a thing that is beyond the object of conceptualization and is impermanent?

original: skyon de min te de nyid grub phyir ro //üîΩgal te yang rnam par rtog pa la @154a * //üîΩsnang ba'i spyi de nyid de lta bu'i /
analyzed: skyon de min te de nyid grub phyir ro // gal te yang rnam par rtog pa la @154a * // snang ba'i spyi de nyid de lta bu'i /
translated: That fault does not exist because it is established as just that.

original: dngos por zhen pa'i sgo nas 'dzin pa de ltar na yang /
analyzed: dngos por zhen pa'i sgo nas 'dzin pa de ltar na yang /
translated: Even though the universal that appears to conceptual consciousness is apprehended by way of adhering to it as such an entity,

original: dngos po rang gi mtshan nyid de skad cig ma la sogs pa'i rnam par yod pa nyid du 'jog pa de la snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po rang gi mtshan nyid de skad cig ma la sogs pa'i rnam par yod pa nyid du 'jog pa de la snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: it appears to the establishment of that thing as having its own characteristic, which exists as momentary, etc.

original: rnam par rtog pa de dag la yang 'jug pa na yang rnam par rtog pa mi slu ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa de dag la yang 'jug pa na yang rnam par rtog pa mi slu ba nyid yin no //
translated: And when one engages those conceptual consciousnesses, conceptual consciousness is nondeceptive.

original: de bas na rang nyid bslad pa yin na yang dngos po rnam pa de lta bu dang 'brel pa skye ba can nyid yin pas na dngos po de lta bu'i rnam pa sgrub par byed pa la de tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: de bas na rang nyid bslad pa yin na yang dngos po rnam pa de lta bu dang 'brel pa skye ba can nyid yin pas na dngos po de lta bu'i rnam pa sgrub par byed pa la de tshad ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, even though it is itself erroneous, since it is the cause of the production of a thing that has such a form, it is a valid cognition in regard to the establishment of a thing that has such a form.

original: tshad ma ni de tsam gyi dgos pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir de ltar 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: tshad ma ni de tsam gyi dgos pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir de ltar 'gal ba med do //
translated: Because the purpose of a valid cognition is just that, there is no contradiction.üîΩAll conceptual thoughts that come about indirectly through the object are mistaken, like seeing, in that they do not appear to have their own characteristics.

original: brgyud pas don gyi sgo nas 'ongs pa'i rnam par rtog pa thams cad ni mthong pa dang 'dra bar rang gi mtshan nyid snang ba med pa can gyi 'khrul ba dag de'i rnam par zhen pa yin na yang /
analyzed: brgyud pas don gyi sgo nas 'ongs pa'i rnam par rtog pa thams cad ni mthong pa dang 'dra bar rang gi mtshan nyid snang ba med pa can gyi 'khrul ba dag de'i rnam par zhen pa yin na yang /
translated: Even though they are fixated on the form of that,

original: rnam par rtog pa gang la rgyu brgyud pa gzhan nye ba yod pa de ni ji ltar zhen pa'i rnam pa dang ldan pa'i dngos po la der zhen pa'i sgo nas 'jug par byed pa de ltar na /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gang la rgyu brgyud pa gzhan nye ba yod pa de ni ji ltar zhen pa'i rnam pa dang ldan pa'i dngos po la der zhen pa'i sgo nas 'jug par byed pa de ltar na /
translated: if a conceptual thought has another cause that is proximate, it engages its object through the apprehension of the object as it is conceived.

original: mi slu ba yin gyi /
analyzed: mi slu ba yin gyi /
translated: In that case, it is nondeceptive.üîΩIt is not otherwise.

original: gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is what is taught.

original: dngos dang yang dag ji bzhin pa //
analyzed: dngos dang yang dag ji bzhin pa //
translated: ‚ÄúReal‚Äù and ‚Äújust as it is‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩdper na mi ni du ba la sogs pa /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / dper na mi ni du ba la sogs pa /
translated: and so on.

original: skyed pa'i nus pa dang ldan pa lta bu'am /
analyzed: skyed pa'i nus pa dang ldan pa lta bu'am /
translated: For example, a person is endowed with the capacity to produce smoke and so on,

original: dper na sgra mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang ldan pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na sgra mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang ldan pa lta bu'o //
translated: or for example, a sound is endowed with the aspect of impermanence and so on.

original: de ni rgyu dang rnam par nges pa'i rang bzhin me la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ni rgyu dang rnam par nges pa'i rang bzhin me la sogs pa'o //
translated: That is the cause and the nature that is ascertained, such as fire and so on.

original: de 'dra ba yi rtags sems kyi //
analyzed: de 'dra ba yi rtags sems kyi //
translated: That kind of sign is the cause of the mind.

original: rgyu yin rnam pa dang ldan pa gang yin pa de rgyu dang rang bzhin gyi rnam pa de nyid la de'i 'bras bur gyur ba du ba la sogs pa'i dngos po'am de'i rang bzhin du gyur ba mtshon par byed pa ni de de 'dra ba'i rtags yin no
analyzed: rgyu yin rnam pa dang ldan pa gang yin pa de rgyu dang rang bzhin gyi rnam pa de nyid la de'i 'bras bur gyur ba du ba la sogs pa'i dngos po'am de'i rang bzhin du gyur ba mtshon par byed pa ni de de 'dra ba'i rtags yin no
translated: Whatever is endowed with an aspect is the cause and nature of that very aspect. Its effect is the thing such as smoke and so on, or its nature is the indicator. That is the sign that is like that.

original: // de'i yul can gyi sems gang yin pa de ni shes pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: // de'i yul can gyi sems gang yin pa de ni shes pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The mind that has that as its object is the cognition that is like that.

original: du ba la sogs pa de'i 'bras bu'am de'i rang bzhin spyi la sogs pa tsam du yod pa nyid la sogs pa dang / khyad par gzhan du sgro btags pa ste /
analyzed: du ba la sogs pa de'i 'bras bu'am de'i rang bzhin spyi la sogs pa tsam du yod pa nyid la sogs pa dang / khyad par gzhan du sgro btags pa ste /
translated: The cognition of the mere existence of smoke, etc., as the effect or nature of that, as well as the superimposition of other attributes,

original: skye ba dang ldan pa nyid dang byas pa nyid la sogs pa rtogs par byed pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: skye ba dang ldan pa nyid dang byas pa nyid la sogs pa rtogs par byed pa nyid yin no //
translated: such as being produced and being a product, is the sign of the mind that is similar to that.

original: de'i dngos po med par mi 'byung ba de'i 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gyi rnam pa'i yul can yang de 'dra ba'i sems kyi rtags yin te /
analyzed: de'i dngos po med par mi 'byung ba de'i 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gyi rnam pa'i yul can yang de 'dra ba'i sems kyi rtags yin te /
translated: The cognition that has as its object the form of the effect or nature of that which does not occur without that is also the sign of the mind that is similar to that,

original: de'i rgyu don dam @154b par dngos po de yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rgyu don dam @154b par dngos po de yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the ultimate object, the cause of that, is that.

original: de las byung ba ni rtags shes pa de las skyes pa gang yin pa de ni de las byung pa'o //
analyzed: de las byung ba ni rtags shes pa de las skyes pa gang yin pa de ni de las byung pa'o //
translated: That which arises from that is the cognition of the sign that is produced from that.

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: rtags can blo'o //
analyzed: rtags can blo'o //
translated: The cognition that has the sign.

original: gang la zhe na /
analyzed: gang la zhe na /
translated: Where?

original: de lta la'o //
analyzed: de lta la'o //
translated: In that way.

original: 'bras bu'i rtags skyes pa me la sogs pa la'am /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i rtags skyes pa me la sogs pa la'am /
translated: The sign of the effect is produced in relation to fire, etc.,

original: byas pa nyid la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa mi rtag pa la sogs pa la 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: byas pa nyid la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa mi rtag pa la sogs pa la 'gyur gyi /
translated: and the sign of nature is produced in relation to impermanence, etc., which are the nature of being produced, etc.

original: rnam pa gzhan du gyur pa la ni ma yin no /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du gyur pa la ni ma yin no /
translated: It is not the case that the aspect is transformed.

original: // / tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel pa /
analyzed: // / tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel pa /
translated: Commentary on Valid Knowledge

original: bam po nyi shu lnga pa /
analyzed: bam po nyi shu lnga pa /
translated: Book Twenty-Five

original: de ltar na gang gi phyir rgyu brgyud pa 'dis bskyed pa gang yin pa des rnam pa ji lta bur gyur pa'i don de la rnam pa de lta bur zhen pa /üîΩde phyir dngos /
analyzed: de ltar na gang gi phyir rgyu brgyud pa 'dis bskyed pa gang yin pa des rnam pa ji lta bur gyur pa'i don de la rnam pa de lta bur zhen pa / de phyir dngos /
translated: Thus, because it is produced by this causal continuum, it is the conception of the object in just such a way that it appears.

original: gzhal byar 'dod pa don gyi bya ba nyid yod na /
analyzed: gzhal byar 'dod pa don gyi bya ba nyid yod na /
translated: Therefore, if the object of engagement exists,

original: rtags can blo de ltar 'gyur ba'i phyir mi slu ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: rtags can blo de ltar 'gyur ba'i phyir mi slu ba nyid yin no //
translated: then the cognition bearing that sign would be nondeceptive.

original: de bas na gal te yang rnam par rtog pa thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid las brgyud pas skye pa 'dra ba yin pa de ltar na yang thams cad kyi dngos po'i rnam pa ji lta ba bzhin du zhe na pa ni 'dra ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de bas na gal te yang rnam par rtog pa thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid las brgyud pas skye pa 'dra ba yin pa de ltar na yang thams cad kyi dngos po'i rnam pa ji lta ba bzhin du zhe na pa ni 'dra ba ma yin te /
translated: Thus, even though all conceptual cognitions are similar in being produced by a continuum from their own characteristics, the conception of all things is not similar to the way they exist,

original: 'on kyang 'ga' zhig kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'ga' zhig kho na yin no //
translated: but rather it is only some.

original: de'i phyir ji skad du bshad pa'i rgyu'i brgyud pas skye ba'i dus na yod pa ma yin pa 'khrul ba'i rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du dngos po la med pa'i rnam pa sgro 'dogs pa yin pa de ltar na de nyid log pa'i shes pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir ji skad du bshad pa'i rgyu'i brgyud pas skye ba'i dus na yod pa ma yin pa 'khrul ba'i rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du dngos po la med pa'i rnam pa sgro 'dogs pa yin pa de ltar na de nyid log pa'i shes pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, because of the causal process as it has been explained, at the time of arising, the aspect that does not exist in the way it appears in the thing is a superimposition of a false condition.

original: gal te yang ji skad du bshad pa'i rgyu'i brgyud pa'i khyad par las skye ba de ni dngos po ji lta ba bzhin du gnas pa'i go bar byed pa'i rtags shes pa la brten nas dngos po la yod pa'i rnam pa nyid du nges par byed pa yin
