analyzed: gal te yang ji skad du bshad pa'i rgyu'i brgyud pa'i khyad par las skye ba de ni dngos po ji lta ba bzhin du gnas pa'i go bar byed pa'i rtags shes pa la brten nas dngos po la yod pa'i rnam pa nyid du nges par byed pa yin
translated: And if the arising from a specific causal process as it has been explained is the cause of the ascertainment that the aspect that exists in the thing is the way it appears, then it is a valid cognition that ascertains the aspect that exists in the thing as the way it appears.

original: te / dngos po phyin ci ma log pa'i rnam pa ston par byed do //
analyzed: te / dngos po phyin ci ma log pa'i rnam pa ston par byed do //
translated: It is because it reveals the aspect of the thing without error.üîΩAnd because its aspect is established, the aspect of the thing is established.

original: de'i rnam pa grub pas dngos po'i rnam pa grub pa yin no zhes rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i rnam pa grub pas dngos po'i rnam pa grub pa yin no zhes rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: This is how it is understood.

original: tshogs pa'i khyad par las skye ba can bzhin gyi gzugs brnyan gyi shes pa'i yul la /
analyzed: tshogs pa'i khyad par las skye ba can bzhin gyi gzugs brnyan gyi shes pa'i yul la /
translated: For example, in the case of a cognition of a reflection, which arises from a specific collection of causes,

original: mtshan ma la sogs pa grub pas bzhin gyi mtshan ma la sogs pa grub pa yin no //
analyzed: mtshan ma la sogs pa grub pas bzhin gyi mtshan ma la sogs pa grub pa yin no //
translated: The establishment of the sign, etc., is the establishment of the sign of the face, etc.

original: de ni don la yod pa'i rnam par zhen pa'i shes pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni don la yod pa'i rnam par zhen pa'i shes pa yin te /
translated: This is the cognition that is attached to the form of an object that exists.

original: de la 'jug pa ni de lta bur gyur pa'i don dang phrad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la 'jug pa ni de lta bur gyur pa'i don dang phrad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The engagement of that is the contact with an object that is of that form.

original: gang gi tshe skyes bu mi 'jug pa na yang 'ga' zhig las phrad pa med pa de'i tshe yang ji lta bur 'gyur ba'i rgyu'i tshogs pa dang 'brel pa'i rnam par rtog pa de la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe skyes bu mi 'jug pa na yang 'ga' zhig las phrad pa med pa de'i tshe yang ji lta bur 'gyur ba'i rgyu'i tshogs pa dang 'brel pa'i rnam par rtog pa de la /
translated: When a person does not engage, even then, there is no contact with anything. At that time, how could there be a conceptual cognition that is related to a collection of causes?

original: @155a * // rnam pa gzhan du zhen pa med pa'i phyir de ni tshad ma nyid yin no //üîΩde ltar na yang gal te yang ji ltar rnam pa srid pa bzhin du dpag par bya ba'i don nges par byed pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i rjes su dpag pa yin pa de ltar na yang des rgyu rnam pa gnyis kyis rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rang
analyzed: @155a * // rnam pa gzhan du zhen pa med pa'i phyir de ni tshad ma nyid yin no // de ltar na yang gal te yang ji ltar rnam pa srid pa bzhin du dpag par bya ba'i don nges par byed pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i rjes su dpag pa yin pa de ltar na yang des rgyu rnam pa gnyis kyis rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rang
translated: Because there is no attachment to another form, that is valid knowledge.

original: gi ngo bo 'dzin pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: gi ngo bo 'dzin pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: Even so, if one determines the object to be inferred in accordance with the possible form, then the inference of conceptual cognition is like that. Even so, it does not apprehend its own nature by means of the two causes, its own characteristic and the power of the object.

original: mthong ba bzhin du mi snang ba'i phyir dang / dngos sum skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba bzhin du mi snang ba'i phyir dang / dngos sum skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not appear as it is seen, and because it is not actually produced.

original: de ltar ma yin na mthong ba bzhin du dngos po'i ngo bo gsal bar snang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar ma yin na mthong ba bzhin du dngos po'i ngo bo gsal bar snang bar 'gyur te /
translated: If it were not so, then the entity‚Äôs own nature would appear clearly as it is seen.

original: dngos po la phan tshun mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba'i rnam pa yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: dngos po la phan tshun mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba'i rnam pa yod pa ma yin na /
translated: Since the entity does not have a form with different characteristics,

original: gang gis mi gsal par 'dzin gyi cig shos kyi ma yin gtan tshigs kyis brgyud pa 'di tsam la ltos nas skyes pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gis mi gsal par 'dzin gyi cig shos kyi ma yin gtan tshigs kyis brgyud pa 'di tsam la ltos nas skyes pa yang ma yin te /
translated: why would one apprehend it unclearly and the other clearly? It is not produced in dependence on just this much of a causal process,

original: mthong pa bzhin du de'i rang gi ngo bo 'dzin pa nyid kyis de las skye ba'i chos can ni brgyud pa las sdod pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong pa bzhin du de'i rang gi ngo bo 'dzin pa nyid kyis de las skye ba'i chos can ni brgyud pa las sdod pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because, like what is seen, it is apprehended as its own nature, and it is not tenable that what is produced from that is dependent on a causal process.

original: dngos po brgyud par sdod pa dang ldan pa yin na dngos pos 'jig pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po brgyud par sdod pa dang ldan pa yin na dngos pos 'jig pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it were to exist as an entity that endures in a causal process, then it would be possible for the entity to be destroyed.

original: 'das pa de la yang don dam par de'i ngo bor gzung du med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'das pa de la yang don dam par de'i ngo bor gzung du med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And that past entity cannot be apprehended as having that nature in the ultimate sense.

original: de'i 'khrul pa yang nyams su myong pa'i bag chags sad pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i 'khrul pa yang nyams su myong pa'i bag chags sad pa yin gyi /
translated: And the error in that is the awakening of the latent impressions of experience.

original: rtags kyis byas pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rtags kyis byas pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not produced by the sign.üîΩTherefore,

original: de'i phyir / de ltar rtags dang rtags can blo //üîΩbstan ma thag rgyu de ltar na rtags dang rtags can gyi blo gang yin pa de dag ni rtags dang rtags can gyi blo dag go //
analyzed: de'i phyir / de ltar rtags dang rtags can blo // bstan ma thag rgyu de ltar na rtags dang rtags can gyi blo gang yin pa de dag ni rtags dang rtags can gyi blo dag go //
translated: Thus, the cognition of the sign and the possessor of the sign

original: dngos po la ste gzhal bya la'o //
analyzed: dngos po la ste gzhal bya la'o //
translated: are in regard to the thing, the object of cognition.

original: 'brel phyir te /
analyzed: 'brel phyir te /
translated: Because of the connection.

original: rgyu'i phyir der snang ba yis ni stong pa'ang /
analyzed: rgyu'i phyir der snang ba yis ni stong pa'ang /
translated: Because of the cause, even though empty,

original: rtags dang rtags can de dag tu rang gi mtshan nyid snang ba ni de snad ba ste /
analyzed: rtags dang rtags can de dag tu rang gi mtshan nyid snang ba ni de snad ba ste /
translated: the appearance of the sign and the possessor of the sign in that way is their appearance.

original: des stong pa yin yang ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des stong pa yin yang ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Even though empty of that, it is so, is the meaning.

original: de 'dra ba yin na yang rtags can gyi mi rtag pa nyid nges pa'i phyir slu byed ma yin no //
analyzed: de 'dra ba yin na yang rtags can gyi mi rtag pa nyid nges pa'i phyir slu byed ma yin no //
translated: Even though it is like that, it is not deceptive because the impermanence of the possessor of the sign is ascertained by that.

original: ji ltar 'dod pa'i don la slu ba nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod pa'i don la slu ba nyid ma yin no //
translated: It is not deceptive in regard to the desired object.

original: gal te rtags las skyes pa'i blo tshad ma yin pa de bas na de ni mngon sum dang 'dra bar 'khrul bar gzhag pa mi rung ngo zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rtags las skyes pa'i blo tshad ma yin pa de bas na de ni mngon sum dang 'dra bar 'khrul bar gzhag pa mi rung ngo zhe na /
translated: But if the cognition that arises from a logical reason is a valid cognition, then it is not correct to posit it as mistaken, just like perception.

original: de dngos slu byed nyid min yang //
analyzed: de dngos slu byed nyid min yang //
translated: Even though it is not a deceptive entity,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: etc.

original: ji ltar rjes su dpag pa'i don dang phrad pa nyid yin na yang /
analyzed: ji ltar rjes su dpag pa'i don dang phrad pa nyid yin na yang /
translated: Even though it is the very thing that is encountered by inference,

original: 'khrul pa rnam gzhag byas pa yin //
analyzed: 'khrul pa rnam gzhag byas pa yin //
translated: it is posited as mistaken.

original: rtags dang rtags can gyi blo de dag go //
analyzed: rtags dang rtags can gyi blo de dag go //
translated: These are the cognitions of the logical reason and the property-possessor.

original: ci'i @155b phyir zhe na /üîΩde yi ngo bos stong ba yang //
analyzed: ci'i @155b phyir zhe na / de yi ngo bos stong ba yang //
translated: Why is that?üîΩBecause of the adherence to its entity,

original: de yi ngo bor zhen phyir ro //
analyzed: de yi ngo bor zhen phyir ro //
translated: even though it is empty of that entity.

original: rtags dang rtags can gyi rang gi ngo bo gzung ba med na yang rtags dang rtags can gyi don du zhen pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rtags dang rtags can gyi rang gi ngo bo gzung ba med na yang rtags dang rtags can gyi don du zhen pa'i phyir /
translated: Even though the entity of the logical reason and the property-possessor are not apprehended, because of the adherence to the logical reason and the property-possessor as objects,

original: de'i dngos po ma yin pa de la de ltar zhen pa ni 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan du rnam par gzhag pa yin no zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ma yin pa de la de ltar zhen pa ni 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan du rnam par gzhag pa yin no zhes ston par byed do //
translated: it is taught that the non-entity of that is posited as the reason for mistake, because of the adherence to it in that way.

original: de de ltar na 'khrul ba yin yang don la mi slu ba'i phyir tshad ma yin na yang log par zhen pa'i phyir 'khrul ba yin no //
analyzed: de de ltar na 'khrul ba yin yang don la mi slu ba'i phyir tshad ma yin na yang log par zhen pa'i phyir 'khrul ba yin no //
translated: Although it is mistaken in that way, it is a valid cognition because it is non-deceptive with regard to the object. But it is mistaken because it is an adherence to the opposite.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar dngos po dang de 'brel ba'i phyir rtags go bar byed pa yin pa de'i phyir dngos po rtogs bya yin te go bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar dngos po dang de 'brel ba'i phyir rtags go bar byed pa yin pa de'i phyir dngos po rtogs bya yin te go bar bya ba yin no //
translated: Because in that way the reason is understood through the connection with the thing, therefore the thing is the object to be understood, that is, the object to be known.

original: khyab byed ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: khyab byed ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The pervaded is the meaning of the probandum.

original: rgyu mtshan ni rgyu nyid do //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan ni rgyu nyid do //
translated: The reason is the cause.

original: gang gi zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi zhe na /
translated: Whose?

original: khyab bya sems kyi ste /
analyzed: khyab bya sems kyi ste /
translated: Of the pervaded, the mind.

original: rtags shes pa'o //üîΩgang rtags kyi rgyu mtshan ni rgyu nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: rtags shes pa'o // gang rtags kyi rgyu mtshan ni rgyu nyid yin gyi /
translated: The reason is the cognition.

original: khyab par byed pa'i rang bzhin ni ma yin te /
analyzed: khyab par byed pa'i rang bzhin ni ma yin te /
translated: The reason is the cause, but not the nature of the pervader.

original: de la rtags dang rtags can ni bdag nyid gcig pa nyid kyis rgyu dang 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la rtags dang rtags can ni bdag nyid gcig pa nyid kyis rgyu dang 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the reason and the property-possessor are not cause and effect due to being the same entity.

original: rtags shes pa'i rgyu nyid kyang gnyis la yang yod pa yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: rtags shes pa'i rgyu nyid kyang gnyis la yang yod pa yin pa de ltar na /
translated: The reason is the cause of the cognition, and it exists in both.

original: rgyu dang khyab par byed pa dag 'dren mar rgyu mtshan gyi ngo bor brten par bzhed pas rtags 'bras bu nyid du ma gsungs kyi 'on kyang de shes pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: rgyu dang khyab par byed pa dag 'dren mar rgyu mtshan gyi ngo bor brten par bzhed pas rtags 'bras bu nyid du ma gsungs kyi 'on kyang de shes pa nyid yin no //
translated: But it is known.

original: khyab par bya ba'i sems kyi rgyu mtshan de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: khyab par bya ba'i sems kyi rgyu mtshan de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is the reason of the pervader's mind?

original: rang bzhin nam rgyu nyid kyi zhes bya ba smos pa la /
analyzed: rang bzhin nam rgyu nyid kyi zhes bya ba smos pa la /
translated: It is said the nature or cause itself.

original: nam gyi sgra ni rim pa bzhin du sbyar pa yin te /
analyzed: nam gyi sgra ni rim pa bzhin du sbyar pa yin te /
translated: The word na is connected in order.

original: rang bzhin nam rgyu nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang bzhin nam rgyu nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is the nature or cause itself.

original: khyab par byed pa'i chos ni dper na mi rtag pa la sogs pa lta bu'am /
analyzed: khyab par byed pa'i chos ni dper na mi rtag pa la sogs pa lta bu'am /
translated: The pervading phenomenon is, for example, impermanence, etc.

original: rgyu ni me la sogs ba lta bu'o //üîΩde yang ni khyab bar byed pa'i sems so //
analyzed: rgyu ni me la sogs ba lta bu'o // de yang ni khyab bar byed pa'i sems so //
translated: The cause is, for example, fire, etc.üîΩThat is the pervading mind.

original: de'i blo yin /
analyzed: de'i blo yin /
translated: That is the cognition.

original: khyab par byed pa'i gtan tshigs yin pa de ltar na dngos po sgrub par byed pa'i go bar byed pa ni /
analyzed: khyab par byed pa'i gtan tshigs yin pa de ltar na dngos po sgrub par byed pa'i go bar byed pa ni /
translated: The pervading reason is like that. Thus, the means of understanding that establishes a thing

original: 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs gnyis kho na yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs gnyis kho na yin te /
translated: are only the two reasons of effect and nature.

original: de las byung ba dang / de'i bdag nyid kyis 'brel pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de las byung ba dang / de'i bdag nyid kyis 'brel pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because of the relation of origination and identity.

original: mi dmigs pas med pa dang med pa'i tha snyad kyi dgag pa dag ni sgrub par byed /
analyzed: mi dmigs pas med pa dang med pa'i tha snyad kyi dgag pa dag ni sgrub par byed /
translated: Non-apprehension and negation of the convention of non-existence are established by the absence of perception.

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: thams cad du gang la yang dngos su mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes thos pa ma yin te /üîΩdper na 'di na grang ba'i reg pa med de me yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya @156a * //
analyzed: thams cad du gang la yang dngos su mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes thos pa ma yin te / dper na 'di na grang ba'i reg pa med de me yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya @156a * //
translated: It is not that in all cases there is no perception of anything.

original: ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like saying, ‚ÄúHere there is no cold touch because there is fire.‚Äù

original: 'dir yang thams cad du zhes bya ba smos pas mi dmigs pa nyid kyi dgag pa grub pa yin no zhes shes par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir yang thams cad du zhes bya ba smos pas mi dmigs pa nyid kyi dgag pa grub pa yin no zhes shes par byed pa yin no //
translated: Here also, by the statement ‚Äúin all cases,‚Äù it is understood that the negation of non-apprehension is established.

original: ci'i phyir yang mi dmigs pa las kyang dgag pa 'grub pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir yang mi dmigs pa las kyang dgag pa 'grub pa yin zhe na /
translated: Why is negation also established from non-apprehension?üîΩThus,

original: 'di ltar / tshad mas grub par smra rnams kyi//
analyzed: 'di ltar / tshad mas grub par smra rnams kyi//
translated: for those who speak of establishment by valid cognition,

original: don ni bzlog pa nyid las yin //
analyzed: don ni bzlog pa nyid las yin //
translated: the object is just the opposite.

original: dngos po gang las grub pa yin //
analyzed: dngos po gang las grub pa yin //
translated: From what thing is it established?

original: zhes 'dri ba la /
analyzed: zhes 'dri ba la /
translated: Thus, it is asked.

original: 'di skad du bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa nyid du nye bar 'jog par byed pa'i tshad ma las don yod pa nyid du grub pa yin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di skad du bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa nyid du nye bar 'jog par byed pa'i tshad ma las don yod pa nyid du grub pa yin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: In that case, one should say that the object is established as existent by the valid cognition that posits it as existing just as it is.

original: de ltar na tshad ma yod pa nyid kyis don yod pa nyid du grub pa yin no zhes smra ba rnams kyi don gyis tshad ma ldog pa las don med pa nyid grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na tshad ma yod pa nyid kyis don yod pa nyid du grub pa yin no zhes smra ba rnams kyi don gyis tshad ma ldog pa las don med pa nyid grub pa yin no //
translated: Thus, those who say that the object is established as existent by the existence of valid cognition, in fact, establish the nonexistence of the object from the cessation of valid cognition.

original: de lta ma yin na don yod pa nyid nye bar 'jog par byed pa'i tshad mar nye bas don 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na don yod pa nyid nye bar 'jog par byed pa'i tshad mar nye bas don 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, since the object is established by the valid cognition that posits its existence, the object would not be established.

original: des na tshad ma ldog pa khas len pa med na mi 'byung ba ni med pa nyid khas len pa yin pas tshad ma ldog pa nyid mi dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: des na tshad ma ldog pa khas len pa med na mi 'byung ba ni med pa nyid khas len pa yin pas tshad ma ldog pa nyid mi dmigs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, if one does not accept the cessation of valid cognition, one would not accept the nonexistence of the object. Therefore, the cessation of valid cognition is non-apprehension.

original: de bas na mi dmigs pa las dgag pa grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na mi dmigs pa las dgag pa grub pa yin no //
translated: Thus, negation is established from non-apprehension.

original: gdon mi za bar mi dmigs pa nyid las dgag pa grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gdon mi za bar mi dmigs pa nyid las dgag pa grub pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not that negation is necessarily established from non-apprehension alone.

original: dper na 'di na grang ba'i reg pa med de me yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'am /
analyzed: dper na 'di na grang ba'i reg pa med de me yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'am /
translated: For example, ‚ÄúHere there is no cold touch because fire exists.‚Äù

original: dper na 'di la spu long zhes byed pa la sogs pa'i bye brag dag med de /
analyzed: dper na 'di la spu long zhes byed pa la sogs pa'i bye brag dag med de /
translated: Or, for example, ‚ÄúHere there is no particular thing called ‚Äògoose bumps‚ÄôüîΩbecause the particular thing that causes shivering is present.‚Äù

original: gdung bar byed pa'i bye brag nye ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i sbyor ba dag mthong ba'i phyir dmigs pa las kyang ma yin nam /
analyzed: gdung bar byed pa'i bye brag nye ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i sbyor ba dag mthong ba'i phyir dmigs pa las kyang ma yin nam /
translated: Since such syllogisms are seen, is it not the case that nonobservation is a means of inference?

original: de ji ltar na yang thams cad du mi dmigs pas dgag pa dag ni sgrub par byed ces brjod /
analyzed: de ji ltar na yang thams cad du mi dmigs pas dgag pa dag ni sgrub par byed ces brjod /
translated: How can you say that all nonobservations are proofs?

original: ji ltar na dmigs pa 'di kho na mi dmigs par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na dmigs pa 'di kho na mi dmigs par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How could this very nonobservation be nonobservation?

original: bshad pa / gang yang sbyor ba byed pa na de dang 'gal ba'i chos bstan pa 'di mthong ste /
analyzed: bshad pa / gang yang sbyor ba byed pa na de dang 'gal ba'i chos bstan pa 'di mthong ste /
translated: In response to this, it is said: When one formulates a syllogism, one sees that this teaches a phenomenon that is contradictory with that.

original: rang bzhin 'gal ba dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang bzhin 'gal ba dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúobservation of a contradictory object‚Äù is that.

original: de'i rgyur ni spu long zhes pa'i rang bzhin de'i rgyu grang ba'i reg pa gang yin pa de'i yang gang 'gal ba dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: de'i rgyur ni spu long zhes pa'i rang bzhin de'i rgyu grang ba'i reg pa gang yin pa de'i yang gang 'gal ba dmigs pa ste /
translated: The cause of that is the contact with cold, which is the cause of the nature called ‚Äúgoose bumps.‚Äù The cause of that is the observation of the opposite of that,

original: dper na gdung bar byed pa'i bye brag nye ba nyid la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na gdung bar byed pa'i bye brag nye ba nyid la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: for example, the proximity of a particular fire.

original: gang la zhe na /
analyzed: gang la zhe na /
translated: With regard to what?

original: de bkag pa la /
analyzed: de bkag pa la /
translated: With regard to the negation of that.

original: rang bzhin dgag par bya ba la'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin dgag par bya ba la'o //
translated: With regard to the negation of the object of negation.

original: de nyid la ste /üîΩdgag par bya ba'i don @156b la rnam pa 'dis //üîΩde ni tshad min nyid du bstan //
analyzed: de nyid la ste / dgag par bya ba'i don @156b la rnam pa 'dis // de ni tshad min nyid du bstan //
translated: In that very way,üîΩthe non-observation of the object of negation is taught to be a non-valid cognition.üîΩThe non-observation of the object of negation is taught to be a non-valid cognition.üîΩThe non-observation of the object of negation is taught to be a non-valid cognition.

original: de'i yul can tshad ma ldog pa bstan pas don gyis mi dmigs pa nyid rab tu sbyar ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i yul can tshad ma ldog pa bstan pas don gyis mi dmigs pa nyid rab tu sbyar ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The non-observation of the object of negation is taught to be a non-valid cognition.üîΩThe non-observation of the object of negation is taught to be a non-valid cognition.

original: de gang las she na gzhan dun don des mi dmigs pa ma bkag pa can gzhan med nyid de thabs gang gis rtogs par 'gyur te /üîΩrnam pa 'ga' zhig gis kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: de gang las she na gzhan dun don des mi dmigs pa ma bkag pa can gzhan med nyid de thabs gang gis rtogs par 'gyur te / rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis kyang ma yin no //
translated: The non-observation of the object of negation is taught to be a non-valid cognition.üîΩThe non-observation of the object of negation is taught to be a non-valid cognition.üîΩThe non-observation of the object of negation is taught to be a non-valid cognition.üîΩThe non-observation of the object of negation is taught to be a non-valid cognition.üîΩThe non-observation of the object of negation is taught to be a non-valid cognition.üîΩThe non-observation of the object of negation is taught to be a non-valid cognition.üîΩThe non-observation of the object of negation is taught to be a non-valid cognition.üîΩThe non-observation of the object of negation is taught to be a non-valid cognition.üîΩThe non-observation of the object of negation is taught to be a non-valid cognition.üîΩThe non-observation of the object of negation is taught to be a non-valid cognition.üîΩThe non-observation of the object of negation is taught to be a non-valid cognition.üîΩThe non-observation of the object of negation is taught to be a non-valid cognition.üîΩThe non-observation of the object of negation is taught to be a non-valid cognition.üîΩThe non-observation of the object of negation is taught to be a non-valid cognition.üîΩThe non-observation of the object of negation is taught to be a non-valid cognition.

original: chos gcig yod pa brjod pas cig shos med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos gcig yod pa brjod pas cig shos med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The non-observation of the object of negation is taught to be a non-valid cognition.üîΩThe non-observation of the object of negation is taught

original: gzhan yod na gzhan med par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yod na gzhan med par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If the other exists, the other does not become nonexistent.

original: shin tu thal ches pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu thal ches pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that is too much of an absurdity.

original: sbyor ba ni gang la chos gcig yod par brjod pa de ni gzhan pa de med par rtogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang la chos gcig yod par brjod pa de ni gzhan pa de med par rtogs pa ma yin te /
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever is said to have one property is not understood to be without the other,

original: dper na gzugs dang gong bu yod par brjod pa ni /
analyzed: dper na gzugs dang gong bu yod par brjod pa ni /
translated: for example, whatever is said to have form and a body

original: grang ba'i reg pa de nyid med par rtogs pa ma yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: grang ba'i reg pa de nyid med par rtogs pa ma yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: is not understood to be without that very cold sensation.

original: 'dir yang grang ba'i reg pa med de me yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di la chos gcig yod par brjod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang grang ba'i reg pa med de me yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di la chos gcig yod par brjod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: Here, it is said that one property exists, namely, that cold sensation does not exist because fire exists. This is the observation of the contradiction with the pervasion.

original: 'dir yang khyab pas ma nges pa nyid du dogs par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir yang khyab pas ma nges pa nyid du dogs par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Here, it is not reasonable to suspect that the pervasion is not ascertained,

original: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no distinction.

original: gtan tshigs la khyad par yod na 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs la khyad par yod na 'gyur ro //
translated: If there were a distinction in the reason, it would be.

original: gang yang dgag pa'i phyir me la sogs pa 'grub par 'gyur ba de dang lhan cig gong bu la sogs pa bsgrub par 'gyur ba khyad par med pa nyid yin pa de ltar na ma grub pa yin par yang bsam par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gang yang dgag pa'i phyir me la sogs pa 'grub par 'gyur ba de dang lhan cig gong bu la sogs pa bsgrub par 'gyur ba khyad par med pa nyid yin pa de ltar na ma grub pa yin par yang bsam par mi bya'o //
translated: and the establishment of fire, etc. is for the purpose of refuting something else, then the establishment of the whole, etc. is the same as that, and so it should not be thought that it is not established.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: This is so, but

original: gal te 'ga' las yin /
analyzed: gal te 'ga' las yin /
translated: if it is from something else,

original: me dang grang ba'i reg pa 'gal ba des na de bsgrubs pa las de med par rtogs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: me dang grang ba'i reg pa 'gal ba des na de bsgrubs pa las de med par rtogs pa yin gyi /
translated: then the establishment of that is the understanding of its nonexistence, because the contact of cold and fire are contradictory.

original: 'gal ba med pa gzhan las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gal ba med pa gzhan las ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not from something else that is not contradictory.

original: de bas na gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid la sogs pa'i skyon yod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de bas na gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid la sogs pa'i skyon yod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, there is the fault that the reason is not established, etc.

original: ma grub pa la sogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ma grub pa la sogs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that it is not established, etc.

original: 'di ltar grang ba'i reg pa dang me 'gal ba de yang tshad ma cis grub /
analyzed: 'di ltar grang ba'i reg pa dang me 'gal ba de yang tshad ma cis grub /
translated: In this way, by what valid cognition is the contradiction between the contact of cold and fire established?

original: ma grub pa nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir de'i gnas skabs can gyi skyon nyid yin no //
analyzed: ma grub pa nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir de'i gnas skabs can gyi skyon nyid yin no //
translated: Since there is no difference in nonestablishment, it is just a fault of its state.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: This is so, but

original: gal te lhan cig mi gnas phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te lhan cig mi gnas phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that they are contradictory because they do not coexist,

original: gang na me yod pa de na grang ba'i reg pa yod pa ma yin te /üîΩde dang lhan cig mi gnas pa'i phyir 'gal ba nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gang na me yod pa de na grang ba'i reg pa yod pa ma yin te / de dang lhan cig mi gnas pa'i phyir 'gal ba nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: then in any place where fire exists, cold touch does not exist,üîΩbecause they do not coexist.

original: @157a * // de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: @157a * // de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: If you say that they are contradictory because they do not coexist,

original: lhan cig mi gnas pa'i 'gal ba sgrub par byed pa de nyid tshad ma gang las 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: lhan cig mi gnas pa'i 'gal ba sgrub par byed pa de nyid tshad ma gang las 'dod pa ste /
translated: then from what valid cognition do you assert that they do not coexist?

original: shes pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shes pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the term is consciousness.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: If you say that they are contradictory because they do not coexist,

original: 'di la dri bar bya ba ci zhig yod /
analyzed: 'di la dri bar bya ba ci zhig yod /
translated: then what is there to discuss?

original: gal te snang ba mthong ba med phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gal te snang ba mthong ba med phyir zhe na /
translated: If you say that they are contradictory because light is not seen in the dark,

original: gang la dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa rgyu ma gtugs pa can gyi grang ba'i reg pa yod pa na /
analyzed: gang la dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa rgyu ma gtugs pa can gyi grang ba'i reg pa yod pa na /
translated: then when cold touch exists, which is characterized by the object of observation,

original: mig dmigs na de las de nye ba nyid rgyu mtshan du byas nas de mthong ba'i phyir med pa grub pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: mig dmigs na de las de nye ba nyid rgyu mtshan du byas nas de mthong ba'i phyir med pa grub pa yin no zhe na /
translated: then if the eye observes it, because it is close to that, it is established that it is not seen.

original: mtshan nyid min mi dmigs pa yin no zhes bya ba la don gyi khyad par med do //
analyzed: mtshan nyid min mi dmigs pa yin no zhes bya ba la don gyi khyad par med do //
translated: There is no difference in meaning between ‚Äúnon-observation of what is suitable to be observed‚Äù and ‚Äúnon-observation of a non-observation.‚Äù

original: de nyid ni kho bo cag gis kyang drang po'i rim par brjod pa yin na de ci'i phyir khyed cag la tshig rtsub por snang ba 'dir sgra la sdang ba 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: de nyid ni kho bo cag gis kyang drang po'i rim par brjod pa yin na de ci'i phyir khyed cag la tshig rtsub por snang ba 'dir sgra la sdang ba 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: We also have stated this in a straightforward manner, so why does it appear to you to be harsh? It is just that you are hostile to the term ‚Äúnon-observation.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir mi dmigs pa ma gtogs par dgag pa'i rgyu gzhan yod pa ma yin pa de phyir rang sgras kyang brjod pa dper na mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mi dmigs pa ma gtogs par dgag pa'i rgyu gzhan yod pa ma yin pa de phyir rang sgras kyang brjod pa dper na mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: Because there is no cause of negation other than non-observation, therefore, even the term ‚Äúitself‚Äù is stated by way of example, as in ‚Äúnon-observation.‚Äù

original: kyang gi sgra rim pa bzhin du sbyar ba las ji ltar rang gi sgras kyang brjod cing sgrub pa'i sgo nas kyang mi dmigs pa brjod pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: kyang gi sgra rim pa bzhin du sbyar ba las ji ltar rang gi sgras kyang brjod cing sgrub pa'i sgo nas kyang mi dmigs pa brjod pa nyid yin no //
translated: The term ‚Äúalso‚Äù is to be applied in order, so it is stated by way of its own term and also by way of proof, as in ‚Äúnon-observation.‚Äù

original: de ni med pa dang de'i tha snyad kyis ci rigs par sgrub byed yin no //
analyzed: de ni med pa dang de'i tha snyad kyis ci rigs par sgrub byed yin no //
translated: It is the proof of nonexistence and the convention of nonexistence, respectively.

original: rgol ba gang gi yang dgag pa la mi dmigs pa de tshad min /
analyzed: rgol ba gang gi yang dgag pa la mi dmigs pa de tshad min /
translated: For any opponent, the negation is not established by non-observation.

original: de yis / rnam kun dgag pa brjod bya min //
analyzed: de yis / rnam kun dgag pa brjod bya min //
translated: The negation is not to be expressed in any way.

original: 'ga' zhig gi tshe'ang des dgag pa brjod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gi tshe'ang des dgag pa brjod par mi bya ste /
translated: Sometimes, even that negation is not to be expressed.

original: de las gzhan pa'i gtan tshigs de 'ga' zhig kyang med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i gtan tshigs de 'ga' zhig kyang med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because there is no other reason than that.

original: rang bzhin 'gal ba la sogs pa'i sbyor ba'i sgo nas don gyis mi dmigs pa nyid rab tu sbyar ba yin no zhes bstan pa des na de dang 'gal mod kyi /
analyzed: rang bzhin 'gal ba la sogs pa'i sbyor ba'i sgo nas don gyis mi dmigs pa nyid rab tu sbyar ba yin no zhes bstan pa des na de dang 'gal mod kyi /
translated: The meaning is that non-apprehension is applied by the method of a syllogism with a contradictory reason, etc.

original: 'bras bu brjod pa rang bzhin 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu brjod pa rang bzhin 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dmigs pa ste /
translated: The result is stated: the apprehension of a result that is contradictory by nature.

original: dper na 'di ni grang ba'i reg pa med de du ba yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: dper na 'di ni grang ba'i reg pa med de du ba yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa yin te /
translated: For example, ‚ÄúHere there is no cold touch because smoke exists.‚Äù

original: ji ltar 'dis kyang dgag pa la dngos su rang nyid dmigs pa ldog pa'i rtags su brjod kyi /
analyzed: ji ltar 'dis kyang dgag pa la dngos su rang nyid dmigs pa ldog pa'i rtags su brjod kyi /
translated: Just as this directly expresses the negation itself, the reason of the reversal of apprehension,

original: gzhan cung zad kyang ma yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan cung zad kyang ma yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: it is said that there is nothing else at all.

original: mi dmigs pa /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa /
translated: Non-apprehension

original: kun la sbyor ba 'ba' zhig dag //
analyzed: kun la sbyor ba 'ba' zhig dag //
translated: is only to be applied in all cases.

original: tha dad don la tha dad med //
analyzed: tha dad don la tha dad med //
translated: The difference in the object is not a difference.

original: 'bras bu mi dmigs pa la sogs pa mi dmigs pa'i @157b sbyor ba rnams la'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu mi dmigs pa la sogs pa mi dmigs pa'i @157b sbyor ba rnams la'o //
translated: The non-apprehension of effect, etc. is the non-apprehension of the application.

original: ji ltar rang bzhin mi dmigs pa la dngos su mi dmigs pa ston pa de ltar med do zhes nye bar bkod pa'i rnam pa tsam tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar rang bzhin mi dmigs pa la dngos su mi dmigs pa ston pa de ltar med do zhes nye bar bkod pa'i rnam pa tsam tha dad pa yin no //
translated: Just as the non-apprehension of intrinsic nature is shown directly in the non-apprehension, so too is the mere arrangement of the form ‚Äúit does not exist.‚Äù

original: mi dmigs pa 'phen par byed pa'i don sgrub pa'i sgo nas kyang brgyud pas mi dmigs pa don dam par 'chad pa yin pa de ltar don la tha dad pa med do //üîΩde ltar na dngos su dgag pa la dmigs pa sbyor bar byed pa'am /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa 'phen par byed pa'i don sgrub pa'i sgo nas kyang brgyud pas mi dmigs pa don dam par 'chad pa yin pa de ltar don la tha dad pa med do // de ltar na dngos su dgag pa la dmigs pa sbyor bar byed pa'am /
translated: The non-apprehension of the object that impels the non-apprehension is also explained as the ultimate non-apprehension through the door of establishing the object. In that way, there is no difference in the object.

original: de 'phen par byed pa'i don zhes bya ba dgag pa la khyad par cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de 'phen par byed pa'i don zhes bya ba dgag pa la khyad par cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the application that directly observes the negation or the object that impels it, called the negation, have not the slightest difference.

original: de de ltar na ji ltar rang bzhin 'gal ba'i chos brjod pas 'gal ba'i don sgrub pa'i sgo nas rang bzhin dgag pa la go bar byed pa yin pa de ltar na de dang 'gal ba'i don gyi 'bras bu brjod pa na yang 'gal ba'i don nye ba'i
analyzed: de de ltar na ji ltar rang bzhin 'gal ba'i chos brjod pas 'gal ba'i don sgrub pa'i sgo nas rang bzhin dgag pa la go bar byed pa yin pa de ltar na de dang 'gal ba'i don gyi 'bras bu brjod pa na yang 'gal ba'i don nye ba'i
translated: In that case, just as the statement of a property that is contradictory by nature serves to make one understand the negation of intrinsic nature by way of establishing a contradictory object, in the same way, when the effect of a contradictory object is stated, the contradictory object is implied.

original: phyir ro // 'dir 'gal ba'i don gyi 'bras bu brjod pa smos pa ni nye bar mtshon pa yin te /
analyzed: phyir ro // 'dir 'gal ba'i don gyi 'bras bu brjod pa smos pa ni nye bar mtshon pa yin te /
translated: Here, the statement of the effect of a contradictory object is an illustration.

original: rgyu dang khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa brjod pa yang go bar byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa brjod pa yang go bar byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the statement of the observation of a contradictory cause or pervader also serves to make one understand.

original: bsgrub par bya ba dgag la tshad ma smra ba gang yin //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba dgag la tshad ma smra ba gang yin //
translated: What is the proof of the negation of the probandum?

original: yang ji skad du bstan pa'i 'gal ba gnyis kyis kyang don 'gal ba brjod pa med pa byas pa'i don to /
analyzed: yang ji skad du bstan pa'i 'gal ba gnyis kyis kyang don 'gal ba brjod pa med pa byas pa'i don to /
translated: Moreover, the statement of the two types of contradiction as they have been presented does not make the statement of a contradictory object. The point is that it makes the statement of a noncontradictory object.

original: don 'gal ba med pa nyid rjod par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don 'gal ba med pa nyid rjod par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The point is that it makes the statement of a noncontradictory object.

original: des ni rang bzhin 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dmigs pa la sogs pa'i sbyor ba la rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: des ni rang bzhin 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dmigs pa la sogs pa'i sbyor ba la rtogs par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood as the application of the observation of an effect that is contradictory by nature, and so on.

original: de yang bsgribs med par zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de yang bsgribs med par zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: And that is to be supplied with the words ‚Äúwithout obstruction.‚Äù

original: bsgribs med par zhes bya ba la bsgribs pa'i don la mthong ba med pa'i phyir bsgribs pa nye bar btags nas mi dmigs par bstan to //
analyzed: bsgribs med par zhes bya ba la bsgribs pa'i don la mthong ba med pa'i phyir bsgribs pa nye bar btags nas mi dmigs par bstan to //
translated: As for ‚Äúwithout obstruction,‚Äù since there is no seeing of the meaning of obstruction, obstruction is figuratively designated as non-observation.

original: bsgribs med par zhes bya ba la bsgribs pa bkag pas de mi byed pa yin no //
analyzed: bsgribs med par zhes bya ba la bsgribs pa bkag pas de mi byed pa yin no //
translated: As for ‚Äúwithout obstruction,‚Äù the negation of obstruction means that it does not do that.

original: de bas na ci 'dra ba'i dmigs pa'i rang bzhin can du nges pa'i don de dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa de 'dra ba mi dmigs pa ma bstan par zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bas na ci 'dra ba'i dmigs pa'i rang bzhin can du nges pa'i don de dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa de 'dra ba mi dmigs pa ma bstan par zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of ‚Äúnot taught as such‚Äù is that the nature of the object of observation that is ascertained as such is not the characteristic of the object of observation.

original: 'dis kyang rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'i sbyor ba ltar bcos pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis kyang rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'i sbyor ba ltar bcos pa bstan to //
translated: This also teaches a counterfeit of the application of the observation of nature.

original: thabs bcas zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin dang bcas pa dang / rang nyid dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa ma yin na yang thabs gang gis de'i rgyu dang / de'i khyab par byed pa dang de'i 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: thabs bcas zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin dang bcas pa dang / rang nyid dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa ma yin na yang thabs gang gis de'i rgyu dang / de'i khyab par byed pa dang de'i 'bras bu ste /
translated: ‚ÄúAlong with the method‚Äù means that even if it is not the case that the nature is characterized by the object of apprehension, the method by which it is the cause of that, the pervader of that, and the effect of that,

original: snang ba'i rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'i thabs gang gis @158a * //
analyzed: snang ba'i rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'i thabs gang gis @158a * //
translated: by what method is the nature of appearance not apprehended?

original: med do zhes nges pa de yang dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa'i mi dmigs pa bstan par zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: med do zhes nges pa de yang dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa'i mi dmigs pa bstan par zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThat which is ascertained as non-existent is also taught to be the non-apprehension that is characterized by the object of apprehension.‚Äù

original: de de ltar na ma 'gal ba brjod pa med pa dang rang bzhin de yang bsgrub pa med par tshad ma smra ba gang yin pa de /
analyzed: de de ltar na ma 'gal ba brjod pa med pa dang rang bzhin de yang bsgrub pa med par tshad ma smra ba gang yin pa de /
translated: Thus, in that case, the one who speaks of the non-contradictory, the one who speaks of the nature that is not established without valid cognition,

original: rigs pa'i rjes su 'brang can min te /
analyzed: rigs pa'i rjes su 'brang can min te /
translated: is not a follower of reasoning.

original: 'khrul pa nyid yin pa'i phyir go bar byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: 'khrul pa nyid yin pa'i phyir go bar byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: Because of being mistaken, it is not understood.

original: ci dang 'dra bar zhe na /
analyzed: ci dang 'dra bar zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: smra la sogs pa kun shes dang // 'jig rten gzhan stsogs 'gog pa bzhin //
analyzed: smra la sogs pa kun shes dang // 'jig rten gzhan stsogs 'gog pa bzhin //
translated: Like the refutation of omniscience, speech, and so on, and the refutation of other worlds, and so on.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The root text says,

original: brjod par 'dod pa'i skyes bu la la zhes thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin te /üîΩsmra ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa'i skyes bu la la zhes thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin te / smra ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúSome person who is not omniscient, because he speaks, like Devadatta.‚Äù

original: stsogs pa smos pas ni skyes bu nyid dang / dbang po la sogs pa dad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba bzung ngo //üîΩskyes bu 'di la yang skyes bu nyid yin pa'i phyir 'jig rten pha rol yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: stsogs pa smos pas ni skyes bu nyid dang / dbang po la sogs pa dad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba bzung ngo // skyes bu 'di la yang skyes bu nyid yin pa'i phyir 'jig rten pha rol yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes ‚Äúbecause he is a person‚Äù and ‚Äúbecause he has faculties,‚Äù and so on.

original: dgra bcom pa 'dod pa'i skyes bu bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //üîΩstsogs pa smos pas ni /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa 'dod pa'i skyes bu bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o // stsogs pa smos pas ni /
translated: ‚ÄúThis person does not have an afterlife, because he is a person, like the arhat who is a person in the desire realm.‚Äù

original: snga na med pa dang lha nyid dang / mtho ris la sogs pa dgag pa de lta bu la sogs pa bzung ngo //
analyzed: snga na med pa dang lha nyid dang / mtho ris la sogs pa dgag pa de lta bu la sogs pa bzung ngo //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes ‚Äúbecause he is not a prior non-existent,‚Äù ‚Äúbecause he is a god,‚Äù and ‚Äúbecause he is in the higher realms,‚Äù and so on.

original: rtags gang yin pa de ni the tshom za bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rtags gang yin pa de ni the tshom za bar byed pa yin no //
translated: The reason is uncertain.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it uncertain?

original: don rnams dbang po las 'das pa /
analyzed: don rnams dbang po las 'das pa /
translated: Because the objects are beyond the senses.

original: yul dang dus dang rang bzhin gyis bskal pa rnams 'ga' zhig dang lhan cig 'gal ba grub pa med phyir de'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul dang dus dang rang bzhin gyis bskal pa rnams 'ga' zhig dang lhan cig 'gal ba grub pa med phyir de'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no proof of the incompatibility of any of the three kinds of dissimilarity, of place, time, and nature, with anything, and because of the reason stated above.

original: de ni gnas skabs gzhan bstan zin cing ji ltar bskal pa rnams 'ga' zhig dang / lhan cig 'gal bar rtogs par dka' ba yin no zhes ston par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni gnas skabs gzhan bstan zin cing ji ltar bskal pa rnams 'ga' zhig dang / lhan cig 'gal bar rtogs par dka' ba yin no zhes ston par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: And this is also an indication of the other situation, and it shows how difficult it is to understand the incompatibility of any of the three kinds of dissimilarity with anything.

original: rtogs pa'i thabs su gyur pa 'gal ba yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rtogs pa'i thabs su gyur pa 'gal ba yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The incompatibility that is the means of understanding is also of two kinds:

original: rgyu ma gtugs pa can 'byung ba gzhan yod na med pa dang / phan tshun spangs te /
analyzed: rgyu ma gtugs pa can 'byung ba gzhan yod na med pa dang / phan tshun spangs te /
translated: the one is the non-existence of one thing when another occurs, without any cause being stated; the other is the incompatibility of mutual exclusion,

original: gnas pa'i mtshan nyid can yin no //
analyzed: gnas pa'i mtshan nyid can yin no //
translated: which has the characteristic of the two not being able to remain together.

original: 'gal ba rnam pa de gnyi ga yang smra ba nyid dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gal ba rnam pa de gnyi ga yang smra ba nyid dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Neither of these two kinds of incompatibility is present in the case of speech and omniscience.

original: des na chos can gcig la /üîΩgal te smra rigs yod 'gyur la //
analyzed: des na chos can gcig la / gal te smra rigs yod 'gyur la //
translated: Therefore,

original: gnod bya gnod byed ngo bo gang //
analyzed: gnod bya gnod byed ngo bo gang //
translated: if speech were possible in the case of one who has the property of being an object,üîΩthen there would be the relation of the one to be refuted and the other the refutation,

original: cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: but there is not the slightest trace of this.

original: de bas na smras pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'gyur ba zhes bya ba 'gal ba med pa nyid yin @158b no //
analyzed: de bas na smras pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'gyur ba zhes bya ba 'gal ba med pa nyid yin @158b no //
translated: Therefore, there is no contradiction in saying that ‚Äúhe is omniscient.‚Äù

original: 'gal ba med par grub pa yang go bar byed pa ma yin no zhes sngar bstan zin to //
analyzed: 'gal ba med par grub pa yang go bar byed pa ma yin no zhes sngar bstan zin to //
translated: But it has already been demonstrated that the nonexistence of contradiction is not a proof.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: This is true, but

original: gal te de 'dra mi dmigs phyir //
analyzed: gal te de 'dra mi dmigs phyir //
translated: if it is not observed,

original: gal te yang 'gal ba yod pa ma yin pa de ltar na yang skyes bu gang gi don thams cad kyi yul can gyi shes pa de 'dra ba nyid mi dmigs pa'i phyir de yang yod pa ma yin no zhes nges pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te yang 'gal ba yod pa ma yin pa de ltar na yang skyes bu gang gi don thams cad kyi yul can gyi shes pa de 'dra ba nyid mi dmigs pa'i phyir de yang yod pa ma yin no zhes nges pa yin no zhe na /
translated: if the existence of contradiction does not exist, then it is certain that the person who is the object of all objects of knowledge does not exist, because such a person is not observed.

original: gal te de lta yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te de lta yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: If that is the case,

original: de 'dra ba mi dmigs pa de nyid skyes bu'i phul du byung ba 'gog pa la /
analyzed: de 'dra ba mi dmigs pa de nyid skyes bu'i phul du byung ba 'gog pa la /
translated: then the nonobservation of such a person is the proof that refutes the person who is the best of beings.

original: sgrub par byed par brjod na /
analyzed: sgrub par byed par brjod na /
translated: If you say that,

original: smras pa nyid la sogs pa shin tu blun po ston par byed pa nye bar 'god pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: smras pa nyid la sogs pa shin tu blun po ston par byed pa nye bar 'god pas ci zhig bya /
translated: then why do you state that you are teaching the extremely stupid, who are to be placed in the position of the respondent?

original: 'on kyang thams cad mkhyen pa la sogs pa dgag pa bsgrub par bya ba la /
analyzed: 'on kyang thams cad mkhyen pa la sogs pa dgag pa bsgrub par bya ba la /
translated: However, in order to prove the negation of omniscience, etc.,

original: mi dmigs pa 'di sgrub par byed pa ni bla ste /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa 'di sgrub par byed pa ni bla ste /
translated: it is best to prove this non-apprehension.

original: de ltar na yang khas len pa'i 'dod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na yang khas len pa'i 'dod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But even so, it will not become the desired conclusion of the one who asserts.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ltar mi dmigs pa ni 'di 'dra ba yang /
analyzed: de ltar mi dmigs pa ni 'di 'dra ba yang /
translated: Because this kind of non-apprehension

original: 'bras bu nges med can /
analyzed: 'bras bu nges med can /
translated: has a result that is uncertain.

original: the tshom za bar byed par sngar nyid /
analyzed: the tshom za bar byed par sngar nyid /
translated: This has already been stated above.

original: rab brjod de ji ltar mi snang ba mi dmigs pa ni dgag pa la nus pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rab brjod de ji ltar mi snang ba mi dmigs pa ni dgag pa la nus pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: How is it that non-apprehension of non-appearance does not have the ability to negate?

original: 'khrul ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khrul ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is mistaken.

original: de ltar na snang ba'i dngos po la de las gzhan dmigs pa'i rkyen yod na /
analyzed: de ltar na snang ba'i dngos po la de las gzhan dmigs pa'i rkyen yod na /
translated: Thus, if the condition for the apprehension of something other than the appearing thing exists,

original: ma rmongs par dran pa'i 'du byed pa po'i mngon sum 'das pa dang de ltar gyi logs na med pa'i tha snyad 'jug par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: ma rmongs par dran pa'i 'du byed pa po'i mngon sum 'das pa dang de ltar gyi logs na med pa'i tha snyad 'jug par 'gyur gyi /
translated: then the direct perception of the one who is not confused, who is mindful, and who is the agent of the mental process, will engage in the convention of the non-existence of the other.

original: cig shos ni ma yin no //
analyzed: cig shos ni ma yin no //
translated: But the other will not.

original: rgol ba gang gi yang mthong ba don thams cad yod pa nyid la 'khrul ba med pa de mi dmigs pa las khyad par med do zhes smra ba ni mdzes pa yin no //
analyzed: rgol ba gang gi yang mthong ba don thams cad yod pa nyid la 'khrul ba med pa de mi dmigs pa las khyad par med do zhes smra ba ni mdzes pa yin no //
translated: It is proper to say that the perception of any opponent is not mistaken with respect to the existence of all objects, and that it is not different from nonapprehension.

original: da ltar na yang de nyid don thams cad shes pa yin pa de ltar na de 'dra ba gzhan 'byung ba dag kyang ma spangs pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: da ltar na yang de nyid don thams cad shes pa yin pa de ltar na de 'dra ba gzhan 'byung ba dag kyang ma spangs pa nyid yin no //
translated: If it is the case that it is the cognition of all objects, then it is not the case that other such cognitions do not arise.

original: yul nyid rnam pa gsum 'byung bar 'gyur te gcig ni mngon sum yin te gang gi nus pa las rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa can gyi blo 'byung ba de ni de las grub pa yin no //
analyzed: yul nyid rnam pa gsum 'byung bar 'gyur te gcig ni mngon sum yin te gang gi nus pa las rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa can gyi blo 'byung ba de ni de las grub pa yin no //
translated: The object itself arises in three ways: One is direct perception, from the capacity of which there arises an awareness that is concomitant with it.

original: gang yang bdag gi yod pa dang med pa la dngos su blo'i snang ba'i rjes su mi byed pa de yang gal te bzlog pa la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma 'jug pa sgrub par byed pa de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid can gyi 'brel ba can gyi
analyzed: gang yang bdag gi yod pa dang med pa la dngos su blo'i snang ba'i rjes su mi byed pa de yang gal te bzlog pa la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma 'jug pa sgrub par byed pa de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid can gyi 'brel ba can gyi
translated: That which is not directly engaged in the appearance of awareness of the existence and nonexistence of the self, if it is engaged in a valid cognition that contradicts it, is established as having a relation that has the characteristic of being of the same nature as that.

original: rtags dang ldan par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: rtags dang ldan par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: It is endowed with a reason that hasüîΩthe property of the subject.

original: dmigs @159a * //üîΩpa dang mi dmigs pa dag gis rab tu bsgrubs pa'i 'bras bu'i rtags dang ldan pa'am /
analyzed: dmigs @159a * // pa dang mi dmigs pa dag gis rab tu bsgrubs pa'i 'bras bu'i rtags dang ldan pa'am /
translated: It is the result of the practice of both the visualization and nonvisualization.üîΩ

original: 'bras bu ldog pa'i sgo nas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa can grub pa yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu ldog pa'i sgo nas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa can grub pa yin te /
translated: The relation of cause and effect is established either by the effect that is produced by the object and its non-observation, or by the cessation of the effect.

original: dper na de las gzhan pa'i rgyu dag yod na 'bras bu rnam par shes pa mi skyed pas /
analyzed: dper na de las gzhan pa'i rgyu dag yod na 'bras bu rnam par shes pa mi skyed pas /
translated: For example, if other causes exist, the effect, consciousness, is not produced.üîΩBut if the other causes that are applied to the production of consciousness are not present, consciousness is not produced.

original: shes pa de skyed pa la nye bar sbyor ba can rgyu gzhan gang med pa na mi skye ba yang yod pa yin pa de ltar na rnam par phye ba'i ngo bo dbang po zhes bya bar grags pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: shes pa de skyed pa la nye bar sbyor ba can rgyu gzhan gang med pa na mi skye ba yang yod pa yin pa de ltar na rnam par phye ba'i ngo bo dbang po zhes bya bar grags pa lta bu ste /
translated: In this way, the nature of the sense faculty is distinguished and known.

original: de 'dra ba'i dngos po de thams cad ni lkog tu gyur pa yin no //üîΩde ltar na gang rang bzhin du gyur pa'am /
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i dngos po de thams cad ni lkog tu gyur pa yin no // de ltar na gang rang bzhin du gyur pa'am /
translated: All such things are hidden.

original: 'bras bur gyur pa'i rtags yod pa ma yin pa dang / mngon sum med de /
analyzed: 'bras bur gyur pa'i rtags yod pa ma yin pa dang / mngon sum med de /
translated: Thus, that which is not a nature or an effect does not have a sign that exists or is directly perceived.

original: dper na bdag la sogs pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: dper na bdag la sogs pa lta bu ste /
translated: For example, a self and so on.

original: de thams cad ni shin tu lkog tu gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: de thams cad ni shin tu lkog tu gyur pa yin no //
translated: All of these are extremely hidden.

original: de'i 'bras bu nyid du 'dod pa'i dbugs 'byung ba la sogs pa de dag ni rgyu gzhan blo la sogs pa dag ni bum pa la sogs pa la med pas /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu nyid du 'dod pa'i dbugs 'byung ba la sogs pa de dag ni rgyu gzhan blo la sogs pa dag ni bum pa la sogs pa la med pas /
translated: The arising of the breath, etc., which are asserted to be the effects of the mind, do not exist in such things as a pot, which are other causes.

original: rigs pa dang ldan pa'i ldog pa med pas /
analyzed: rigs pa dang ldan pa'i ldog pa med pas /
translated: Since there is no rational basis for exclusion,

original: 'bras bu nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir //
analyzed: 'bras bu nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir //
translated: they are not established as effects.

original: de la 'jug par byed pa'am /
analyzed: de la 'jug par byed pa'am /
translated: There is no engagement or disengagement in that.üîΩThus, one who sees only one side cannot ascertain that it exists.

original: ldog par byed pa yod pa ma yin no zhes tshu rol mthong bas de yod pa nyid du nges par mi nus pa lta bu'o thams cad mkhyen pa la sogs pa yang dbang po las 'das pa yin pa /üîΩde phyir shin tu lkog gyur la //
analyzed: ldog par byed pa yod pa ma yin no zhes tshu rol mthong bas de yod pa nyid du nges par mi nus pa lta bu'o thams cad mkhyen pa la sogs pa yang dbang po las 'das pa yin pa / de phyir shin tu lkog gyur la //
translated: Omniscience, etc., are also beyond the senses.

original: don de lta bu'i rnam pa la //
analyzed: don de lta bu'i rnam pa la //
translated: Therefore, with respect to that extremely hidden object,

original: yod med nyid ni rnam nges med //
analyzed: yod med nyid ni rnam nges med //
translated: one cannot ascertain existence or nonexistenceüîΩwith respect to that kind of aspect.

original: de bas na 'gal ba med pa'i don de 'dra bas ldog pa sgrub par byed pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de bas na 'gal ba med pa'i don de 'dra bas ldog pa sgrub par byed pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Thus, since the meaning is not contradictory, it is not established by exclusion,

original: gsal bas sgrub par byed pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: gsal bas sgrub par byed pa nyid yin no //
translated: but is established by affirmation.

original: gal te 'ga' zhig 'gog pa la sbyor bar byed pa na /
analyzed: gal te 'ga' zhig 'gog pa la sbyor bar byed pa na /
translated: If someone were to apply an argument to a negation,

original: chos ni tha dad pa sbyor bar byed dam /
analyzed: chos ni tha dad pa sbyor bar byed dam /
translated: Does it join them as different things?

original: dgag par bya ba las /
analyzed: dgag par bya ba las /
translated: Does the reason prove a difference or does it negate a difference?üîΩIt is not a difference that is proved or negated.

original: tha dad med kyang rab sbyor byed //
analyzed: tha dad med kyang rab sbyor byed //
translated: But a difference is proved by the reason.

original: gal te phan tshun 'gal ba'i chos dag kyang gcig la ji ltar na yod pa yin /
analyzed: gal te phan tshun 'gal ba'i chos dag kyang gcig la ji ltar na yod pa yin /
translated: If mutually contradictory properties are found in one thing, how can they be contradictory?

original: gang gis na 'gal ba tha dad med pa'i sbyor bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis na 'gal ba tha dad med pa'i sbyor bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How can there be a proof of a non-difference of contradictories?

original: de de ltar ni yin mod kyi /
analyzed: de de ltar ni yin mod kyi /
translated: This is true, but

original: 'on kyang gzhan 'gal ba dag kyang gcig la yod par rtogs pa de ltar na /
analyzed: 'on kyang gzhan 'gal ba dag kyang gcig la yod par rtogs pa de ltar na /
translated: when one understands that contradictories can be found in one thing,

original: de'i dor byas nas de skad du brjod do //
analyzed: de'i dor byas nas de skad du brjod do //
translated: then one can say that the reason proves a non-difference.

original: ji ltar na tha dad pa rab tu sbyor ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na tha dad pa rab tu sbyor ba yin zhe na /
translated: How is a difference proved?

original: dper na kha med sgrub pa la /üîΩdper na 'di na kha ba'i reg pa med do zhes sgrub par byed pa de las don gzhan @159b grang ba dang 'gal ba me rab tu sbyor ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na kha med sgrub pa la / dper na 'di na kha ba'i reg pa med do zhes sgrub par byed pa de las don gzhan @159b grang ba dang 'gal ba me rab tu sbyor ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, in the proof that there is no fireüîΩin a place where there is no smoke, the reason proves a difference.

original: tha dad pa med pa ni dper na /
analyzed: tha dad pa med pa ni dper na /
translated: A non-difference is proved, for example,

original: skye la yod nyid 'gal ba bzhin //
analyzed: skye la yod nyid 'gal ba bzhin //
translated: like the contradiction of existence and non-existence in one thing.

original: yod pa nyid skyed par 'gyur ro zhes 'dod pa gang yin pa de dag ni gang phul du byung ba 'ga' zhig kho na skye ba'i sgo nas dbang po'i yul du gyur pa la sogs pa'i ngo bor 'byung bas skye ba zhes tha snyad ldog par byed do
analyzed: yod pa nyid skyed par 'gyur ro zhes 'dod pa gang yin pa de dag ni gang phul du byung ba 'ga' zhig kho na skye ba'i sgo nas dbang po'i yul du gyur pa la sogs pa'i ngo bor 'byung bas skye ba zhes tha snyad ldog par byed do
translated: Those who assert that ‚Äúexistence‚Äù is produced, they are merely using the term ‚Äúproduction‚Äù to refer to the occurrence of something excellent that becomes an object of the senses.

original: // phul du byung ba de sngar med pa nyid skye ba yin gyi /
analyzed: // phul du byung ba de sngar med pa nyid skye ba yin gyi /
translated: That excellence is produced as something that did not exist previously.

original: de lta ma yin na da ltar gyi gnas skabs bzhin du sngar yang yod pa yin na //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na da ltar gyi gnas skabs bzhin du sngar yang yod pa yin na //
translated: Otherwise, it would have existed previously, just as it does at present.

original: skye ba'i don gang yin pa des na rnam pa gang yod pa de mi 'byung zhing 'byung ba gang yin pa de ltar yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: skye ba'i don gang yin pa des na rnam pa gang yod pa de mi 'byung zhing 'byung ba gang yin pa de ltar yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Since that is the meaning of ‚Äúproduction,‚Äù whatever exists does not arise, and whatever arises does not exist in that way.

original: gnas skabs de dang de 'brel pas de nyid de ltar skye ba yin no zhes pa'i rnam par rtog pa yang mi 'gyur te /üîΩskye ba dang 'jig pa dang ldan pa dag ni /
analyzed: gnas skabs de dang de 'brel pas de nyid de ltar skye ba yin no zhes pa'i rnam par rtog pa yang mi 'gyur te / skye ba dang 'jig pa dang ldan pa dag ni /
translated: The thought that ‚Äúthat very thing is produced in that way‚Äù does not occur in connection with that state.üîΩBecause it is established that things that possess production and destruction

original: rtag pa las gzhan nyid du sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa las gzhan nyid du sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: are different from permanent things.

original: de ltar ma yin na thams cad ches par 'gyur ro //üîΩskyes bu skye ba'am shi ba la gangs can g-yo ba med pa 'byung ba'am /
analyzed: de ltar ma yin na thams cad ches par 'gyur ro // skyes bu skye ba'am shi ba la gangs can g-yo ba med pa 'byung ba'am /
translated: If it were not so, then everything would be produced.

original: 'jig par rtogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'jig par rtogs pa ma yin te /
translated: The birth or death of a person does not prove the arising or destruction of the mountain.üîΩThe state and the one who is in that state are not different.

original: gnas skabs dang de dang ldan pa dag tha dad pa med pa yang sgrub pa nyid skye ba dang mi skye ba 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: gnas skabs dang de dang ldan pa dag tha dad pa med pa yang sgrub pa nyid skye ba dang mi skye ba 'gal ba yin no //
translated: The state is the very thing that is produced. It is contradictory for something to be both produced and not produced.

original: 'gal ba'i chos gnas skabs pa de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: 'gal ba'i chos gnas skabs pa de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Because of the contradiction between the state and the thing in the state,

original: de nyid ces 'dod pa yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid ces 'dod pa yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: it cannot be said that the state is the very thing in the state.

original: de'i phyir med pa phul du byung ba de yod pa nyid yod pa de bas na /
analyzed: de'i phyir med pa phul du byung ba de yod pa nyid yod pa de bas na /
translated: Therefore, the nonexistence of the thing in the state is the existence of the state.

original: yod pa nyid 'di ni skye ba dang 'gal ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yod pa nyid 'di ni skye ba dang 'gal ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, this existence is said to be contradictory to production.

original: gal te de sngar yod pa nyid yin na de nyid skye ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te de sngar yod pa nyid yin na de nyid skye ba ma yin no //
translated: If the thing in the state existed previously, then it would not be produced.

original: ci ste de skye ba yin na /
analyzed: ci ste de skye ba yin na /
translated: But if it is produced,

original: 'o na ni de sngar yod pa nyid ma yin no zhes gcig tu nges pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'o na ni de sngar yod pa nyid ma yin no zhes gcig tu nges pa nyid yin no //
translated: then it does not exist previously.

original: ji ltar dngos rnams bsgrub pa la //
analyzed: ji ltar dngos rnams bsgrub pa la //
translated: How can things be established?

original: dngos po nyid ni sgrub byed 'dod //
analyzed: dngos po nyid ni sgrub byed 'dod //
translated: The existence of things is the proof of things.

original: ji skad bshad pa'i /
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i /
translated: As it was said:

original: dngos gang yang dag ji bzhin pa //
analyzed: dngos gang yang dag ji bzhin pa //
translated: ‚ÄúThe existence of things just as they are‚ÄùüîΩand so on.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji ltar dngos po nyid dngos po'i sgrub pa yin pa de ltar dngos po rnams rang ldog la bdag nyid ldog pa dag la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji ltar dngos po nyid dngos po'i sgrub pa yin pa de ltar dngos po rnams rang ldog la bdag nyid ldog pa dag la /
translated: Just as the existence of things is the proof of things, in the same way, the existence of things is the refutation of the self of things.

original: dngos po nyid ni ldog byed yin //üîΩdes ni dngos po nyid kyis dngos po sgrub par byed pa'am /
analyzed: dngos po nyid ni ldog byed yin // des ni dngos po nyid kyis dngos po sgrub par byed pa'am /
translated: The existence of things is the refutation of the self of things.üîΩTherefore, the existence of things proves the existence of things,

original: dngos po ldog pa nyid kyis dngos po ldog pa nyid go bar byed pa nyid yin no //üîΩdes gang rtogs pa dag gi sbyar ba yi //
analyzed: dngos po ldog pa nyid kyis dngos po ldog pa nyid go bar byed pa nyid yin no // des gang rtogs pa dag gi sbyar ba yi //
translated: or the nonexistence of the self of things makes known the nonexistence of the self of things.

original: 'dod pas sgro btags pa'i chos yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dod pas sgro btags pa'i chos yin gyi /
translated: The things that are understood by that are the things that are imagined by the desire to superimpose nonexisting things.

original: dngos po ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩde ni @160a * //
analyzed: dngos po ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to // de ni @160a * //
translated: They are not real things. This is the meaning.

original: bsal ba yin /
analyzed: bsal ba yin /
translated: That is refuted.

original: spangs pa yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: spangs pa yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood that it is rejected.

original: dper na sgrub par byed pa dang 'gog par byed pa ma yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na sgrub par byed pa dang 'gog par byed pa ma yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like a nonproof and a nonrefutation.

original: ci'i phyir dngos po med pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir dngos po med pa yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it nonexistent?

original: bshad pa gang la lar yod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bshad pa gang la lar yod pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is explained in some places.

original: ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du gzhan du gyur pa gang yin pa de ni dngos po'i rang bzhin ma yin gyi /
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du gzhan du gyur pa gang yin pa de ni dngos po'i rang bzhin ma yin gyi /
translated: Whatever is transformed in accordance with desire is not the nature of things.

original: 'on kyang de la rtogs pas gzhan du 'gyur ba yin gyi /
analyzed: 'on kyang de la rtogs pas gzhan du 'gyur ba yin gyi /
translated: However, it is transformed by the realization of that.

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the nature of things.

original: de 'dra ba'i chos de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i chos de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that kind of dharma?

original: phyogs dang phyogs mthun gang rung nyid //
analyzed: phyogs dang phyogs mthun gang rung nyid //
translated: It is any direction or intermediate direction.

original: sogs pa smos pas ni /
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù

original: kho bos khas blangs pa la sogs pa dang lung gis bsgrub pa bzung ngo //
analyzed: kho bos khas blangs pa la sogs pa dang lung gis bsgrub pa bzung ngo //
translated: refers to the acceptance of what I assert and the establishment by scripture.

original: de ltar na de dag ni smra ba po'i 'dod pa tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa can yin gyi /
analyzed: de ltar na de dag ni smra ba po'i 'dod pa tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa can yin gyi /
translated: Thus, those are only related to the assertions of the proponent.

original: phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs gang yang rung ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa la yang /
analyzed: phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs gang yang rung ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa la yang /
translated: Even in the conception of any direction or intermediate direction,

original: dngos po'i nye ba dang bskal pa dag tu mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po'i nye ba dang bskal pa dag tu mi 'gyur ro //
translated: there is no nearness or remoteness of things.

original: 'on ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on ci yin zhe na /
translated: Well then, what is it?

original: de la nye ba dang bskal pa dag ni /
analyzed: de la nye ba dang bskal pa dag ni /
translated: Nearness and remoteness in that

original: 'dod pas nye ba dang bskal pa dag yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pas nye ba dang bskal pa dag yin no //
translated: It is either near or distant in terms of desire.

original: gal te yang dngos po las 'gyur ba yin na /
analyzed: gal te yang dngos po las 'gyur ba yin na /
translated: If it were a transformation of the thing,

original: de'i 'dod pas gzhan nyid du rtogs par mi 'gyur na 'gyur ba yang yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i 'dod pas gzhan nyid du rtogs par mi 'gyur na 'gyur ba yang yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: then it would not be understood as different by desire. But it is a transformation.

original: de dag ni 'ba' zhig gi yang sgrub par byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de dag ni 'ba' zhig gi yang sgrub par byed pa yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, it is a proof of only that.

original: gnod pa can nyid yin no //
analyzed: gnod pa can nyid yin no //
translated: It is not a refutation.

original: gang yang dngos po ldog pa nyid dngos po rnams kyi ldog par byed pa nyid yin no zhes bshad pa /
analyzed: gang yang dngos po ldog pa nyid dngos po rnams kyi ldog par byed pa nyid yin no zhes bshad pa /
translated: Also, it was said that the cessation of a thing is the cessation of things.

original: de yang khyab par byed pa'i chos /
analyzed: de yang khyab par byed pa'i chos /
translated: But that is a property of the pervaded.

original: ldog par byed pa'i ldog pa'am khyab bya'i go byed 'dod /
analyzed: ldog par byed pa'i ldog pa'am khyab bya'i go byed 'dod /
translated: Do you assert that it is the cessation of the pervader or the understood of the pervaded?

original: khyab par byed pa med pa'i yang go bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: khyab par byed pa med pa'i yang go bar byed pa yin no //
translated: It is also the understood of the absence of the pervader.

original: 'dis kyang rgyu dang khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa 'dren par bstan pa rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dis kyang rgyu dang khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa 'dren par bstan pa rtogs par bya'o //
translated: This also teaches that the nonobservation of a cause and the nonobservation of a pervader are similar.

original: gang gi cho zhe na /üîΩgal te rang gi ldog pa ni //
analyzed: gang gi cho zhe na / gal te rang gi ldog pa ni //
translated: With respect to what?üîΩIf the cessation of its own thing

original: rnam 'gas yongs su gcod pa na'o //
analyzed: rnam 'gas yongs su gcod pa na'o //
translated: is ascertained in some way.

original: gal te rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis de bzlog pa la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma 'jug pa khyab par bya ba'i de tsam dang 'brel pas khyab par byed pa'i dngos por grub pa can bdag nyid med par nges par 'gyur ba na /
analyzed: gal te rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis de bzlog pa la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma 'jug pa khyab par bya ba'i de tsam dang 'brel pas khyab par byed pa'i dngos por grub pa can bdag nyid med par nges par 'gyur ba na /
translated: If some aspect of the object of negation is refuted, then the valid cognition that contradicts it is related to the mere object of negation, and the object of negation is established as not existing.

original: de dag nyid med pas de'i tshe khyab bya ldog pa go bar byed do //
analyzed: de dag nyid med pas de'i tshe khyab bya ldog pa go bar byed do //
translated: Since those [valid cognitions] themselves do not exist, at that time the pervaded is understood to be negated.

original: de bzhin du bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du tshad ma'i sngo nas de'i rgyu dngos por grub pa can bdag nyid med par grub pa can gyi rgyu ni 'bras @160b bu'i yang yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du tshad ma'i sngo nas de'i rgyu dngos por grub pa can bdag nyid med par grub pa can gyi rgyu ni 'bras @160b bu'i yang yin no //
translated: In the same way, just as the valid cognition establishes the object of negation, the cause of that valid cognition is established as not existing. The cause of the valid cognition is also the effect of the object of negation.

original: tshad ma nyid med ces pa gcig dang 'dres pa can tshad ma nyid ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: tshad ma nyid med ces pa gcig dang 'dres pa can tshad ma nyid ma yin pa ste /
translated: The phrase the absence of valid cognition is similar to mixed with one, which means not valid cognition.

original: tshad ma nyid ldog pa gang de nyid med pa ste /
analyzed: tshad ma nyid ldog pa gang de nyid med pa ste /
translated: The negation of valid cognition is the absence of that [valid cognition].

original: med pa'i tha snyad bsgrub par bya ba la ji skad du bshad pa'i mngon sum ldog pa gang yin pa rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'i ming can rtags su brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: med pa'i tha snyad bsgrub par bya ba la ji skad du bshad pa'i mngon sum ldog pa gang yin pa rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'i ming can rtags su brjod pa yin no //
