translated: The evidence that is mentioned, which is called ‚Äúnon-observation of the essence,‚Äù is the opposite of the direct perception that was explained above, in order to prove the expression of non-existence.

original: rtags de ni shin tu rmongs don te /
analyzed: rtags de ni shin tu rmongs don te /
translated: That evidence is for the sake of the very confused.

original: yul rtogs su zin kyang de'i yul can gyi tha snyad ma rtogs pa gang yin pa de ni rmongs pa yin la /
analyzed: yul rtogs su zin kyang de'i yul can gyi tha snyad ma rtogs pa gang yin pa de ni rmongs pa yin la /
translated: Even though the object is understood, if the expression of its subject is not understood, that is confusion.

original: de'i don du rtags de 'dra ba brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i don du rtags de 'dra ba brjod pa yin no //
translated: That evidence is mentioned for the sake of that.

original: de lta ma yin na brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would be inexpressible.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gnag rdzi mo bar grags phyir ro //
analyzed: gnag rdzi mo bar grags phyir ro //
translated: Because it is well known even to cowherds.

original: don rnam pa de lta bu ni gnag rdzi mo'i bar la rab tu grags pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: don rnam pa de lta bu ni gnag rdzi mo'i bar la rab tu grags pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because that kind of object is well known even to cowherds.

original: de nyid ni sngar zhib tu dpyad zin pa de lta na /
analyzed: de nyid ni sngar zhib tu dpyad zin pa de lta na /
translated: Since that has already been analyzed in detail above,

original: 'dir yang ma spros so //
analyzed: 'dir yang ma spros so //
translated: I will not elaborate on it here.

original: mi dmigs pa ni de tsam zhig / ji skad du bstan pa'i mi dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni mi dmigs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa ni de tsam zhig / ji skad du bstan pa'i mi dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni mi dmigs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The non-apprehension that has been taught is non-apprehension, that is the meaning of the sentence.

original: de ni med pa ste dgag pa dang de'i tha snyad la ci rigs par nges pa'i 'bras can yin gyi gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni med pa ste dgag pa dang de'i tha snyad la ci rigs par nges pa'i 'bras can yin gyi gzhan ma yin no //
translated: It is the non-existence, the negation, and the convention of that, as the case may be, that has the result of ascertainment, and not anything else.

original: mi dmigs pa nges par byed pa de yang gang gi tshe yin na /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa nges par byed pa de yang gang gi tshe yin na /
translated: And when is that ascertainment of non-apprehension?

original: rgyu'am rang bzhin dang // mi snang ba la snang nyid 'dod //
analyzed: rgyu'am rang bzhin dang // mi snang ba la snang nyid 'dod //
translated: When there is non-apprehension of cause or nature, or of the appearance of the non-appearing.

original: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa nyid du khas blangs nas so //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa nyid du khas blangs nas so //
translated: Having accepted the non-apprehension as having the characteristic of an object.

original: mi snang ba ni dmigs par ma gyur na'o //
analyzed: mi snang ba ni dmigs par ma gyur na'o //
translated: The non-appearing is the non-apprehension when there is no appearance.

original: 'dis ni rgyu mi dmigs pa dang / rang bzhin mi dmigs pa dang don gyis khyab par byed pa yang mi dmigs pa bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba na mjug bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni rgyu mi dmigs pa dang / rang bzhin mi dmigs pa dang don gyis khyab par byed pa yang mi dmigs pa bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba na mjug bsdu ba'o //
translated: This shows the non-apprehension of cause, the non-apprehension of nature, and the non-apprehension of the pervader of the object. This is the conclusion.

original: de de ltar zhar la 'ongs pa rdzogs par byas nas /
analyzed: de de ltar zhar la 'ongs pa rdzogs par byas nas /
translated: Having thus completed the digression,

original: rjes su dpag pas zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnal ma dang sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnal ma dang sbyor bar byed do //
translated: He connects the correct position with the words, ‚Äúby inference, etc.‚Äù

original: skabs kyang gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: skabs kyang gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the occasion?

original: kha dog spyi la sbyor phyir ro //
analyzed: kha dog spyi la sbyor phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause it is applied to the universal of color.‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is the occasion.

original: zhar la 'ongs pa yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: zhar la 'ongs pa yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is the digression?

original: dngos med ngo bo min de nyid //
analyzed: dngos med ngo bo min de nyid //
translated: ‚ÄúNon-entity is not the essence.‚Äù

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is the digression.

original: go rims 'di ste rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pas kha dog gi spyi mi rtag pa nyid dang sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: go rims 'di ste rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pas kha dog gi spyi mi rtag pa nyid dang sbyor bar byed do //
translated: This is the order: the conceptual consciousness applies the universal of impermanence to the universal of color.

original: gal te yang rnam par rtog pa la snang ba can gyi spyi la de ltar zhen pa yin pa de ltar na yang dngos po nyid du grub po zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa sngar bshad pa yin no //üîΩgang gi tshe @161a * //
analyzed: gal te yang rnam par rtog pa la snang ba can gyi spyi la de ltar zhen pa yin pa de ltar na yang dngos po nyid du grub po zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa sngar bshad pa yin no // gang gi tshe @161a * //
translated: Even though the universal that appears in the conceptual consciousness is conceived in that way, it is established as a real entity. This is the sort of thing that was explained earlier.üîΩWhen is it?

original: bzhed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: bzhed pa yin zhe na /
translated: When is it desired?

original: rjes su dpag pas te tshad mas kha dog la sogs pa la yod pa'i mi rtag stsogs 'dzin pa yin gyi gzhan gyi tshe ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas te tshad mas kha dog la sogs pa la yod pa'i mi rtag stsogs 'dzin pa yin gyi gzhan gyi tshe ni ma yin no //
translated: It is by inference, by a valid cognition, that one apprehends impermanence, etc., as existing in color, etc., and not otherwise.üîΩWhy is that?

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Because,

original: 'di ltar gzhan la /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhan la /
translated: in regard to another,

original: gang la skad cig tha ma mthong pa'i rang tshul can gyis da rigs pa'am gyur pa na 'di zhig pa yin no zhes nges par 'gyur pa de la /
analyzed: gang la skad cig tha ma mthong pa'i rang tshul can gyis da rigs pa'am gyur pa na 'di zhig pa yin no zhes nges par 'gyur pa de la /
translated: when one sees the last moment of the life of a thing, one is certain that it has perished, because one has seen the nature of things.

original: mngon sum nyid kyis mi rtag pa'i rang bzhin rtogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mngon sum nyid kyis mi rtag pa'i rang bzhin rtogs pa'i phyir /
translated: By direct perception, one understands the impermanent nature of the thing.

original: de'i tshe gzung ba nges pa nyid yin pa de ltar na /üîΩgzung ba 'dzin pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de'i tshe gzung ba nges pa nyid yin pa de ltar na / gzung ba 'dzin pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: At that time, there is ascertainment of the object.

original: de'i tshe tshad ma nyid du mi bzhed do //
analyzed: de'i tshe tshad ma nyid du mi bzhed do //
translated: But, at that time, it is not accepted that there is a valid cognition, because the object is grasped by the valid cognition.

original: gang gis de las kyang dngos po mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa dad ldan pa grub pa yin /
analyzed: gang gis de las kyang dngos po mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa dad ldan pa grub pa yin /
translated: By that, the aspect of the impermanent thing, etc., is also established.

original: de bzhin du rjes su dpag pas nges pa las kyang dus phyis byung ba la rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rjes su dpag pas nges pa las kyang dus phyis byung ba la rtogs par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, one should understand that the object is ascertained later on, even from the ascertainment by inference.

original: gzung ba 'dzin pa'i dngos po yang ji ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: gzung ba 'dzin pa'i dngos po yang ji ltar yin zhe na /
translated: How could the object of apprehension exist?

original: bshad pa 'di ltar dngos po de yang /
analyzed: bshad pa 'di ltar dngos po de yang /
translated: The object exists in this way:

original: dbang po las te /
analyzed: dbang po las te /
translated: The object is from the sense faculty.

original: mngon sum gyis yongs su gcod pa na srog chags rnams kyi de'i skad cig mar gnas pa'i chos can nyid kyi rang bzhin 'dzin pa de nyid mi rtag pa zhes bya ba gzhan 'ga' zhig kyang gzhan na yod pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis yongs su gcod pa na srog chags rnams kyi de'i skad cig mar gnas pa'i chos can nyid kyi rang bzhin 'dzin pa de nyid mi rtag pa zhes bya ba gzhan 'ga' zhig kyang gzhan na yod pa yin no //
translated: When the object is ascertained by direct perception, the nature of the object that is the basis of the object‚Äôs momentary existence is apprehended by living beings.

original: de ltar na gang zhig gang gi bdag nyid du gyur pa de ni de grub pa na grub pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na gang zhig gang gi bdag nyid du gyur pa de ni de grub pa na grub pa yin te /
translated: Thus, if something becomes the nature of something, when the latter is established, the former is also established.

original: dper na sgra la sogs pa'i chos can de nyid kyi ngo bo lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na sgra la sogs pa'i chos can de nyid kyi ngo bo lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the nature of the object, such as sound, is just that.

original: gal te de'i mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i chos de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te de'i mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i chos de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: If impermanence and so on become the nature of that object,

original: gang gis na ma grub pa yin /
analyzed: gang gis na ma grub pa yin /
translated: then how could they not be established?

original: ci ste yang mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa dngos po las don gzhan yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: ci ste yang mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa dngos po las don gzhan yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: But if impermanence and so on are different objects from the object,

original: dngos po de 'jig par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: dngos po de 'jig par mi 'gyur te /
translated: then the object would not perish.

original: gzhan yod na gzhan 'jig pa zhes bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yod na gzhan 'jig pa zhes bya ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not the case that when the other exists, the other is destroyed.

original: de bas na dngos po'i 'jig pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa zhes bya'i rtogs pa yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bas na dngos po'i 'jig pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa zhes bya'i rtogs pa yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable to think that the nature of the destruction of things is real.

original: bdag nyid g-yo ba med pa'i rang bzhin can gzhan gyi rang bzhin gzhan du med par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid g-yo ba med pa'i rang bzhin can gzhan gyi rang bzhin gzhan du med par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not possible for something that has an immobile nature to have a different nature from another.

original: @161b bdag nyid g-yo ba med pa'i rang bzhin @162a * //
analyzed: @161b bdag nyid g-yo ba med pa'i rang bzhin @162a * //
translated: The nature of something that has an immobile nature

original: la rang bzhin sna tshogs pa bzhin du rnam par rtog pa'i blo nye bar gzhag pa'i chos rnams ni /
analyzed: la rang bzhin sna tshogs pa bzhin du rnam par rtog pa'i blo nye bar gzhag pa'i chos rnams ni /
translated: is not like a variety of natures. The dharmas that are posited by the mind that conceives of them

original: der snang ba'i rjes su byed pa des ngo bo sna tshogs pa'i tha snyad du brjod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: der snang ba'i rjes su byed pa des ngo bo sna tshogs pa'i tha snyad du brjod pa yin gyi /
translated: are described as having a variety of natures that conform to the way they appear.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid la ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid la ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But this is not the case with their own characteristics.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rnam par rtog pa las skyes pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rnam par rtog pa las skyes pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: That is why it is said that they arise from conceptualization.

original: de'i phyir / spyi'i rten ni grub pa na mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos kyi rten sgra la sogs pa'i chos can cha med pa mngon sum gyis bzung bar gyur pa na /
analyzed: de'i phyir / spyi'i rten ni grub pa na mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos kyi rten sgra la sogs pa'i chos can cha med pa mngon sum gyis bzung bar gyur pa na /
translated: Therefore, when the universal is established, the substratum of the properties such as impermanence, the sound, etc., which are the subjects, are apprehended by direct perception, and then

original: spyi de nyid ni grub pa yin de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin grub pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: spyi de nyid ni grub pa yin de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin grub pa nyid yin no //
translated: the universal itself is established, and the nature of impermanence, etc., which is of the same nature as that, is established.

original: de ma grub na mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i sgra la sogs pa'i chos can ma bzung na /
analyzed: de ma grub na mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i sgra la sogs pa'i chos can ma bzung na /
translated: If that is not established, the sound, etc., which are the subjects possessing the properties such as impermanence, are not apprehended.

original: de ltar chos de dang ldan pa sgra la sogs pa'i chos can de'i rab tu grub phyir mi rtag pa'i rang bzhin shes par bya ba'i phyir rjes su dpag pa 'jug pa yin no zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: de ltar chos de dang ldan pa sgra la sogs pa'i chos can de'i rab tu grub phyir mi rtag pa'i rang bzhin shes par bya ba'i phyir rjes su dpag pa 'jug pa yin no zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: Thus, the subject, sound, etc., which possesses that property, is well established. Therefore, in order to make known the nature of impermanence, inference is applied. This is the remainder of the sentence.

original: de'i bdag nyid du rang bzhin ma lus par yongs su bcad ba can kha dog la sogs pa'i chos can mthong bas bzung ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid du rang bzhin ma lus par yongs su bcad ba can kha dog la sogs pa'i chos can mthong bas bzung ba ma yin nam /
translated: Is it not the case that the subject, such as color, which is completely determined as having that nature, is apprehended by seeing?

original: de ltar na de ma grub pa yin /üîΩgang gis na de de shes par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar na de ma grub pa yin / gang gis na de de shes par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Thus, it is not established.

original: rjes su dpag pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa yin zhe na /
translated: By what is inference for the sake of knowing that?

original: de ni de ltar yin te /
analyzed: de ni de ltar yin te /
translated: That is so.

original: rang bzhin ma lus pa phyogs gcig gis 'dzin pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rang bzhin ma lus pa phyogs gcig gis 'dzin pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: But it is not that the entire nature is apprehended by one part.

original: 'on kyang rnam pa thams cad du bzhin 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang rnam pa thams cad du bzhin 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: Rather, it is that all aspects are apprehended.

original: de la mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i khyad par tha dad pa'i rang bzhin can 'ba' zhig bzung du zin kyang /
analyzed: de la mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i khyad par tha dad pa'i rang bzhin can 'ba' zhig bzung du zin kyang /
translated: Even though only the nature that has the different aspects of impermanence, etc. is apprehended,

original: 'khrul pas de'i ngo bo chod pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir nges pa ma yin zhing ma nges pa las kyang de dag mthong bas ma bzung ba dang 'dra ba yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: 'khrul pas de'i ngo bo chod pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir nges pa ma yin zhing ma nges pa las kyang de dag mthong bas ma bzung ba dang 'dra ba yin pa de ltar na /
translated: it is not ascertained because it is mistaken and it is as if it were not apprehended because the nature is not ascertained.

original: de ni de dag la tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni de dag la tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: Thus, it is not a valid cognition in regard to that.

original: de ltar na gal te de la mthong ba skyes pa'i rnam pa de dag la dran pa'i nges pa skyed pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: de ltar na gal te de la mthong ba skyes pa'i rnam pa de dag la dran pa'i nges pa skyed pa de'i tshe /
translated: Thus, if the ascertainment of those aspects that arise from seeing that is generated by memory,

original: de la dran pa'i sgo nas 'jug pa'i phyir de tshad ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de la dran pa'i sgo nas 'jug pa'i phyir de tshad ma yin gyi /
translated: Because it engages its object through memory, it is a valid cognition.

original: rnam pa gzhan du ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not in any other way,

original: tshad ma ni 'jug pa'i 'bras bu can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma ni 'jug pa'i 'bras bu can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because a valid cognition is the result of engagement.

original: gal te thams cad las tha dad pa'i dngos po'i ngo bo la khyad par med par mthong ba skyes par gyur pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te thams cad las tha dad pa'i dngos po'i ngo bo la khyad par med par mthong ba skyes par gyur pa yin na /
translated: If a cognition arises that sees a thing that is different from everything else without any distinction,

original: ci'i phyir ji lta ba bzhin du nyams su myong pa'i rnam pa dag la nges pa @162b skyed par mi byed /
analyzed: ci'i phyir ji lta ba bzhin du nyams su myong pa'i rnam pa dag la nges pa @162b skyed par mi byed /
translated: why does it not generate certainty about the aspects that are experienced as they are?

original: gang gis na de dag gi rang bzhin ma grub pa nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis na de dag gi rang bzhin ma grub pa nyid yin zhe na /
translated: How could it be that their nature is not established?

original: de nyams su myong ba nyid kyi phyir nges pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyams su myong ba nyid kyi phyir nges pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not certainty because it experiences that.

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is it, then?

original: khyad par thams cad la cha med par nyams su myong ba skye ba na yang /
analyzed: khyad par thams cad la cha med par nyams su myong ba skye ba na yang /
translated: When it arises experiencing all distinctions without parts,

original: rnam pa gang dag la 'khrul pas mchod pa yod cing chod pa med na yang rnam pa gang kho na goms pa la sogs pa'i nges pa'i rgyu mtshan yod pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa gang dag la 'khrul pas mchod pa yod cing chod pa med na yang rnam pa gang kho na goms pa la sogs pa'i nges pa'i rgyu mtshan yod pa yin te /
translated: If there is no error in any aspect, and if there is no doubt, then there is a definite reason for the cultivation of any aspect whatsoever.

original: de nyid kho na la shin tu dang ches shin tu nye bas nges par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid kho na la shin tu dang ches shin tu nye bas nges par 'gyur ro //
translated: And it is just that which is ascertained by the closest and most intimate contact.

original: des ni mthong ba skyes pa la yang gang dang gang la nges pa de nyid tha snyad du rung ba bzung ba yin no zhes rnam par gzhag pa yin gyi /
analyzed: des ni mthong ba skyes pa la yang gang dang gang la nges pa de nyid tha snyad du rung ba bzung ba yin no zhes rnam par gzhag pa yin gyi /
translated: This is the presentation of the fact that even when seeing has arisen, that which is ascertained in any case is accepted as conventionally suitable.

original: gzhan ma yin pa de ltar na kha na ma thob ba med do //
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa de ltar na kha na ma thob ba med do //
translated: There is no fault in that.

original: gang gis yang mngon sum rang nyid nges pa'i bdag nyid kho na yin pa de nyid kyi skyon 'di yin no //
analyzed: gang gis yang mngon sum rang nyid nges pa'i bdag nyid kho na yin pa de nyid kyi skyon 'di yin no //
translated: But if perception itself has the nature of ascertainment, then this is the fault.

original: de ltar na nges pa rnams kyis rang gi don rtogs pa gang yin pa 'di nyid ni don de'i nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na nges pa rnams kyis rang gi don rtogs pa gang yin pa 'di nyid ni don de'i nges pa yin no //
translated: Thus, that which is understood by oneself through ascertainment is just the ascertainment of that object.

original: des na tha dad pa'i khyad par gcig gi sgo nas kyang /
analyzed: des na tha dad pa'i khyad par gcig gi sgo nas kyang /
translated: Therefore, even by means of a single distinct characteristic,

original: sna tshogs pa'i bdag nyid du de las gzhan pa la phan 'dogs par byed pa ma lus pa'i rang bzhin can gyi dngos po bzung ba na /
analyzed: sna tshogs pa'i bdag nyid du de las gzhan pa la phan 'dogs par byed pa ma lus pa'i rang bzhin can gyi dngos po bzung ba na /
translated: When a thing is apprehended that has the nature of being helpful to something else that is different from it, and that has the nature of being a composite of various things,

original: de'i nges par yongs su ma bcad pa'i rang bzhin can mi rung ba'i phyir /üîΩtshad ma gzhan 'jug par mi 'gyur ba de ltar na /
analyzed: de'i nges par yongs su ma bcad pa'i rang bzhin can mi rung ba'i phyir / tshad ma gzhan 'jug par mi 'gyur ba de ltar na /
translated: then it is not possible for it to have the nature of being unapprehended.

original: mngon sum nges pa'i bdag nyid can ma yin pa 'dod par bya'o //
analyzed: mngon sum nges pa'i bdag nyid can ma yin pa 'dod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, if a valid cognition does not engage in the apprehension of a thing, then it must be accepted that it does not have the nature of a direct perception.

original: de bas na bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du rgyu mtshan yod par sgro 'dogs pa rnam par gcod pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa 'jug pa yin no zhes bya ba de rgyas par gong du bstan zin to //
analyzed: de bas na bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du rgyu mtshan yod par sgro 'dogs pa rnam par gcod pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa 'jug pa yin no zhes bya ba de rgyas par gong du bstan zin to //
translated: Thus, we have already explained at length how inference engages in order to eliminate superimpositions that are not in accordance with the way things are.

original: de'i phyir gang zhig la lar yongs su mi shes te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang zhig la lar yongs su mi shes te /
translated: Therefore, when something is not fully understood,

original: rgyud rgyun mi 'chad pa'i dus na /
analyzed: rgyud rgyun mi 'chad pa'i dus na /
translated: at the time when the continuum of the mind is not interrupted,

original: mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can gyi dngos po gang yin pa de 'khrul phyir te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can gyi dngos po gang yin pa de 'khrul phyir te /
translated: it is because of confusion about the thing that has the nature of impermanence, etc.

original: rgyu'i phyir skad cig ma rnams kyi tha dad ma mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: rgyu'i phyir skad cig ma rnams kyi tha dad ma mthong ba yin no //
translated: The difference between the moments is not perceived because of the cause.

original: nges par ma byas pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: nges par ma byas pa nyid yin no //
translated: It is not ascertained.

original: ci dang 'dra bar zhe na sgong gi tha dad bzhin /
analyzed: ci dang 'dra bar zhe na sgong gi tha dad bzhin /
translated: In what way? Like the difference between two eggs.

original: ji ltar sgong gnyis tha dad par mthong du zin kyang shin tu myur ba la sogs pa'i 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis lta ba po tha dad pa med par zhen pas sgong de gnyis yin no zhes nges pa de dang 'dra bar ro //
analyzed: ji ltar sgong gnyis tha dad par mthong du zin kyang shin tu myur ba la sogs pa'i 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis lta ba po tha dad pa med par zhen pas sgong de gnyis yin no zhes nges pa de dang 'dra bar ro //
translated: Even though the difference between two eggs is perceived, the seer is attached to the non-difference because of the cause of error, such as the speed of the movement.

original: rgyu gang las 'khrul pa yang yin zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu gang las 'khrul pa yang yin zhe na /
translated: From what cause is there error?

original: 'dra ba gzhan ni yod phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dra ba gzhan ni yod phyir ro //
translated: Because another similar one exists.

original: dngos po @163a * //
analyzed: dngos po @163a * //
translated: The thingüîΩthat is momentary and perishes is perceived as different, but the difference in parts is not seen because of the arising of another similar one.

original: skad cig mar 'jig pa can tha dad par dmigs pa dag la yang cha tha dad par ma mthong ba ni 'dra ba gzhan 'byung bas 'khrul pa de nyid 'di yin no zhes zhen pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skad cig mar 'jig pa can tha dad par dmigs pa dag la yang cha tha dad par ma mthong ba ni 'dra ba gzhan 'byung bas 'khrul pa de nyid 'di yin no zhes zhen pa'i phyir /
translated: It is error. It is attached to that as this.

original: mi rtag pa bzung du zin kyang ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: mi rtag pa bzung du zin kyang ma nges pa yin no //
translated: Even though impermanence is grasped, it is not ascertained.

original: de gang las she na /
analyzed: de gang las she na /
translated: From what?
